Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that interacts with an Ollama API to generate responses using HTTP requests through the Guzzle HTTP client.

Class Description: The Ollama class is designed to communicate with an Ollama API endpoint to generate responses based on provided prompts. It handles the configuration of the API request and processes the response.

Attributes:
- model: string - The name of the AI model to be used for generating responses.
- prompt: string - The input text prompt to be sent to the AI model.
- temperature: float - Controls the randomness of the output (higher values make output more random).
- stream: bool - Determines whether the response should be streamed.
- raw: bool - Specifies whether to use raw mode for the prompt processing.

Methods:
- __construct(string $model, string $prompt, float $temperature, bool $stream, bool $raw) -> void - Initializes the Ollama instance with the specified parameters for model interaction.
- ask() -> string - Sends a POST request to the Ollama API with the configured parameters and returns the generated response from the AI model.
unmatched_results:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;

class Ollama {
    private $model;
    private $prompt;
    private $temperature;
    private $stream;
    private $raw;
    private $client;

    public function __construct(string $model, string $prompt, float $temperature, bool $stream, bool $raw) {
        $this->model = $model;
        $this->prompt = $prompt;
        $this->temperature = $temperature;
        $this->stream = $stream;
        $this->raw = $raw;
        $this->client = new Client();
    }

    public function ask(): string {
        $response = $this->client->post('https://api.ollama.com/v1/generate', [
            'json' => [
                'model' => $this->model,
                'prompt' => $this->prompt,
                'temperature' => $this->temperature,
                'stream' => $this->stream,
                'raw' => $this->raw
            ]
        ]);

        $body = $response->getBody();
        $data = json_decode($body, true);

        return $data['response'] ?? '';
    }
}

<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class Ollama
{
    private $model;
    private $prompt;
    private $temperature;
    private $stream;
    private $raw;
    private $client;

    public function __construct(string $model, string $prompt, float $temperature, bool $stream, bool $raw)
    {
        $this->model = $model;
        $this->prompt = $prompt;
        $this->temperature = $temperature;
        $this->stream = $stream;
        $this->raw = $raw;
        $this->client = new Client();
    }

    public function ask(): string
    {
        $url = 'https://api.ollama.com/generate';
        $options = [
            'json' => [
                'model' => $this->model,
                'prompt' => $this->prompt,
                'temperature' => $this->temperature,
                'stream' => $this->stream,
                'raw' => $this->raw
            ]
        ];

        try {
            $response = $this->client->post($url, $options);
            $body = $response->getBody();
            $data = json_decode($body, true);
            return $data['response'] ?? 'No response';
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return 'Error: ' . $e->getMessage();
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client for sending payment requests to an e-payment API using Guzzle.

Class Description: The EpayHttpClient class is designed to handle HTTP communication with an e-payment API. It encapsulates the functionality for sending payment requests and processing the responses. The class uses Guzzle HTTP client for making requests and handles potential exceptions that may occur during the process.

Attributes:
- epay: array - Stores the configuration for the e-payment API
- client: Client - The Guzzle HTTP client instance used for making requests

Methods:
- __construct(array $epayConfig) -> void - Initializes the class with e-payment configuration and creates a new Guzzle Client instance
- sendPaymentRequest(array $data) -> array - Sends a payment request to the API endpoint and processes the response. Returns an array indicating success/failure and containing either the payment URL or an error message
matched_results:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class EpayHttpClient
{
    private $epay;
    private $client;

    public function __construct(array $epayConfig)
    {
        $this->epay = $epayConfig;
        $this->client = new Client([
            'base_uri' => $this->epay['base_uri'],
            'timeout'  => 2.0,
        ]);
    }

    public function sendPaymentRequest(array $data): array
    {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->request('POST', $this->epay['endpoint'], [
                'json' => $data,
                'headers' => [
                    'Authorization' => 'Bearer ' . $this->epay['api_key'],
                    'Accept'        => 'application/json',
                ],
            ]);

            $responseData = json_decode($response->getBody()->getContents(), true);

            if (isset($responseData['payment_url'])) {
                return [
                    'success' => true,
                    'payment_url' => $responseData['payment_url'],
                ];
            } else {
                return [
                    'success' => false,
                    'error' => 'Payment URL not found in response.',
                ];
            }
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return [
                'success' => false,
                'error' => $e->getMessage(),
            ];
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles downloading and processing images with size limitations and compression capabilities.

Class Description: The Picture class is designed to download images from given URLs while enforcing size limits and compression thresholds. It uses cURL for HTTP requests and provides mechanisms to control download size and handle response data efficiently.

Attributes:
- compressLimit: [int] - The maximum size (in bytes) for downloaded content before compression is considered
- sizeLimit: [int] - The maximum dimension (in pixels) for the image width/height

Methods:
- downloadImage: [downloadImage]($url: string) -> string - Downloads an image from the specified URL while respecting size limits. Returns the image body content.
  - $url: The URL of the image to download
  - Returns: The binary content of the downloaded image
matched_results:
<?php

class Picture {
    private $compressLimit;
    private $sizeLimit;

    public function __construct($compressLimit, $sizeLimit) {
        $this->compressLimit = $compressLimit;
        $this->sizeLimit = $sizeLimit;
    }

    public function downloadImage($url) {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);

class Picture {
    private $compressLimit;
    private $sizeLimit;

    public function __construct($compressLimit, $sizeLimit) {
        $this->compressLimit = $compressLimit;
        $this->sizeLimit = $sizeLimit;
    }

    public function downloadImage($url) {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 5);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'Mozilla/5.0');

        $imageData = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $contentType = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_CONTENT_TYPE);
        $contentLength = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_CONTENT_LENGTH_DOWNLOAD);

        curl_close($ch);

        if ($httpCode !== 200 || strpos($contentType, 'image') === false) {
            throw new Exception('Failed to download image or invalid content type.');
        }

        if ($contentLength > $this->compressLimit) {
            $imageData = $this->compressImage($imageData);
        }

        $image = imagecreatefromstring($imageData);
        if ($image === false) {
            throw new Exception('Failed to create image from downloaded data.');
        }

        $width = imagesx($image);
        $height = imagesy($image);

        if ($width > $this->sizeLimit || $height > $this->sizeLimit) {
            $imageData = $this->resizeImage($image, $width, $height);
        }

        imagedestroy($image);

        return $imageData;
    }

    private function compressImage($imageData) {
        $image = imagecreatefromstring($imageData);
        ob_start();
        imagejpeg($image, null, 75);
        $compressedData = ob_get_contents();
        ob_end_clean();
        imagedestroy($image);
        return $compressedData;
    }

    private function resizeImage($image, $width, $height) {
        $ratio = min($this->sizeLimit / $width, $this->sizeLimit / $height);
        $newWidth = $width * $ratio;
        $newHeight = $height * $ratio;

        $newImage = imagecreatetruecolor($newWidth, $newHeight);
        imagecopyresampled($newImage, $image, 0, 0, 0, 0, $newWidth, $newHeight, $width, $height);

        ob_start();
        imagejpeg($newImage, null, 75);
        $resizedData = ob_get_contents();
        ob_end_clean();
        imagedestroy($newImage);

        return $resizedData;
    }
}

class Picture {

    private $sizeLimit;

    public function __construct($compressLimit, $sizeLimit) {
        $this->compressLimit = $compressLimit;
        $this->sizeLimit = $sizeLimit;
    }

    public function downloadImage($url) {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 10);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_BINARYTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_BUFFERSIZE, 128000);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $header_size = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
        $header = substr($response, 0, $header_size);
        $body = substr($response, $header_size);

        $content_length = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_CONTENT_LENGTH_DOWNLOAD);
        if ($content_length > $this->compressLimit) {
            $body = $this->compressImage($body);
        }

        curl_close($ch);

        if ($this->exceedsSizeLimit($body)) {
            $body = $this->resizeImage($body);
        }

        return $body;
    }

    private function compressImage($imageData) {
        $image = imagecreatefromstring($imageData);
        ob_start();
        imagejpeg($image, null, 75);
        $compressedImage = ob_get_contents();
        ob_end_clean();
        imagedestroy($image);
        return $compressedImage;
    }

    private function exceedsSizeLimit($imageData) {
        $image = imagecreatefromstring($imageData);
        $width = imagesx($image);
        $height = imagesy($image);
        imagedestroy($image);
        return $width > $this->sizeLimit || $height > $this->sizeLimit;
    }

    private function resizeImage($imageData) {
        $image = imagecreatefromstring($imageData);
        $width = imagesx($image);
        $height = imagesy($image);

        $newWidth = $this->sizeLimit;
        $newHeight = ($height / $width) * $newWidth;

        if ($newHeight > $this->sizeLimit) {
            $newHeight = $this->sizeLimit;
            $newWidth = ($width / $height) * $newHeight;
        }

        $newImage = imagecreatetruecolor($newWidth, $newHeight);
        imagecopyresampled($newImage, $image, 0, 0, 0, 0, $newWidth, $newHeight, $width, $height);

        ob_start();
        imagejpeg($newImage, null, 75);
        $resizedImage = ob_get_contents();
        ob_end_clean();

        imagedestroy($image);
        imagedestroy($newImage);

        return $resizedImage;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified HTTP URL using fsockopen for low-level HTTP communication, with support for proxies and basic authentication.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy), sends an HTTP GET request, reads the response, and returns the response body. It handles URL parsing, proxy configuration, timeout settings, and basic authentication. The function can either return the content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string, required) The HTTP URL to fetch
  - 'assign': (string, optional) Template variable name to assign content to
  - 'proxy_host': (string, optional) Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (int, optional) Proxy server port
  - 'timeout': (int, optional) Connection timeout in seconds (default: 30)
- $template: (object) The template object for assigning content (when 'assign' parameter is used)

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if 'assign' parameter is not provided
- Assigns content to the specified template variable and returns nothing if 'assign' parameter is provided
- Returns nothing and triggers notice on error conditions (invalid URL, connection failure)
matched_results:
<?php
function fetch_http_content($params, $template = null) {
    $url = isset($params['file']) ? $params['file'] : null;
    if (!$url) {
        trigger_error("URL is required", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $parsed_url = parse_url($url);
    if (!$parsed_url || !isset($parsed_url['host'])) {
        trigger_error("Invalid URL", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $host = $parsed_url['host'];
    $port = isset($parsed_url['port']) ? $parsed_url['port'] : 80;
    $path = isset($parsed_url['path']) ? $parsed_url['path'] : '/';
    $path .= isset($parsed_url['query']) ? '?' . $parsed_url['query'] : '';
    $timeout = isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 30;

    $proxy_host = isset($params['proxy_host']) ? $params['proxy_host'] : null;
    $proxy_port = isset($params['proxy_port']) ? $params['proxy_port'] : null;

    $fp = null;
    if ($proxy_host && $proxy_port) {
        $fp = fsockopen($proxy_host, $proxy_port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
        $request = "GET $url HTTP/1.0\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    } else {
        $fp = fsockopen($host, $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
        $request = "GET $path HTTP/1.0\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    }

    if (!$fp) {
        trigger_error("Connection failed: $errstr ($errno)", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    if (isset($parsed_url['user']) && isset($parsed_url['pass'])) {
        $auth = base64_encode($parsed_url['user'] . ':' . $parsed_url['pass']);
        $request .= "Authorization: Basic $auth\r\n";
    }

    $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
    fwrite($fp, $request);

    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 128);
    }
    fclose($fp);

    $header_end = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    if ($header_end === false) {
        trigger_error("Invalid response from server", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $body = substr($response, $header_end + 4);

    if (isset($params['assign']) && $template) {
        $template->assign($params['assign'], $body);
    } else {
        return $body;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified URL or file path, with support for HTTP requests using fsockopen, including handling of proxy servers, authentication, and security checks.

Function Description: The function retrieves content from either a local file or a remote HTTP resource. For HTTP requests, it establishes a socket connection, sends a GET request with appropriate headers (including authentication if provided), reads the response, and extracts the content body. It includes security checks for trusted URIs and resource directories when operating within a Smarty template context.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string) Required. The URL or file path to fetch
  - 'assign': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign the content to
  - 'assign_headers': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign headers to
  - 'user': (string) Optional. Username for HTTP authentication
  - 'pass': (string) Optional. Password for HTTP authentication
  - 'proxy_host': (string) Optional. Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (integer) Optional. Proxy server port
- $template: The Smarty template object (used for security checks and variable assignment)

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if no 'assign' parameter is provided
- Assigns the content to the specified template variable if 'assign' parameter is present
- Returns nothing if security checks fail or if there are errors in fetching the content

<?php
function fetch_content($params, $template) {
    $file = isset($params['file']) ? $params['file'] : null;
    $assign = isset($params['assign']) ? $params['assign'] : null;
    $assign_headers = isset($params['assign_headers']) ? $params['assign_headers'] : null;
    $user = isset($params['user']) ? $params['user'] : null;
    $pass = isset($params['pass']) ? $params['pass'] : null;
    $proxy_host = isset($params['proxy_host']) ? $params['proxy_host'] : null;
    $proxy_port = isset($params['proxy_port']) ? $params['proxy_port'] : null;

    if (!$file) {
        return;
    }

    $content = '';
    $headers = [];

    if (filter_var($file, FILTER_VALIDATE_URL)) {
        $url_parts = parse_url($file);
        $host = $url_parts['host'];
        $path = isset($url_parts['path']) ? $url_parts['path'] : '/';
        $path .= isset($url_parts['query']) ? '?' . $url_parts['query'] : '';
        $port = isset($url_parts['port']) ? $url_parts['port'] : 80;

        $fp = fsockopen($proxy_host ? $proxy_host : $host, $proxy_host ? $proxy_port : $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);
        if (!$fp) {
            return;
        }

        $auth = '';
        if ($user && $pass) {
            $auth = "Authorization: Basic " . base64_encode("$user:$pass") . "\r\n";
        }

        $out = "GET $path HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $out .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        $out .= $auth;
        $out .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";

        fwrite($fp, $out);
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $line = fgets($fp, 128);
            if (trim($line) == '') {
                break;
            }
            $headers[] = $line;
        }
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $content .= fgets($fp, 128);
        }
        fclose($fp);
    } else {
        if (!is_readable($file)) {
            return;
        }
        $content = file_get_contents($file);
    }

    if ($assign) {
        $template->assign($assign, $content);
    } else {
        return $content;
    }

    if ($assign_headers) {
        $template->assign($assign_headers, $headers);
    }
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP class for handling trackback requests using low-level HTTP socket communication.

Class Description: The CI_Trackback class provides functionality to send and process trackback pings to remote servers. It handles HTTP communication directly using fsockopen, processes responses, and manages errors.

Attributes:
- charset: string - Character encoding to use (default: 'UTF-8')
- data: array - Trackback data including url, title, excerpt, blog_name, and charset
- convert_ascii: bool - Whether to convert non-ASCII characters (default: TRUE)
- response: string - Raw HTTP response from the trackback server
- error_msg: array - Collection of error messages encountered during processing

Methods:
- process(string $url, string $data) -> bool - Sends a trackback ping to the specified URL with the given data. Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.
  Input: 
    $url: string - Target URL for the trackback
    $data: string - URL-encoded trackback data
  Output: bool - Success status

- get_id(string $url) -> mixed - Extracts a numeric ID from the given URL. Returns the ID as string or FALSE if not found.
  Input: $url: string - URL to parse for an ID
  Output: mixed - Extracted ID string or FALSE

- set_error(string $msg) -> void - Adds an error message to the error collection.
  Input: $msg: string - Error message to store
  Output: void
matched_results:
<?php

class CI_Trackback {
    public $charset = 'UTF-8';
    public $data = [];
    public $convert_ascii = true;
    public $response = '';
    public $error_msg = [];

    public function process($url, $data) {
        $url_info = parse_url($url);
        if (!isset($url_info['host'])) {
            $this->set_error('Invalid URL');
            return false;
        }

        $path = isset($url_info['path']) ? $url_info['path'] : '/';
        $path .= isset($url_info['query']) ? '?' . $url_info['query'] : '';
        $port = isset($url_info['port']) ? $url_info['port'] : 80;

        $fp = fsockopen($url_info['host'], $port, $errno, $errstr, 5);
        if (!$fp) {
            $this->set_error("Connection failed: $errstr ($errno)");
            return false;
        }

        $request = "POST $path HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: " . $url_info['host'] . "\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($data) . "\r\n";
        $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
        $request .= $data;

        fwrite($fp, $request);

        $this->response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $this->response .= fgets($fp, 128);
        }
        fclose($fp);

        if (strpos($this->response, '200 OK') === false) {
            $this->set_error('Invalid response from server');
            return false;
        }

        return true;
    }

    public function get_id($url) {
        if (preg_match('/\d+/', $url, $matches)) {
            return $matches[0];
        }
        return false;
    }

    public function set_error($msg) {
        $this->error_msg[] = $msg;
    }
}

Task Description: Implement a class that handles HTTP POST requests to Google's reCAPTCHA verification service using low-level socket operations in PHP.

Class Description: ReCaptchaSocketPostRequestMethod is a class that implements reCAPTCHA verification by establishing a direct socket connection to Google's servers, sending an HTTP POST request, and processing the response. It provides an alternative to higher-level HTTP clients.

Attributes:
- socket: [ReCaptchaSocket] - The socket connection handler used for HTTP communication
- RECAPTCHA_HOST: [string] - Constant storing Google's reCAPTCHA hostname ('www.google.com')
- SITE_VERIFY_PATH: [string] - Constant storing the reCAPTCHA verification endpoint path ('/recaptcha/api/siteverify')
- BAD_REQUEST: [string] - Constant JSON response for failed requests
- BAD_RESPONSE: [string] - Constant JSON response for invalid server responses

Methods:
- __construct([ReCaptchaSocket $socket = null]) -> [void] - Initializes the class with an optional socket dependency injection
- submit(ReCaptchaRequestParameters $params) -> [string] - Performs the reCAPTCHA verification by:
  1. Opening an SSL socket connection to Google's server
  2. Formatting and sending an HTTP POST request with verification parameters
  3. Reading and parsing the server response
  4. Returning the verification result as JSON string
  Returns either the server response or error JSON if the request/response fails

<?php

class ReCaptchaSocketPostRequestMethod {
    private $socket;
    const RECAPTCHA_HOST = 'www.google.com';
    const SITE_VERIFY_PATH = '/recaptcha/api/siteverify';
    const BAD_REQUEST = '{"success": false, "error-codes": ["bad-request"]}';
    const BAD_RESPONSE = '{"success": false, "error-codes": ["bad-response"]}';

    public function __construct($socket = null) {
        $this->socket = $socket ?: new ReCaptchaSocket();
    }

    public function submit($params) {
        $host = self::RECAPTCHA_HOST;
        $path = self::SITE_VERIFY_PATH;
        $data = http_build_query([
            'secret' => $params->getSecret(),
            'response' => $params->getResponse(),
            'remoteip' => $params->getRemoteIp()
        ]);

        $request = "POST $path HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($data) . "\r\n";
        $request .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";
        $request .= $data;

        $fp = $this->socket->open("ssl://$host", 443);
        if (!$fp) {
            return self::BAD_REQUEST;
        }

        fwrite($fp, $request);
        $response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $response .= fgets($fp, 1024);
        }
        fclose($fp);

        $responseParts = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        if (count($responseParts) < 2) {
            return self::BAD_RESPONSE;
        }

        return $responseParts[1];
    }
}

class ReCaptchaSocket {
    public function open($hostname, $port) {
        return fsockopen($hostname, $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);
    }
}

class ReCaptchaRequestParameters {
    private $secret;
    private $response;
    private $remoteIp;

    public function __construct($secret, $response, $remoteIp) {
        $this->secret = $secret;
        $this->response = $response;
        $this->remoteIp = $remoteIp;
    }

    public function getSecret() {
        return $this->secret;
    }

    public function getResponse() {
        return $this->response;
    }

    public function getRemoteIp() {
        return $this->remoteIp;
    }
}

    const BAD_RESPONSE = '{"success": false, "error-codes": ["bad-response"]}';

    public function __construct($socket = null) {
        $this->socket = $socket ?: new ReCaptchaSocket();
    }

    public function submit($params) {
        $host = self::RECAPTCHA_HOST;
        $path = self::SITE_VERIFY_PATH;
        $data = http_build_query([
            'secret' => $params->secret,
            'response' => $params->response,
            'remoteip' => $params->remoteip
        ]);

        $request = "POST $path HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($data) . "\r\n";
        $request .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";
        $request .= $data;

        $socket = $this->socket->connect($host, 443);
        if (!$socket) {
            return self::BAD_REQUEST;
        }

        $this->socket->write($socket, $request);
        $response = $this->socket->read($socket);
        $this->socket->close($socket);

        if (!$response) {
            return self::BAD_RESPONSE;
        }

        $responseParts = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        if (count($responseParts) < 2) {
            return self::BAD_RESPONSE;
        }

        return $responseParts[1];
    }

    public function read($socket) {

        while (!feof($socket)) {

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class for handling HTTP/HTTPS communications using either socket-based connections (via fsockopen) or cURL, supporting both standard and persistent connections, with proper header and cookie management.

Class Description: The soap_transport_http class provides low-level HTTP transport capabilities for SOAP communications, supporting both socket and cURL implementations. It handles connection management, request/response processing, and error handling.

Attributes:
- url: string - The target URL for HTTP requests
- uri: string - The URI portion of the URL
- scheme: string - The protocol scheme (http/https)
- host: string - The target hostname
- port: string - The target port number
- path: string - The path portion of the URL
- request_method: string - HTTP method (default: POST)
- protocol_version: string - HTTP version (default: 1.0)
- outgoing_headers: array - Headers to be sent with the request
- incoming_headers: array - Headers received in the response
- outgoing_payload: string - Data to be sent in the request
- incoming_payload: string - Data received in the response
- persistentConnection: bool - Flag for persistent connections
- use_curl: bool - Flag to use cURL instead of sockets
- proxy: array|null - Proxy configuration if used

Methods:
- __construct(string $url, array $curl_options=null, bool $use_curl=false) -> void - Initializes the transport with target URL and options
- connect(int $connection_timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30) -> bool - Establishes connection to server
- send(string $data, int $timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30, array $cookies=null) -> mixed - Sends data and returns response
- sendRequest(string $data, array $cookies=null) -> bool - Sends the HTTP request with headers
- getResponse() -> string|bool - Reads and processes the server response
- setHeader(string $name, string $value) -> void - Adds a header to outgoing request
- setCurlOption(mixed $option, mixed $value) -> void - Sets cURL option when using cURL
- parseCookie(string $cookie_str) -> array|bool - Parses Set-Cookie header into array

<?php

class soap_transport_http {
    private $url;
    private $uri;
    private $scheme;
    private $host;
    private $port;
    private $path;
    private $request_method = 'POST';
    private $protocol_version = '1.0';
    private $outgoing_headers = [];
    private $incoming_headers = [];
    private $outgoing_payload;
    private $incoming_payload;
    private $persistentConnection = false;
    private $use_curl = false;
    private $proxy = null;
    private $curl_options = [];

    public function __construct($url, $curl_options = null, $use_curl = false) {
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->use_curl = $use_curl;
        if ($curl_options) {
            $this->curl_options = $curl_options;
        }
        $this->parseUrl($url);
    }

    private function parseUrl($url) {
        $parts = parse_url($url);
        $this->scheme = $parts['scheme'];
        $this->host = $parts['host'];
        $this->port = isset($parts['port']) ? $parts['port'] : ($this->scheme == 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $this->path = isset($parts['path']) ? $parts['path'] : '/';
        $this->uri = $this->scheme . '://' . $this->host . ($this->port ? ':' . $this->port : '') . $this->path;
    }

    public function connect($connection_timeout = 0, $response_timeout = 30) {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            return true;
        }
        $errno = 0;
        $errstr = '';
        $socket = fsockopen(($this->scheme == 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $this->host, $this->port, $errno, $errstr, $connection_timeout);
        if (!$socket) {
            return false;
        }
        stream_set_timeout($socket, $response_timeout);
        $this->socket = $socket;
        return true;
    }

    public function send($data, $timeout = 0, $response_timeout = 30, $cookies = null) {
        $this->outgoing_payload = $data;
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            return $this->sendCurlRequest($data, $cookies);
        }
        if (!$this->connect($timeout, $response_timeout)) {
            return false;
        }
        $this->sendRequest($data, $cookies);
        return $this->getResponse();
    }

    private function sendCurlRequest($data, $cookies) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $this->url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $this->formatHeaders($cookies));
        foreach ($this->curl_options as $option => $value) {
            curl_setopt($ch, $option, $value);
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $this->incoming_payload = $response;
        $this->incoming_headers = curl_getinfo($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    private function formatHeaders($cookies) {
        $headers = [];
        foreach ($this->outgoing_headers as $name => $value) {
            $headers[] = "$name: $value";
        }
        if ($cookies) {
            $cookie_str = '';
            foreach ($cookies as $name => $value) {
                $cookie_str .= "$name=$value; ";
            }
            $headers[] = "Cookie: $cookie_str";
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    public function sendRequest($data, $cookies = null) {
        $headers = $this->formatHeaders($cookies);
        $request = $this->request_method . " " . $this->path . " HTTP/" . $this->protocol_version . "\r\n";
        foreach ($headers as $header) {
            $request .= $header . "\r\n";
        }
        $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($data) . "\r\n\r\n";
        $request .= $data;
        fwrite($this->socket, $request);
    }

    public function getResponse() {
        $response = '';
        while (!feof($this->socket)) {
            $response .= fgets($this->socket, 4096);
        }
        fclose($this->socket);
        $this->incoming_payload = $response;
        list($header, $body) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        $this->incoming_headers = $this->parseHeaders($header);
        return $body;
    }

    private function parseHeaders($header_str) {
        $headers = [];
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $header_str);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                list($name, $value) = explode(': ', $line, 2);
                $headers[$name] = $value;
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    public function setHeader($name, $value) {
        $this->outgoing_headers[$name] = $value;
    }

    public function setCurlOption($option, $value) {
        $this->curl_options[$option] = $value;
    }

    public function parseCookie($cookie_str) {
        $cookies = [];
        $parts = explode('; ', $cookie_str);
        foreach ($parts as $part) {
            list($name, $value) = explode('=', $part, 2);
            $cookies[$name] = $value;
        }
        return $cookies;
    }
}

<?php

class soap_transport_http {
    private $url;
    private $uri;
    private $scheme;
    private $host;
    private $port;
    private $path;
    private $request_method = 'POST';
    private $protocol_version = '1.0';
    private $outgoing_headers = [];
    private $incoming_headers = [];
    private $outgoing_payload;
    private $incoming_payload;
    private $persistentConnection = false;
    private $use_curl = false;
    private $proxy = null;
    private $curl_options = [];

    public function __construct($url, $curl_options = null, $use_curl = false) {
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->use_curl = $use_curl;
        if ($curl_options) {
            $this->curl_options = $curl_options;
        }
        $this->parseUrl($url);
    }

    private function parseUrl($url) {
        $parts = parse_url($url);
        $this->scheme = $parts['scheme'];
        $this->host = $parts['host'];
        $this->port = isset($parts['port']) ? $parts['port'] : ($this->scheme == 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $this->path = isset($parts['path']) ? $parts['path'] : '/';
        $this->uri = $this->scheme . '://' . $this->host . ($this->port ? ':' . $this->port : '') . $this->path;
    }

    public function connect($connection_timeout = 0, $response_timeout = 30) {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            return true;
        } else {
            $errno = 0;
            $errstr = '';
            $fp = fsockopen($this->scheme == 'https' ? 'ssl://' . $this->host : $this->host, $this->port, $errno, $errstr, $connection_timeout);
            if (!$fp) {
                return false;
            }
            stream_set_timeout($fp, $response_timeout);
            $this->fp = $fp;
            return true;
        }
    }

    public function send($data, $timeout = 0, $response_timeout = 30, $cookies = null) {
        $this->outgoing_payload = $data;
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            return $this->sendCurl($data, $timeout, $response_timeout, $cookies);
        } else {
            return $this->sendSocket($data, $timeout, $response_timeout, $cookies);
        }
    }

    private function sendCurl($data, $timeout, $response_timeout, $cookies) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $this->url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $response_timeout);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
        if ($cookies) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_COOKIE, implode('; ', $cookies));
        }
        foreach ($this->curl_options as $option => $value) {
            curl_setopt($ch, $option, $value);
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $this->incoming_payload = $response;
        $this->incoming_headers = curl_getinfo($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    private function sendSocket($data, $timeout, $response_timeout, $cookies) {
        $this->sendRequest($data, $cookies);
        return $this->getResponse();
    }

    public function sendRequest($data, $cookies = null) {
        $headers = "POST " . $this->path . " HTTP/" . $this->protocol_version . "\r\n";
        $headers .= "Host: " . $this->host . "\r\n";
        foreach ($this->outgoing_headers as $name => $value) {
            $headers .= $name . ": " . $value . "\r\n";
        }
        if ($cookies) {
            $headers .= "Cookie: " . implode('; ', $cookies) . "\r\n";
        }
        $headers .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($data) . "\r\n";

        $this->path = isset($parts['path']) ? $parts['path'] : '/';
        $this->uri = $this->path . (isset($parts['query']) ? '?' . $parts['query'] : '');
    }

        if ($this->use_curl) {

        }
        $host = ($this->scheme == 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $this->host;

        } else {

                return false;
            }
            $this->sendRequest($data, $cookies);
            return $this->getResponse();
        }

        }

        $this->scheme = $parts['scheme'];

        $this->uri = $this->path . (isset($parts['query']) ? '?' . $parts['query'] : '');

        if ($this->use_curl) {
            return true;
        }
        $host = $this->host;
        if ($this->scheme == 'https') {
            $host = 'ssl://' . $host;
        }
        $this->fp = fsockopen($host, $this->port, $errno, $errstr, $connection_timeout);
        if (!$this->fp) {
            return false;
        }
        stream_set_timeout($this->fp, $response_timeout);
        return true;
    }

    public function send(string $data, int $timeout = 0, int $response_timeout = 30, array $cookies = null) {
        $this->outgoing_payload = $data;
        if (!$this->connect($timeout, $response_timeout)) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!$this->sendRequest($data, $cookies)) {
            return false;
        }
        return $this->getResponse();
    }

        $headers = $this->outgoing_headers;
        $headers['Content-Length'] = strlen($data);
        if ($cookies) {
            $headers['Cookie'] = implode('; ', array_map(function ($k, $v) {
                return "$k=$v";
            }, array_keys($cookies), $cookies));
        }
        $request = "{$this->request_method} {$this->uri} HTTP/{$this->protocol_version}\r\n";
        foreach ($headers as $key => $value) {

            $ch = curl_init();

            return true;
        }
    }

        if ($this->use_curl) {
            return $this->incoming_payload;
        }
        $response = '';
        while (!feof($this->fp)) {
            $response .= fgets($this->fp, 128);
        }

        list($header, $body) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        $this->incoming_headers = $this->parseHeaders($header);
        $this->incoming_payload = $body;
        return $body;
    }

    private function parseHeaders($header) {
        $headers = [];
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $header);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                list($key, $value) = explode(': ', $line, 2);
                $headers[$key] = $value;
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

        $this->outgoing_headers[$name] = $value;
    }

    public function setCurlOption($option, $value) {
        $this->curl_options[$option] = $value;
    }

    public function parseCookie(string $cookie_str) {
        $cookies = [];
        $parts = explode(';', $cookie_str);
        foreach ($parts as $part) {
            list($key, $value) = explode('=', trim($part), 2);
            $cookies[$key] = $value;
        }

        while (!feof($this->fp)) {
            $response .= fgets($this->fp, 128);
        }
        list($header, $body) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        $this->incoming_headers = $this->parseHeaders($header);
        $this->incoming_payload = $body;
        return $this->incoming_payload;
    }

    private function parseHeaders($header) {
        $headers = [];
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $header);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                list($key, $value) = explode(': ', $line, 2);
                $headers[$key] = $value;
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    public function setHeader(string $name, string $value) {
        $this->outgoing_headers[] = "$name: $value";
    }

    public function setCurlOption($option, $value) {
        $this->curl_options[$option] = $value;
    }

    public function parseCookie(string $cookie_str) {
        $cookies = [];
        $parts = explode(';', $cookie_str);
        foreach ($parts as $part) {
            list($key, $value) = explode('=', trim($part), 2);
            $cookies[$key] = $value;
        }
        return $cookies;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a remote HTTP server using low-level socket operations, with support for various HTTP request parameters and proxy configuration.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy), sends an HTTP GET request with customizable headers, reads the response, and returns the content body. It supports authentication, custom headers, timeout settings, and proxy configuration. The function can either return the content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: [array] - An associative array containing the following possible keys:
  - 'file': [string] - The URL to fetch (required)
  - 'assign': [string] - Template variable name to assign content to (optional)
  - 'assign_headers': [string] - Template variable name to assign response headers to (optional)
  - 'user': [string] - Username for HTTP authentication (optional)
  - 'pass': [string] - Password for HTTP authentication (optional)
  - 'accept': [string] - Accept header value (optional)
  - 'header': [string|array] - Additional HTTP headers (optional)
  - 'proxy_host': [string] - Proxy server hostname (optional)
  - 'proxy_port': [int] - Proxy server port (optional)
  - 'agent': [string] - User-Agent header value (optional)
  - 'referer': [string] - Referer header value (optional)
  - 'timeout': [int] - Connection timeout in seconds (optional)
- $template: [object] - Template engine object for variable assignment (optional)

Output:
- If 'assign' parameter is provided: [void] - Assigns content to template variable
- If 'assign' parameter is not provided: [string] - Returns the fetched content
- On error: [void] - Triggers notice and returns nothing

<?php
function fetchContent($params, $template = null) {
    if (empty($params['file'])) {
        trigger_error('URL is required', E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $url = parse_url($params['file']);
    $host = $url['host'];
    $path = isset($url['path']) ? $url['path'] : '/';
    $path .= isset($url['query']) ? '?' . $url['query'] : '';
    $port = isset($url['port']) ? $url['port'] : 80;
    $timeout = isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 30;

    $proxy_host = isset($params['proxy_host']) ? $params['proxy_host'] : null;
    $proxy_port = isset($params['proxy_port']) ? $params['proxy_port'] : null;

    $fp = fsockopen($proxy_host ? $proxy_host : $host, $proxy_host ? $proxy_port : $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    if (!$fp) {
        trigger_error("Unable to connect to $host: $errstr ($errno)", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $request = "GET " . ($proxy_host ? $params['file'] : $path) . " HTTP/1.0\r\n";
    $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    if (isset($params['agent'])) {
        $request .= "User-Agent: " . $params['agent'] . "\r\n";
    }
    if (isset($params['referer'])) {
        $request .= "Referer: " . $params['referer'] . "\r\n";
    }
    if (isset($params['accept'])) {
        $request .= "Accept: " . $params['accept'] . "\r\n";
    }
    if (isset($params['user']) && isset($params['pass'])) {
        $request .= "Authorization: Basic " . base64_encode($params['user'] . ':' . $params['pass']) . "\r\n";
    }
    if (isset($params['header'])) {
        if (is_array($params['header'])) {
            foreach ($params['header'] as $header) {
                $request .= $header . "\r\n";
            }
        } else {
            $request .= $params['header'] . "\r\n";
        }
    }
    $request .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";

    fwrite($fp, $request);

    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 128);
    }
    fclose($fp);

    $header_end = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    $headers = substr($response, 0, $header_end);
    $body = substr($response, $header_end + 4);

    if (isset($params['assign'])) {
        if ($template) {
            $template->assign($params['assign'], $body);
        } else {
            trigger_error('Template object is required for assignment', E_USER_NOTICE);
        }
    } else {
        return $body;
    }

    if (isset($params['assign_headers'])) {
        if ($template) {
            $template->assign($params['assign_headers'], $headers);
        } else {
            trigger_error('Template object is required for header assignment', E_USER_NOTICE);
        }
    }
}

    $proxy_port = isset($params['proxy_port']) ? $params['proxy_port'] : null;

    $timeout = isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 30;

    $fp = @fsockopen($proxy_host ? $proxy_host : $host, $proxy_host ? $proxy_port : $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    if (!$fp) {
        trigger_error("Unable to connect to server: $errstr", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $request = "GET " . ($proxy_host ? $params['file'] : $path) . " HTTP/1.0\r\n";
    $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";

    if (isset($params['user']) && isset($params['pass'])) {
        $auth = base64_encode($params['user'] . ':' . $params['pass']);
        $request .= "Authorization: Basic $auth\r\n";
    }

    if (isset($params['accept'])) {
        $request .= "Accept: " . $params['accept'] . "\r\n";
    }

    if (isset($params['agent'])) {
        $request .= "User-Agent: " . $params['agent'] . "\r\n";
    }

    if (isset($params['referer'])) {
        $request .= "Referer: " . $params['referer'] . "\r\n";
    }

    if (isset($params['header'])) {
        if (is_array($params['header'])) {
            foreach ($params['header'] as $header) {
                $request .= $header . "\r\n";
            }
        } else {
            $request .= $params['header'] . "\r\n";
        }
    }

    $request .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";

    fwrite($fp, $request);

    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 128);
    }
    fclose($fp);

    list($header, $body) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);

    if (isset($params['assign_headers']) && $template) {
        $template->assign($params['assign_headers'], $header);
    }

    if (isset($params['assign']) && $template) {
        $template->assign($params['assign'], $body);
    } else {
        return $body;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using fsockopen for making HTTP requests when CURL extension is not available. The class should support both GET and POST methods, handle headers, cookies, timeouts, and allow configuration of various connection parameters.

Class Description: The Http class provides low-level HTTP client functionality using PHP's fsockopen function. It's designed as a fallback when CURL isn't available, offering stable performance for making HTTP requests. The class contains one static method that handles the complete HTTP request lifecycle from connection establishment to response processing.

Methods:

Method1: fsockopenDownload(string $url, array $conf = []) -> mixed - Performs an HTTP request using fsockopen
  Input Parameters:
    - $url: string - The target URL to request
    - $conf: array - Configuration options including:
      - limit: int - Maximum bytes to read (0 for unlimited)
      - post: mixed - POST data (array or string)
      - cookie: string - Cookie header content
      - ip: string - Force specific IP address
      - timeout: int - Connection timeout in seconds
      - block: bool - Whether to use blocking mode
  Return Type: mixed - Returns the HTTP response body as string, or empty string on failure

The method follows these steps:
1. Parses the URL and merges configuration with defaults
2. Prepares appropriate HTTP request headers (GET/POST)
3. Establishes TCP connection using fsockopen
4. Sends the HTTP request
5. Reads and processes the response
6. Closes the connection and returns the response body

<?php

class Http {
    public static function fsockopenDownload(string $url, array $conf = []) {
        $defaults = [
            'limit' => 0,
            'post' => '',
            'cookie' => '',
            'ip' => '',
            'timeout' => 30,
            'block' => true,
        ];
        $conf = array_merge($defaults, $conf);

        $urlParts = parse_url($url);
        $scheme = $urlParts['scheme'] ?? 'http';
        $host = $urlParts['host'] ?? '';
        $port = $urlParts['port'] ?? ($scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $path = ($urlParts['path'] ?? '/') . (isset($urlParts['query']) ? '?' . $urlParts['query'] : '');
        $protocol = $scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '';

        $fp = fsockopen($protocol . ($conf['ip'] ?: $host), $port, $errno, $errstr, $conf['timeout']);
        if (!$fp) {
            return '';
        }

        stream_set_blocking($fp, $conf['block']);
        stream_set_timeout($fp, $conf['timeout']);

        $method = $conf['post'] ? 'POST' : 'GET';
        $headers = [
            "$method $path HTTP/1.1",
            "Host: $host",
            "Connection: Close",
        ];

        if ($conf['post']) {
            if (is_array($conf['post'])) {
                $conf['post'] = http_build_query($conf['post']);
            }
            $headers[] = 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded';
            $headers[] = 'Content-Length: ' . strlen($conf['post']);
        }

        if ($conf['cookie']) {
            $headers[] = 'Cookie: ' . $conf['cookie'];
        }

        $request = implode("\r\n", $headers) . "\r\n\r\n" . $conf['post'];
        fwrite($fp, $request);

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $response .= fgets($fp, 1024);
            if ($conf['limit'] && strlen($response) >= $conf['limit']) {
                break;
            }
        }

        fclose($fp);

        $headerEnd = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
        if ($headerEnd !== false) {
            $response = substr($response, $headerEnd + 4);
        }

        return $response;
    }
}

            $headers[] = 'Cookie: ' . $conf['cookie'];
        }

        $request = implode("\r\n", $headers) . "\r\n\r\n";
        if ($conf['post']) {
            $request .= $postData;
        }

        fwrite($fp, $request);

        if (!$conf['block']) {
            stream_set_blocking($fp, false);
        }

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            if ($conf['limit'] > 0 && strlen($response) >= $conf['limit']) {
                break;
            }
            $response .= fread($fp, 1024);
        }

        fclose($fp);

        $headerEndPos = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
        if ($headerEndPos !== false) {
            $response = substr($response, $headerEndPos + 4);
        }

        return $response;
    }
}

        $protocol = $scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '';
        $fp = fsockopen($protocol . $ip, $port, $errno, $errstr, $conf['timeout']);

        if (!$fp) {
            return '';
        }

        stream_set_blocking($fp, $conf['block']);
        stream_set_timeout($fp, $conf['timeout']);

        $method = $conf['post'] ? 'POST' : 'GET';

        if ($conf['cookie']) {

        if ($conf['post']) {

            $headers .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
            $headers .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($conf['post']) . "\r\n";

class Http {

            'post' => '',
            'cookie' => '',
            'ip' => '',
            'timeout' => 30,
            'block' => true,

        while (!feof($fp)) {

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified HTTP URL using fsockopen for low-level HTTP communication, with support for proxy configuration and timeout settings.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy server if configured), sends an HTTP GET request, reads the response, and returns the response body. It handles URL parsing, connection establishment, request sending, response reading, and connection closing. The function can either return the fetched content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string, required) The HTTP URL to fetch
  - 'proxy_host': (string, optional) Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (integer, optional) Proxy server port
  - 'timeout': (integer, optional) Connection timeout in seconds (default: 30)
  - 'assign': (string, optional) Template variable name to assign the content to
- $template: (object) The template object for assigning content when 'assign' parameter is used

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if 'assign' parameter is not provided
- Returns nothing (void) if 'assign' parameter is provided (content is assigned to template instead)
matched_results:
<?php
function fetch_http_content($params, $template = null) {
    $url = parse_url($params['file']);
    $host = $url['host'];
    $path = isset($url['path']) ? $url['path'] : '/';
    $path .= isset($url['query']) ? '?' . $url['query'] : '';
    $port = isset($url['port']) ? $url['port'] : 80;
    $timeout = isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 30;

    $proxy_host = isset($params['proxy_host']) ? $params['proxy_host'] : null;
    $proxy_port = isset($params['proxy_port']) ? $params['proxy_port'] : null;

    if ($proxy_host && $proxy_port) {
        $fp = fsockopen($proxy_host, $proxy_port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
        $request = "GET http://$host$path HTTP/1.0\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    } else {
        $fp = fsockopen($host, $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
        $request = "GET $path HTTP/1.0\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    }

    if (!$fp) {
        return false;
    }

    $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
    fwrite($fp, $request);

    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 128);
    }
    fclose($fp);

    $header_end = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    $body = substr($response, $header_end + 4);

    if (isset($params['assign']) && $template) {
        $template->assign($params['assign'], $body);
        return;
    }

    return $body;
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that retrieves content from a specified URL using low-level socket operations (fsockopen) rather than higher-level HTTP client libraries. The function should handle both HTTP and HTTPS protocols, manage connection timeouts, and properly process the HTTP response.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to the specified HTTP server, sends a GET request, reads the response (separating headers from body), and returns the content. It handles both HTTP and HTTPS connections with appropriate ports, includes basic error handling, and follows proper HTTP protocol for request/response cycles.

Input:
- $url (string): The URL to fetch content from (e.g., "http://example.com" or "https://example.com")
- &$data (string, passed by reference): Variable that will contain the response body content

Output:
- bool: Returns true if the request was successful and content was retrieved, false if any error occurred (connection failure, empty response, etc.)
- The response body content is stored in the $data parameter passed by reference

Note: The function does not return the content directly but instead modifies the $data parameter. This follows the pattern seen in the reference code where output is handled via parameter reference rather than return value.

function fetchContent($url, &$data) {
    $parsedUrl = parse_url($url);
    if ($parsedUrl === false || !isset($parsedUrl['host'])) {
        return false;
    }

    $host = $parsedUrl['host'];
    $port = isset($parsedUrl['scheme']) && $parsedUrl['scheme'] === 'https' ? 443 : 80;
    $path = isset($parsedUrl['path']) ? $parsedUrl['path'] : '/';
    $path .= isset($parsedUrl['query']) ? '?' . $parsedUrl['query'] : '';

    $scheme = isset($parsedUrl['scheme']) ? $parsedUrl['scheme'] : 'http';
    $protocol = $scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '';

    $fp = @fsockopen($protocol . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 10);
    if (!$fp) {
        return false;
    }

    $out = "GET $path HTTP/1.1\r\n";
    $out .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    $out .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";

    fwrite($fp, $out);

    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 128);
    }
    fclose($fp);

    $headerEnd = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    if ($headerEnd === false) {
        return false;
    }

    $data = substr($response, $headerEnd + 4);
    return true;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles file uploads to a specified host using HTTP PUT requests with Guzzle HTTP client, including CRC32 checksum verification.

Class Description: ImageX is a class that extends V4Curl and provides functionality to upload files to a remote server. It handles file validation, CRC32 checksum generation, and HTTP communication using Guzzle's HTTP client.

Attributes: (No explicit attributes in this class - it inherits from V4Curl)

Methods:
upload: [upload](string $uploadHost, array $storeInfo, string $filePath) -> int - Uploads a file to the specified host using HTTP PUT request. Validates file existence, calculates CRC32 checksum, and sends the file with appropriate headers. Returns 0 on success, -1 if file doesn't exist, or -2 if upload fails.

Parameters:
- $uploadHost: string - The host address to upload to
- $storeInfo: array - Contains 'StoreUri' for upload endpoint and 'Auth' for authorization
- $filePath: string - Local path to the file to be uploaded

Return:
- int: 0 for success, -1 for file not found, -2 for upload failure
unmatched_results:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class ImageX extends V4Curl
{
    public function upload(string $uploadHost, array $storeInfo, string $filePath): int
    {
        if (!file_exists($filePath)) {
            return -1;
        }

        $fileContent = file_get_contents($filePath);
        $crc32Checksum = hash_file('crc32b', $filePath);

        $client = new Client();
        $uri = $uploadHost . $storeInfo['StoreUri'];
        $headers = [
            'Authorization' => $storeInfo['Auth'],
            'Content-Type' => 'application/octet-stream',
            'Content-CRC32' => $crc32Checksum
        ];

        try {
            $response = $client->put($uri, [
                'headers' => $headers,
                'body' => $fileContent
            ]);

            if ($response->getStatusCode() === 200) {
                return 0;
            } else {
                return -2;
            }
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return -2;
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using fsockopen for making HTTP requests when cURL is not available. The class should support both GET and POST requests with configurable options like timeout, cookies, and blocking mode.

Class Description: The Http class provides a static method for making HTTP requests using fsockopen. It's designed as a fallback when cURL isn't available, offering stable performance with configurable options for different HTTP request scenarios.

Methods:

Method1: fsockopenDownload(string $url, array $conf = array()) -> mixed - Makes an HTTP request using fsockopen
  Input:
    - $url: string - The target URL to request
    - $conf: array - Configuration options including:
      - limit: int - Number of characters to read in segments (0 for unlimited)
      - post: string|array - POST content (either as string or array for form data)
      - cookie: string - Cookie content to send with request
      - ip: string - IP address to use instead of resolving hostname
      - timeout: int - Connection timeout in seconds (default: 15)
      - block: bool - Whether to use blocking mode (default: true)
  Output:
    - Returns string containing the HTTP response body, or empty string on failure

<?php

class Http {
    public static function fsockopenDownload($url, $conf = array()) {
        $limit = isset($conf['limit']) ? intval($conf['limit']) : 0;
        $post = isset($conf['post']) ? $conf['post'] : '';
        $cookie = isset($conf['cookie']) ? $conf['cookie'] : '';
        $ip = isset($conf['ip']) ? $conf['ip'] : '';
        $timeout = isset($conf['timeout']) ? intval($conf['timeout']) : 15;
        $block = isset($conf['block']) ? boolval($conf['block']) : true;

        $urlParts = parse_url($url);
        $host = $urlParts['host'];
        $port = isset($urlParts['port']) ? $urlParts['port'] : 80;
        $path = isset($urlParts['path']) ? $urlParts['path'] : '/';
        $query = isset($urlParts['query']) ? '?' . $urlParts['query'] : '';

        $hostIp = $ip ? $ip : $host;
        $errno = 0;
        $errstr = '';
        $fp = fsockopen($hostIp, $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);

        if (!$fp) {
            return '';
        }

        stream_set_blocking($fp, $block);
        stream_set_timeout($fp, $timeout);

        $method = $post ? 'POST' : 'GET';
        $header = "$method $path$query HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $header .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        $header .= "Connection: Close\r\n";
        if ($cookie) {
            $header .= "Cookie: $cookie\r\n";
        }
        if ($post) {
            if (is_array($post)) {
                $post = http_build_query($post);
            }
            $header .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
            $header .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($post) . "\r\n";
        }
        $header .= "\r\n";
        if ($post) {
            $header .= $post;
        }

        fwrite($fp, $header);

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $line = fgets($fp, $limit > 0 ? $limit : 4096);
            if ($line === false) {
                break;
            }
            $response .= $line;
        }

        fclose($fp);

        $headerEndPos = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
        if ($headerEndPos !== false) {
            $response = substr($response, $headerEndPos + 4);
        }

        return $response;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using either cURL (if available) or fsockopen as a fallback, supporting both GET and POST methods with various configurations.

Function Description: The function _dfsockopen performs HTTP requests to a specified URL with support for POST data, cookies, custom headers, file uploads, and timeout settings. It first attempts to use cURL if available, falling back to fsockopen for basic socket communication. The function handles both URL-encoded and multipart form data for POST requests.

Input:
- $url: (string) The target URL for the HTTP request
- $limit: (int) Maximum number of bytes to read from response (0 for unlimited)
- $post: (string|array) POST data to send (either query string or associative array)
- $cookie: (string) Cookie header string
- $bysocket: (bool) Force using fsockopen (unused in this implementation)
- $ip: (string) Specific IP to connect to (bypassing DNS)
- $timeout: (int) Connection timeout in seconds
- $block: (bool) Whether to use blocking I/O
- $encodetype: (string) POST data encoding type ('URLENCODE' or other for multipart)
- $allowcurl: (bool) Whether to allow cURL usage
- $position: (int) Unused parameter
- $files: (array) Associative array of file paths for file uploads

Output:
- Returns: (string) The HTTP response body (limited by $limit if specified)
- Side effect: Sets $GLOBALS['filesockheader'] with response headers
- Returns empty string on connection failure or non-200 status code (for cURL)

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client using low-level socket operations (fsockopen) to send HTTP requests and handle responses, with logging capabilities.

Class Description: SocketHttpClient is a PSR-compatible HTTP client that establishes direct socket connections to HTTP servers, sends requests, and processes responses. It implements both a custom HTTP client interface and PSR-18's ClientInterface, while also supporting PSR-3 logging.

Attributes:
- logger: [LoggerInterface] - PSR-3 logger instance for tracking connection attempts, errors, and debug information

Methods:
- __construct([LoggerInterface $logger]) -> [void] - Initializes the client with a PSR-3 logger instance
- sendRequest([RequestInterface $request]) -> [ResponseInterface] - Sends an HTTP request and returns the response. Handles both HTTP and HTTPS connections, processes headers and body, and manages socket lifecycle. Returns a PSR-7 response object.

<?php

use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseFactoryInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\StreamFactoryInterface;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface
{
    private $logger;
    private $responseFactory;
    private $streamFactory;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger, ResponseFactoryInterface $responseFactory, StreamFactoryInterface $streamFactory)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
        $this->responseFactory = $responseFactory;
        $this->streamFactory = $streamFactory;
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: ($uri->getScheme() === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $path = $uri->getPath() ?: '/';
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $path .= $query ? '?' . $query : '';

        $errno = 0;
        $errstr = '';
        $contextOptions = [];
        if ($scheme === 'https') {
            $contextOptions['ssl'] = [
                'verify_peer' => true,
                'verify_peer_name' => true,
            ];
        }

        $context = stream_context_create($contextOptions);
        $socket = @stream_socket_client(
            ($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : 'tcp://') . $host . ':' . $port,
            $errno,
            $errstr,
            30,
            STREAM_CLIENT_CONNECT,
            $context
        );

        if (!$socket) {
            $this->logger->error("Connection failed: $errstr ($errno)");
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: $errstr ($errno)");
        }

        $this->logger->info("Connected to $host:$port");

        $headers = sprintf(
            "%s %s HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: %s\r\n",
            $request->getMethod(),
            $path,
            $host
        );

        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            foreach ($values as $value) {
                $headers .= sprintf("%s: %s\r\n", $name, $value);
            }
        }

        $body = (string) $request->getBody();
        if ($body) {
            $headers .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($body) . "\r\n";
        }

        $headers .= "\r\n" . $body;

        fwrite($socket, $headers);

        $responseHeaders = '';
        while (($line = fgets($socket)) !== false) {
            if (rtrim($line) === '') {
                break;
            }
            $responseHeaders .= $line;
        }

        $responseBody = stream_get_contents($socket);
        fclose($socket);

        $this->logger->info("Received response from $host:$port");

        list($responseLine, $headerLines) = explode("\r\n", $responseHeaders, 2);
        list(, $statusCode) = explode(' ', $responseLine, 3);

        $response = $this->responseFactory->createResponse((int) $statusCode);
        foreach (explode("\r\n", $headerLines) as $headerLine) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(': ', $headerLine, 2);
            $response = $response->withHeader($name, $value);
        }

        $stream = $this->streamFactory->createStream($responseBody);
        return $response->withBody($stream);
    }
}

<?php

use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Log\NullLogger;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface
{
    private $logger;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger = null)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger ?: new NullLogger();
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: ($uri->getScheme() === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $path = $uri->getPath() ?: '/';
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $path .= $query ? '?' . $query : '';

        $this->logger->debug("Connecting to {$host}:{$port}");

        $errno = 0;
        $errstr = '';
        $socket = @fsockopen(($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);

        if (!$socket) {
            $this->logger->error("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
        }

        $this->logger->debug("Connected to {$host}:{$port}");

        $headers = sprintf(
            "%s %s HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: %s\r\n",
            $request->getMethod(),
            $path,
            $host
        );

        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            foreach ($values as $value) {
                $headers .= sprintf("%s: %s\r\n", $name, $value);
            }
        }

        $body = (string) $request->getBody();
        if ($body) {
            $headers .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($body) . "\r\n";
        }

        $headers .= "\r\n" . $body;

        $this->logger->debug("Sending request:\n{$headers}");

        fwrite($socket, $headers);

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($socket)) {
            $response .= fgets($socket, 1024);
        }

        fclose($socket);

        $this->logger->debug("Received response:\n{$response}");

        list($headerPart, $bodyPart) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        $headerLines = explode("\r\n", $headerPart);
        $statusLine = array_shift($headerLines);
        preg_match('#HTTP/\d\.\d\s+(\d{3})#', $statusLine, $matches);
        $statusCode = (int) $matches[1];

        $headers = [];
        foreach ($headerLines as $line) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(': ', $line, 2);
            $headers[$name][] = $value;
        }

        return new class($statusCode, $headers, $bodyPart) implements ResponseInterface {
            private $statusCode;
            private $headers;
            private $body;

            public function __construct($statusCode, $headers, $body)
            {
                $this->statusCode = $statusCode;
                $this->headers = $headers;
                $this->body = $body;
            }

            public function getStatusCode()
            {
                return $this->statusCode;
            }

            public function getHeaders()
            {
                return $this->headers;
            }

            public function getHeader($name)
            {
                return $this->headers[$name] ?? [];
            }

            public function getBody()
            {
                return $this->body;
            }

            // Other PSR-7 methods would be implemented here...
        };
    }
}

<?php

use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseFactoryInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\StreamFactoryInterface;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface
{
    private $logger;
    private $responseFactory;
    private $streamFactory;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger, ResponseFactoryInterface $responseFactory, StreamFactoryInterface $streamFactory)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
        $this->responseFactory = $responseFactory;
        $this->streamFactory = $streamFactory;
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: ($uri->getScheme() === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $path = $uri->getPath() ?: '/';
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $path .= $query ? '?' . $query : '';

        $this->logger->info("Connecting to {$host}:{$port}");

        $socket = @fsockopen(($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);
        if (!$socket) {
            $this->logger->error("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
        }

        $this->logger->info("Connected to {$host}:{$port}");

        $requestLine = sprintf("%s %s HTTP/1.1\r\n", $request->getMethod(), $path);
        $headers = sprintf("Host: %s\r\n", $host);
        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            foreach ($values as $value) {
                $headers .= sprintf("%s: %s\r\n", $name, $value);
            }
        }

        $body = (string) $request->getBody();
        if ($body) {
            $headers .= sprintf("Content-Length: %d\r\n", strlen($body));
        }

        $headers .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";

        $this->logger->debug("Sending request:\n{$requestLine}{$headers}{$body}");

        fwrite($socket, $requestLine . $headers . $body);

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($socket)) {
            $response .= fgets($socket, 1024);
        }

        fclose($socket);

        $this->logger->debug("Received response:\n{$response}");

        list($headerText, $body) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        $headerLines = explode("\r\n", $headerText);
        $statusLine = array_shift($headerLines);
        preg_match('#HTTP/\d\.\d\s+(\d{3})#', $statusLine, $matches);
        $statusCode = (int) $matches[1];

        $response = $this->responseFactory->createResponse($statusCode);
        foreach ($headerLines as $headerLine) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(': ', $headerLine, 2);
            $response = $response->withAddedHeader($name, $value);
        }

        $stream = $this->streamFactory->createStream($body);
        return $response->withBody($stream);
    }
}
