use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Log\NullLogger;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface
{
    private $logger;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger = null)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger ?: new NullLogger();
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: ($uri->getScheme() === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $path = $uri->getPath() ?: '/';
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $path .= $query ? '?' . $query : '';

        $this->logger->debug("Connecting to {$host}:{$port}");

        $errno = 0;
        $errstr = '';
        $contextOptions = [];
        if ($scheme === 'https') {
            $contextOptions['ssl'] = [
                'verify_peer' => true,
                'verify_peer_name' => true,
            ];
        }
        $context = stream_context_create($contextOptions);
        $socket = @stream_socket_client(
            "{$scheme}://{$host}:{$port}",
            $errno,
            $errstr,
            30,
            STREAM_CLIENT_CONNECT,
            $context
        );

        if (!$socket) {
            $this->logger->error("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
        }

        $this->logger->debug("Connected to {$host}:{$port}");

        $headers = [];
        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            foreach ($values as $value) {
                $headers[] = "{$name}: {$value}";
            }
        }

        $requestLine = sprintf(
            "%s %s HTTP/%s\r\n",
            $request->getMethod(),
            $path,
            $request->getProtocolVersion()
        );
        $headerLines = implode("\r\n", $headers);
        $body = (string)$request->getBody();

        $httpRequest = $requestLine . $headerLines . "\r\n\r\n" . $body;

        $this->logger->debug("Sending request:\n{$httpRequest}");

        fwrite($socket, $httpRequest);

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($socket)) {
            $response .= fgets($socket, 1024);
        }

        fclose($socket);

        $this->logger->debug("Received response:\n{$response}");

        list($responseHeaders, $responseBody) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        $responseLines = explode("\r\n", $responseHeaders);
        $statusLine = array_shift($responseLines);
        preg_match('#HTTP/\d\.\d (\d{3})#', $statusLine, $matches);
        $statusCode = (int)$matches[1];

        $responseHeaders = [];
        foreach ($responseLines as $line) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(': ', $line, 2);
            $responseHeaders[$name][] = $value;
        }

        return new class($statusCode, $responseHeaders, $responseBody) implements ResponseInterface {
            private $statusCode;
            private $headers;
            private $body;

            public function __construct($statusCode, $headers, $body)
            {
                $this->statusCode = $statusCode;
                $this->headers = $headers;
                $this->body = $body;
            }

            public function getStatusCode()
            {
                return $this->statusCode;
            }

            public function getReasonPhrase()
            {
                return '';
            }

            public function getProtocolVersion()
            {
                return '1.1';
            }

            public function getHeaders()
            {
                return $this->headers;
            }

            public function hasHeader($name)
            {
                return isset($this->headers[$name]);
            }

            public function getHeader($name)
            {
                return $this->headers[$name] ?? [];
            }

            public function getHeaderLine($name)
            {
                return implode(', ', $this->headers[$name] ?? []);
            }

            public function getBody()
            {
                return $this->body;
            }

            public function withStatus($code, $reasonPhrase = '')
            {
                $this->statusCode = $code;
                return $this;
            }

            public function withProtocolVersion($version)
            {
                return $this;
            }

            public function withHeader($name, $value)
            {
                $this->headers[$name] = (array)$value;
                return $this;
            }

            public function withAddedHeader($name, $value)
            {
                $this->headers[$name][] = $value;
                return $this;
            }

            public function withoutHeader($name)
            {
                unset($this->headers[$name]);
                return $this;
            }

            public function withBody($body)
            {
                $this->body = $body;
                return $this;
            }
        };
    }
}

<?php

use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Log\NullLogger;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface
{
    private $logger;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger = null)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger ?: new NullLogger();
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: ($scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $path = $uri->getPath() ?: '/';
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $path .= $query ? '?' . $query : '';

        $this->logger->info("Connecting to {$host}:{$port}");

        $errno = 0;
        $errstr = '';
        $contextOptions = [];
        if ($scheme === 'https') {
            $contextOptions['ssl'] = [
                'verify_peer' => true,
                'verify_peer_name' => true,
            ];
        }
        $context = stream_context_create($contextOptions);
        $fp = @stream_socket_client(
            ($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : 'tcp://') . $host . ':' . $port,
            $errno,
            $errstr,
            30,
            STREAM_CLIENT_CONNECT,
            $context
        );

        if (!$fp) {
            $this->logger->error("Connection failed: $errstr ($errno)");
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: $errstr ($errno)");
        }

        $this->logger->info("Connected to {$host}:{$port}");

        $headers = "Host: {$host}\r\n";
        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            $headers .= $name . ': ' . implode(', ', $values) . "\r\n";
        }

        $body = (string)$request->getBody();
        $headers .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($body) . "\r\n";
        $headers .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";

        $requestString = strtoupper($request->getMethod()) . " {$path} HTTP/1.1\r\n" . $headers . $body;

        $this->logger->debug("Sending request:\n" . $requestString);

        fwrite($fp, $requestString);

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $response .= fgets($fp, 1024);
        }

        fclose($fp);

        $this->logger->debug("Received response:\n" . $response);

        list($responseHeaders, $responseBody) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);

        $responseLines = explode("\r\n", $responseHeaders);
        $statusLine = array_shift($responseLines);
        list(, $statusCode, $reasonPhrase) = explode(' ', $statusLine, 3);

        $responseHeaders = [];
        foreach ($responseLines as $line) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(': ', $line, 2);
            $responseHeaders[$name][] = $value;
        }

        return new class($statusCode, $reasonPhrase, $responseHeaders, $responseBody) implements ResponseInterface {
            private $statusCode;
            private $reasonPhrase;
            private $headers;
            private $body;

            public function __construct($statusCode, $reasonPhrase, $headers, $body)
            {
                $this->statusCode = $statusCode;
                $this->reasonPhrase = $reasonPhrase;
                $this->headers = $headers;
                $this->body = $body;
            }

            public function getStatusCode()
            {
                return $this->statusCode;
            }

            public function getReasonPhrase()
            {
                return $this->reasonPhrase;
            }

            public function getProtocolVersion()
            {
                return '1.1';
            }

            public function withStatus($code, $reasonPhrase = '')
            {
                $this->statusCode = $code;
                $this->reasonPhrase = $reasonPhrase;
                return $this;
            }

            public function getHeaders()
            {
                return $this->headers;
            }

            public function hasHeader($name)
            {
                return isset($this->headers[$name]);
            }

            public function getHeader($name)
            {
                return $this->headers[$name] ?? [];
            }

            public function getHeaderLine($name)
            {
                return implode(', ', $this->headers[$name] ?? []);
            }

            public function withHeader($name, $value)
            {
                $this->headers[$name] = (array)$value;
                return $this;
            }

            public function withAddedHeader($name, $value)
            {
                $this->headers[$name][] = $value;
                return $this;
            }

            public function withoutHeader($name)
            {
                unset($this->headers[$name]);
                return $this;
            }

            public function getBody()
            {
                return $this->body;
            }

            public function withBody(\Psr\Http\Message\StreamInterface $body)
            {
                $this->body = (string)$body;
                return $this;
            }
        };
    }
}

        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $path .= $query ? '?' . $query : '';

        $this->logger->debug("Connecting to {$scheme}://{$host}:{$port}");

        $errno = 0;
        $errstr = '';
        $socket = fsockopen(($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);

        if (!$socket) {
            $this->logger->error("Connection failed: $errstr ($errno)");
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: $errstr ($errno)");
        }

        $headers = $this->formatHeaders($request);
        $body = (string) $request->getBody();
        $requestLine = sprintf("%s %s HTTP/1.1\r\n", $request->getMethod(), $path);

        $this->logger->debug("Sending request: $requestLine");

        fwrite($socket, $requestLine);
        fwrite($socket, $headers);
        fwrite($socket, "\r\n");
        fwrite($socket, $body);

        $response = $this->readResponse($socket);

        fclose($socket);

        return $response;
    }

    private function formatHeaders(RequestInterface $request): string
    {
        $headers = '';
        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            foreach ($values as $value) {
                $headers .= sprintf("%s: %s\r\n", $name, $value);
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    private function readResponse($socket): ResponseInterface
    {
        $response = '';
        while (!feof($socket)) {
            $response .= fgets($socket, 1024);
        }

        list($headerPart, $bodyPart) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        $headers = explode("\r\n", $headerPart);
        $statusLine = array_shift($headers);
        list($protocol, $statusCode, $reasonPhrase) = explode(' ', $statusLine, 3);

        $responseHeaders = [];
        foreach ($headers as $header) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(': ', $header, 2);
            $responseHeaders[$name][] = $value;
        }

        $response = new \GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response($statusCode, $responseHeaders, $bodyPart, $protocol, $reasonPhrase);

        return $response;
    }
}

<?php

use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Log\NullLogger;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface
{
    private $logger;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger = null)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger ?: new NullLogger();
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: ($scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $path = $uri->getPath() ?: '/';
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $path .= $query ? '?' . $query : '';

        $this->logger->debug("Connecting to {$host}:{$port}");

        $contextOptions = [];
        if ($scheme === 'https') {
            $contextOptions['ssl'] = [
                'verify_peer' => true,
                'verify_peer_name' => true,
            ];
        }

        $context = stream_context_create($contextOptions);
        $socket = @fsockopen(($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);

        if (!$socket) {
            $this->logger->error("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
        }

        $this->logger->debug("Connected to {$host}:{$port}");

        $headers = $this->buildHeaders($request);
        $body = (string) $request->getBody();

        $requestString = "{$request->getMethod()} {$path} HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $requestString .= "Host: {$host}\r\n";
        $requestString .= $headers;
        $requestString .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($body) . "\r\n";
        $requestString .= "\r\n";
        $requestString .= $body;

        fwrite($socket, $requestString);

        $responseString = '';
        while (!feof($socket)) {
            $responseString .= fgets($socket, 1024);
        }

        fclose($socket);

        return $this->parseResponse($responseString);
    }

    private function buildHeaders(RequestInterface $request): string
    {
        $headers = '';
        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            foreach ($values as $value) {
                $headers .= "{$name}: {$value}\r\n";
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    private function parseResponse(string $responseString): ResponseInterface
    {
        list($headerPart, $body) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $responseString, 2);
        $headerLines = explode("\r\n", $headerPart);

        $statusLine = array_shift($headerLines);
        preg_match('#HTTP/\d\.\d\s(\d{3})#', $statusLine, $matches);
        $statusCode = (int) $matches[1];

        $headers = [];
        foreach ($headerLines as $line) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(': ', $line, 2);
            $headers[$name][] = $value;
        }

        $response = new \GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response($statusCode, $headers, $body);
        return $response;
    }
}

<?php

use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Log\NullLogger;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface
{
    private $logger;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger = null)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger ?: new NullLogger();
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: ($scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $path = $uri->getPath() ?: '/';
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $path .= $query ? '?' . $query : '';

        $this->logger->info("Connecting to {$host}:{$port}");

        $errno = 0;
        $errstr = '';
        $socket = fsockopen(($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);

        if (!$socket) {
            $this->logger->error("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
        }

        $this->logger->info("Connected to {$host}:{$port}");

        $headers = sprintf(
            "%s %s HTTP/%s\r\nHost: %s\r\n",
            $request->getMethod(),
            $path,
            $request->getProtocolVersion(),
            $host
        );

        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            $headers .= $name . ': ' . implode(', ', $values) . "\r\n";
        }

        $headers .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";
        $body = (string) $request->getBody();

        $this->logger->debug("Sending request headers:\n{$headers}");
        $this->logger->debug("Sending request body:\n{$body}");

        fwrite($socket, $headers . $body);

        $responseHeaders = '';
        while (($line = fgets($socket)) !== false) {
            if (rtrim($line) === '') {
                break;
            }
            $responseHeaders .= $line;
        }

        $responseBody = '';
        while (!feof($socket)) {
            $responseBody .= fgets($socket);
        }

        fclose($socket);

        $this->logger->debug("Received response headers:\n{$responseHeaders}");
        $this->logger->debug("Received response body:\n{$responseBody}");

        list($responseLine, $headerLines) = explode("\r\n", $responseHeaders, 2);
        list($protocol, $statusCode, $reasonPhrase) = explode(' ', $responseLine, 3);

        $response = new \GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response(
            (int) $statusCode,
            $this->parseHeaders($headerLines),
            $responseBody,
            $protocol,
            $reasonPhrase
        );

        return $response;
    }

    private function parseHeaders(string $headerLines): array
    {
        $headers = [];
        foreach (explode("\r\n", $headerLines) as $line) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
            $headers[trim($name)][] = trim($value);
        }
        return $headers;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that implements a RabbitMQ consumer in PHP to process messages from a specified queue.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, and starts consuming messages. It processes each message by printing its content and acknowledging it. The consumer stops when it receives a 'quit' message or when the channel is no longer consuming. The function includes proper cleanup by closing the channel and connection upon shutdown.

Input:
- $host (string): The hostname of the RabbitMQ server
- $port (int): The port number of the RabbitMQ server
- $user (string): The username for RabbitMQ authentication
- $pass (string): The password for RabbitMQ authentication
- $vhost (string): The virtual host to connect to
- $exchange (string): The name of the exchange to declare
- $queue (string): The name of the queue to declare and consume from
- $consumerTag (string): The identifier for this consumer

Output: None (The function processes messages asynchronously and does not return a value)

<?php
require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';
use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function consumeRabbitMQ($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $exchange, $queue, $consumerTag) {
    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
    $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
    $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

    $callback = function($msg) use ($channel) {
        echo 'Received: ', $msg->body, "\n";
        if ($msg->body === 'quit') {
            $msg->delivery_info['channel']->basic_cancel($msg->delivery_info['consumer_tag']);
        }
        $msg->ack();
    };

    $channel->basic_consume($queue, $consumerTag, false, false, false, false, $callback);

    register_shutdown_function(function() use ($channel, $connection) {
        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();
    });

    while ($channel->is_consuming()) {
        $channel->wait();
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a RabbitMQ consumer class in PHP that connects to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, and processes incoming messages until a termination signal is received.

Class Description: The RabbitMQConsumer class handles the consumption of messages from a RabbitMQ queue. It establishes a connection to the server, sets up the necessary queue and exchange, processes messages, and provides shutdown functionality.

Attributes:
- msgCount: [int] - Tracks the number of messages processed
- startTime: [float|null] - Records the start time of message processing
- conn: [AMQPStreamConnection] - Holds the RabbitMQ server connection
- ch: [AMQPChannel] - Represents the communication channel
- exchange: [string] - Name of the exchange to bind to
- queue: [string] - Name of the queue to consume from
- consumer_tag: [string] - Identifier for the consumer (empty in this implementation)

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the RabbitMQ connection, channel, exchange, and queue
- process_message([AMQPMessage] $msg) -> [void] - Processes incoming messages and handles termination signal
- startConsuming() -> [void] - Starts consuming messages from the queue
- shutdown() -> [void] - Closes the channel and connection cleanly
matched_results:
<?php

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

class RabbitMQConsumer
{
    private $msgCount = 0;
    private $startTime = null;
    private $conn;
    private $ch;
    private $exchange = 'my_exchange';
    private $queue = 'my_queue';
    private $consumer_tag = '';

    public function __construct()
    {
        $this->conn = new AMQPStreamConnection('localhost', 5672, 'guest', 'guest');
        $this->ch = $this->conn->channel();

        $this->ch->exchange_declare($this->exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
        $this->ch->queue_declare($this->queue, false, true, false, false);
        $this->ch->queue_bind($this->queue, $this->exchange);

        $this->ch->basic_consume($this->queue, $this->consumer_tag, false, true, false, false, [$this, 'process_message']);
    }

    public function process_message(AMQPMessage $msg)
    {
        if ($this->startTime === null) {
            $this->startTime = microtime(true);
        }

        $this->msgCount++;
        echo 'Received message: ', $msg->body, PHP_EOL;

        if ($msg->body === 'quit') {
            $this->shutdown();
        }
    }

    public function startConsuming()
    {
        echo 'Waiting for messages. To exit press CTRL+C', PHP_EOL;
        while ($this->ch->is_consuming()) {
            $this->ch->wait();
        }
    }

    public function shutdown()
    {
        echo 'Shutting down...', PHP_EOL;
        $this->ch->close();
        $this->conn->close();
        echo 'Processed ', $this->msgCount, ' messages in ', microtime(true) - $this->startTime, ' seconds.', PHP_EOL;
    }
}

$consumer = new RabbitMQConsumer();
$consumer->startConsuming();

    private $queue = 'my_queue';

        $this->ch = $this->conn->channel();

        $this->ch->exchange_declare($this->exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
        $this->ch->queue_declare($this->queue, false, true, false, false);
        $this->ch->queue_bind($this->queue, $this->exchange);

        $this->startTime = microtime(true);
    }

    public function process_message(AMQPMessage $msg)
    {
        echo 'Received message: ', $msg->body, "\n";
        $this->msgCount++;

        if ($msg->body === 'quit') {
            $this->shutdown();
        }
    }

    public function startConsuming()
    {
        $this->ch->basic_consume($this->queue, $this->consumer_tag, false, true, false, false, [$this, 'process_message']);

        while ($this->ch->is_consuming()) {
            $this->ch->wait();
        }
    }

    public function shutdown()
    {
        $this->ch->close();
        $this->conn->close();
        $endTime = microtime(true);
        echo 'Processed ', $this->msgCount, ' messages in ', ($endTime - $this->startTime), " seconds\n";

<?php

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

class RabbitMQConsumer
{
    private $msgCount = 0;
    private $startTime = null;
    private $conn;
    private $ch;
    private $exchange;
    private $queue;
    private $consumer_tag = '';

    public function __construct($host, $port, $user, $password, $exchange, $queue)
    {
        $this->exchange = $exchange;
        $this->queue = $queue;

        $this->conn = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $password);
        $this->ch = $this->conn->channel();

        $this->ch->exchange_declare($this->exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
        $this->ch->queue_declare($this->queue, false, true, false, false);
        $this->ch->queue_bind($this->queue, $this->exchange);

        pcntl_signal(SIGTERM, [$this, 'shutdown']);
        pcntl_signal(SIGINT, [$this, 'shutdown']);
    }

    public function process_message(AMQPMessage $msg)
    {
        echo 'Received message: ', $msg->body, "\n";
        $this->msgCount++;

        if ($msg->body === 'quit') {
            $this->shutdown();
        } else {
            $msg->ack();
        }
    }

    public function startConsuming()
    {
        $this->startTime = microtime(true);

        $this->ch->basic_consume(
            $this->queue,
            $this->consumer_tag,
            false,
            false,
            false,
            false,
            [$this, 'process_message']
        );

        while ($this->ch->is_consuming()) {
            pcntl_signal_dispatch();
            $this->ch->wait();
        }
    }

    public function shutdown()
    {
        echo "Shutting down...\n";
        $this->ch->close();
        $this->conn->close();
        $elapsed = microtime(true) - $this->startTime;
        echo "Processed {$this->msgCount} messages in {$elapsed} seconds.\n";
        exit();
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that implements a RabbitMQ consumer to process messages from a specified queue, with the ability to acknowledge or reject messages based on their content, and properly handle connection shutdown.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them together, and starts consuming messages. It processes each message by acknowledging "good" messages and rejecting others. If the message body is "quit", it stops consuming. The function includes proper cleanup by closing the channel and connection on shutdown.

Input:
- $host: string - RabbitMQ server hostname
- $port: int - RabbitMQ server port
- $user: string - RabbitMQ username
- $pass: string - RabbitMQ password  
- $vhost: string - RabbitMQ virtual host
- $exchange: string - Exchange name to bind to
- $queue: string - Queue name to consume from
- $consumerTag: string - Identifier for this consumer

Output: None (This is a long-running consumer process that handles messages asynchronously)

<?php

require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function consumeRabbitMQ($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $exchange, $queue, $consumerTag) {
    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
    $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
    $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

    $callback = function ($msg) use ($channel) {
        echo 'Received ', $msg->body, "\n";
        if ($msg->body === 'quit') {
            $msg->delivery_info['channel']->basic_cancel($msg->delivery_info['consumer_tag']);
        } elseif (strpos($msg->body, 'good') !== false) {
            $msg->ack();
        } else {
            $msg->nack(false, false);
        }
    };

    $channel->basic_consume($queue, $consumerTag, false, false, false, false, $callback);

    register_shutdown_function(function() use ($channel, $connection) {
        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();
    });

    while ($channel->is_consuming()) {
        $channel->wait();
    }
}

        }
        $msg->ack();
    };

    $channel->basic_consume($queue, '', false, false, false, false, $callback);

    while ($channel->is_consuming()) {
        $channel->wait();
    }

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that consumes messages from a RabbitMQ queue using headers-based routing. The function should establish a connection to RabbitMQ, declare an exchange and queue, bind the queue with specified headers, and process incoming messages with a callback function.

Function Description: The function `consume_rabbitmq_messages` connects to a RabbitMQ server, sets up a headers-based exchange, declares a temporary queue, binds the queue with the provided headers, and starts consuming messages. It processes each message using a callback function that displays the message body and headers. The function handles timeouts gracefully and cleans up resources after processing.

Input: 
- `$headers` (array): An array of strings in the format "key=value" representing the headers to bind the queue with.

Output: 
- Returns `true` if the function executes successfully.
- Returns `false` if the input headers are empty.
- Outputs message details to stdout and may write errors to stderr.

use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function consume_rabbitmq_messages($headers) {
    if (empty($headers)) {
        return false;
    }

    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection('localhost', 5672, 'guest', 'guest');
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $exchange = 'headers_exchange';
    $queue = '';

    $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'headers', false, true, false);
    list($queue_name, ,) = $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, true, false);

    $binding_headers = [];
    foreach ($headers as $header) {
        list($key, $value) = explode('=', $header);
        $binding_headers[$key] = ['S', $value];
    }
    $binding_headers['x-match'] = ['S', 'all'];

    $channel->queue_bind($queue_name, $exchange, '', false, false, new \PhpAmqpLib\Wire\AMQPTable($binding_headers));

    $callback = function ($msg) {
        echo "Message body: " . $msg->body . PHP_EOL;
        echo "Message headers: " . json_encode($msg->get('application_headers')->getNativeData()) . PHP_EOL;

        try {
            $channel->wait(null, false, 5);

            break;

    }

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that sends multiple messages to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and measures the execution time for the operation.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, creates a temporary queue, sends a specified number of messages with the given content, and returns the total time taken to complete the operation. Each message is sent through a newly created channel, and the temporary queue is automatically deleted after use.

Input:
- $max_messages: [int] - The number of messages to send.
- $host: [string] - The hostname or IP address of the RabbitMQ server.
- $port: [int] - The port number of the RabbitMQ server.
- $user: [string] - The username for RabbitMQ authentication.
- $pass: [string] - The password for RabbitMQ authentication.
- $vhost: [string] - The virtual host to connect to on the RabbitMQ server.
- $message_body: [string] - The content of the message to be sent.

Output:
- [float] - The total execution time in seconds for sending all messages, or false if the connection fails.

<?php
require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';
use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function sendMessagesToRabbitMQ($max_messages, $host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $message_body) {
    try {
        $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    } catch (Exception $e) {
        return false;
    }

    $channel = $connection->channel();
    list($queue_name, ,) = $channel->queue_declare("", false, false, true, true);

    $start_time = microtime(true);

    for ($i = 0; $i < $max_messages; $i++) {
        $msg = new AMQPMessage($message_body);
        $channel->basic_publish($msg, '', $queue_name);
    }

    $end_time = microtime(true);
    $execution_time = $end_time - $start_time;

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();

    return $execution_time;
}
?>

function sendMessagesToRabbitMQ($max_messages, $host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $message_body) {
    try {
        $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    } catch (Exception $e) {
        return false;
    }

    $channel = $connection->channel();
    list($queue_name, ,) = $channel->queue_declare("", false, false, true, false);

    $start_time = microtime(true);

    for ($i = 0; $i < $max_messages; $i++) {
        $msg = new AMQPMessage($message_body);
        $channel->basic_publish($msg, '', $queue_name);
    }

    $end_time = microtime(true);
    $execution_time = $end_time - $start_time;

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();

    return $execution_time;
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a CAPTCHA validation class that verifies user-submitted CAPTCHA responses using Google's reCAPTCHA API.

Class Description: The Captcha class implements Laravel's Rule interface to provide CAPTCHA validation functionality. It sends the user's CAPTCHA response to Google's verification endpoint and checks the success status in the response.

Attributes: (This class has no explicit attributes as it uses configuration values directly)

Methods:
1: passes(string $attribute, mixed $value) -> bool - Validates the CAPTCHA response by sending it to Google's verification API along with the secret key and client IP. Returns true if verification succeeds.
   - $attribute: The name of the attribute being validated
   - $value: The CAPTCHA response token to be validated

2: message() -> string - Returns the validation error message to be displayed when CAPTCHA validation fails. The message is localized using Laravel's translation system.
unmatched_results:
<?php

namespace App\Rules;

use Illuminate\Contracts\Validation\Rule;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Http;

class Captcha implements Rule
{
    public function passes($attribute, $value)
    {
        $response = Http::asForm()->post('https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api/siteverify', [
            'secret' => config('services.recaptcha.secret'),
            'response' => $value,
            'remoteip' => request()->ip(),
        ]);

        return $response->json()['success'];
    }

    public function message()
    {
        return __('validation.captcha');
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a function that sends a delayed message to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and the PhpAmqpLib library. The function should establish a connection to RabbitMQ, declare a delayed exchange and queue, and publish a message with a specified delay time.

Function Description: The function `send_delayed_message` sends a message to a RabbitMQ queue with a specified delay. It uses a delayed exchange to achieve the delay functionality. The function handles the connection setup, exchange and queue declaration, message creation with delay headers, and cleanup of resources.

Input:
- `$message_content` [string] - The content of the message to be sent.
- `$delay_ms` [int] - The delay time in milliseconds before the message is delivered to the queue.

Output: None. The function does not return any value but publishes the message to the specified RabbitMQ queue with the given delay.

Note: The function assumes the existence of a `config.php` file containing the RabbitMQ connection parameters (HOST, PORT, USER, PASS, VHOST).
matched_results:
<?php

require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';
require_once 'config.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function send_delayed_message($message_content, $delay_ms) {
    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection(HOST, PORT, USER, PASS, VHOST);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $exchange = 'delayed_exchange';
    $queue = 'delayed_queue';

    $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'x-delayed-message', false, true, false, false, false, [
        'x-delayed-type' => ['S', 'direct']
    ]);

    $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false, false, [
        'x-dead-letter-exchange' => ['S', $exchange]
    ]);

    $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

    $message = new AMQPMessage($message_content, [
        'delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT,
        'application_headers' => [
            'x-delay' => ['I', $delay_ms]
        ]
    ]);

    $channel->basic_publish($message, $exchange);

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that sends a message to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and the PhpAmqpLib library.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, publishes a message with persistent delivery mode, and then closes the connection. It handles errors gracefully by returning false if an exception occurs.

Input:  
- $messageBody: [string] - The content of the message to be sent  
- $exchange: [string] - The name of the exchange (default: 'router')  
- $queue: [string] - The name of the queue (default: 'msgs')  

Output:  
- [bool] - Returns true if the message was successfully sent, false if an error occurred
matched_results:
<?php
require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';
use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function sendMessageToQueue($messageBody, $exchange = 'router', $queue = 'msgs') {
    try {
        $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection('localhost', 5672, 'guest', 'guest');
        $channel = $connection->channel();

        $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
        $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
        $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

        $msg = new AMQPMessage($messageBody, array('delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT));
        $channel->basic_publish($msg, $exchange);

        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();

        return true;
    } catch (Exception $e) {
        return false;
    }
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that publishes messages to a RabbitMQ queue in batches, measuring the total execution time for sending all messages.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares an exchange and queue, then publishes a specified number of messages in configurable batch sizes. It handles connection blocking scenarios and returns the total execution time. A special 'quit' message is sent at the end to signal completion.

Input:
- $msg_count: [integer] - The total number of messages to publish
- $batch_size: [integer] - The number of messages to send in each batch
- $host: [string] - RabbitMQ server hostname
- $port: [integer] - RabbitMQ server port
- $user: [string] - RabbitMQ username
- $pass: [string] - RabbitMQ password
- $vhost: [string] - RabbitMQ virtual host

Output:
- [float] - The total execution time in seconds for sending all messages
matched_results:
<?php
require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';
use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function publish_messages_in_batches($msg_count, $batch_size, $host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost) {
    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $exchange = 'batch_exchange';
    $queue = 'batch_queue';
    $routing_key = 'batch_routing_key';

    $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
    $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
    $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange, $routing_key);

    $start_time = microtime(true);

    for ($i = 0; $i < $msg_count; $i++) {
        $msg_body = 'Message ' . ($i + 1);
        $msg = new AMQPMessage($msg_body, ['delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT]);
        $channel->basic_publish($msg, $exchange, $routing_key);

        if (($i + 1) % $batch_size == 0) {
            $channel->wait_for_pending_acks();
        }
    }

    $quit_msg = new AMQPMessage('quit', ['delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT]);
    $channel->basic_publish($quit_msg, $exchange, $routing_key);
    $channel->wait_for_pending_acks();

    $end_time = microtime(true);
    $execution_time = $end_time - $start_time;

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();

    return $execution_time;
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP function that sends a message to a RabbitMQ queue using the PhpAmqpLib library. The function should handle connection establishment, message publishing, and resource cleanup.

Function Description: The function `send_rabbitmq_message` sends a given message to a predefined RabbitMQ queue. It establishes a connection to the RabbitMQ server, declares the necessary exchange and queue, publishes the message, and then closes the connection. The function returns a boolean indicating success or failure.

Input:  
- `$message_content` (string): The content of the message to be sent to the RabbitMQ queue.

Output:  
- (bool): Returns `true` if the message was successfully sent, `false` if an error occurred.

<?php
require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function send_rabbitmq_message($message_content) {
    $host = 'localhost';
    $port = 5672;
    $user = 'guest';
    $password = 'guest';
    $queue = 'my_queue';
    $exchange = 'my_exchange';
    $routing_key = 'my_routing_key';

    try {
        $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $password);
        $channel = $connection->channel();

        $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
        $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
        $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange, $routing_key);

        $msg = new AMQPMessage($message_content, array('delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT));
        $channel->basic_publish($msg, $exchange, $routing_key);

        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();

        return true;
    } catch (Exception $e) {
        return false;
    }
}

        $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange, $routing_key);

        $message = new AMQPMessage($message_content, ['delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT]);
        $channel->basic_publish($message, $exchange, $routing_key);

        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();

        return true;
    } catch (Exception $e) {
        return false;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Redis-based session handler class that extends a base session driver and implements the SessionHandlerInterface for use in a web application framework.

Class Description: The CI_Session_redis_driver class provides Redis-based session management functionality, including session data storage, retrieval, locking mechanisms, and cleanup. It handles connection management, session data persistence, and concurrency control through Redis operations.

Attributes:
- _redis: [Redis] - Instance of the Redis client used for all operations
- _key_prefix: [string] - Prefix for all Redis keys used in session storage
- _lock_key: [string] - Key used for the current session lock
- _key_exists: [bool] - Flag indicating whether the current session key exists in Redis
- _config: [array] - Configuration array containing connection parameters and settings
- _session_id: [string] - Current session ID being handled
- _fingerprint: [string] - MD5 hash of the current session data for change detection

Methods:
- __construct(&$params) -> [void] - Constructor that parses configuration parameters and sets up the Redis connection details
- open($save_path, $name) -> [bool] - Opens a connection to the Redis server using configured parameters
- read($session_id) -> [string] - Reads session data from Redis for the given session ID
- write($session_id, $session_data) -> [bool] - Writes session data to Redis for the given session ID
- close() -> [bool] - Closes the Redis connection and releases any locks
- destroy($session_id) -> [bool] - Removes session data from Redis for the given session ID
- gc($maxlifetime) -> [bool] - Garbage collection handler (not implemented for Redis)
- _get_lock($session_id) -> [bool] - Internal method to acquire a lock for session operations
- _release_lock() -> [bool] - Internal method to release the current session lock
- _fail() -> [bool] - Internal method to handle operation failures
- _success() -> [bool] - Internal method to handle operation successes

<?php

class CI_Session_redis_driver extends CI_Session_driver implements SessionHandlerInterface
{
    protected $_redis;
    protected $_key_prefix;
    protected $_lock_key;
    protected $_key_exists;
    protected $_config;
    protected $_session_id;
    protected $_fingerprint;

    public function __construct(&$params)
    {
        parent::__construct($params);
        $this->_config = $params;
        $this->_key_prefix = isset($this->_config['key_prefix']) ? $this->_config['key_prefix'] : 'ci_session:';
        $this->_redis = new Redis();
    }

    public function open($save_path, $name)
    {
        if (!$this->_redis->connect($this->_config['host'], $this->_config['port'])) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        if (isset($this->_config['password']) && !$this->_redis->auth($this->_config['password'])) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        if (isset($this->_config['database']) && !$this->_redis->select($this->_config['database'])) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        return $this->_success();
    }

    public function read($session_id)
    {
        $this->_session_id = $session_id;
        $this->_get_lock($session_id);

        $session_data = $this->_redis->get($this->_key_prefix . $session_id);
        if ($session_data === false) {
            $this->_key_exists = false;
            return '';
        }

        $this->_key_exists = true;
        $this->_fingerprint = md5($session_data);
        return $session_data;
    }

    public function write($session_id, $session_data)
    {
        if ($session_id !== $this->_session_id) {
            if (!$this->_release_lock() || !$this->_get_lock($session_id)) {
                return $this->_fail();
            }
            $this->_key_exists = false;
            $this->_session_id = $session_id;
        }

        if ($this->_fingerprint !== md5($session_data) || !$this->_key_exists) {
            if ($this->_redis->set($this->_key_prefix . $session_id, $session_data, $this->_config['lifetime'])) {
                $this->_fingerprint = md5($session_data);
                $this->_key_exists = true;
                return $this->_success();
            }
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        return $this->_redis->expire($this->_key_prefix . $session_id, $this->_config['lifetime']) ? $this->_success() : $this->_fail();
    }

    public function close()
    {
        return $this->_release_lock() && $this->_redis->close();
    }

    public function destroy($session_id)
    {
        if ($this->_redis->del($this->_key_prefix . $session_id) !== 1) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        $this->_release_lock();
        return $this->_success();
    }

    public function gc($maxlifetime)
    {
        return true;
    }

    protected function _get_lock($session_id)
    {
        $this->_lock_key = $this->_key_prefix . $session_id . ':lock';
        $attempt = 0;

        do {
            if ($this->_redis->set($this->_lock_key, time(), ['nx', 'ex' => 300])) {
                return true;
            }

            usleep(100000);
        } while (++$attempt < 30);

        return false;
    }

    protected function _release_lock()
    {
        return $this->_redis->del($this->_lock_key) === 1;
    }

    protected function _fail()
    {
        return false;
    }

    protected function _success()
    {
        return true;
    }
}

class CI_Session_redis_driver extends CI_Session_driver implements SessionHandlerInterface
{
    protected $_redis;
    protected $_key_prefix;
    protected $_lock_key;
    protected $_key_exists = false;
    protected $_config;
    protected $_session_id;
    protected $_fingerprint;

    public function __construct(&$params)
    {
        parent::__construct($params);
        $this->_config = array(
            'host' => isset($params['host']) ? $params['host'] : '127.0.0.1',
            'port' => isset($params['port']) ? $params['port'] : 6379,
            'timeout' => isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 0,
            'password' => isset($params['password']) ? $params['password'] : NULL,
            'database' => isset($params['database']) ? $params['database'] : 0,
            'key_prefix' => isset($params['key_prefix']) ? $params['key_prefix'] : 'ci_session:'
        );
        $this->_key_prefix = $this->_config['key_prefix'];
        $this->_redis = new Redis();
    }

    public function open($save_path, $name)
    {
        if (!$this->_redis->connect($this->_config['host'], $this->_config['port'], $this->_config['timeout'])) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }
        if ($this->_config['password'] && !$this->_redis->auth($this->_config['password'])) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }
        if ($this->_config['database'] && !$this->_redis->select($this->_config['database'])) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }
        return $this->_success();
    }

    public function read($session_id)
    {
        $this->_session_id = $session_id;
        if ($this->_get_lock($session_id)) {
            $data = $this->_redis->get($this->_key_prefix.$session_id);
            if ($data !== false) {
                $this->_fingerprint = md5($data);
                $this->_key_exists = true;
                return $data;
            }
        }
        return '';
    }

    public function write($session_id, $session_data)
    {
        if ($session_id !== $this->_session_id && !$this->_release_lock() && !$this->_get_lock($session_id)) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }
        $this->_session_id = $session_id;
        if ($this->_fingerprint !== md5($session_data) || !$this->_key_exists) {
            if ($this->_redis->set($this->_key_prefix.$session_id, $session_data, ini_get('session.gc_maxlifetime'))) {
                $this->_fingerprint = md5($session_data);
                $this->_key_exists = true;
                return $this->_success();
            }
            return $this->_fail();
        }
        return $this->_redis->expire($this->_key_prefix.$session_id, ini_get('session.gc_maxlifetime')) ? $this->_success() : $this->_fail();
    }

    public function close()
    {
        if (isset($this->_redis)) {
            $this->_release_lock();
            if ($this->_redis->close()) {
                $this->_redis = null;
                return $this->_success();
            }
            return $this->_fail();
        }
        return $this->_success();
    }

    public function destroy($session_id)
    {
        if ($this->_redis->del($this->_key_prefix.$session_id) !== 1) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }
        $this->_release_lock();
        return $this->_success();
    }

    public function gc($maxlifetime)
    {
        return true;
    }

    protected function _get_lock($session_id)
    {
        $this->_lock_key = $this->_key_prefix.$session_id.':lock';
        if ($this->_redis->setnx($this->_lock_key, time())) {
            return $this->_redis->expire($this->_lock_key, 300);
        }
        if ($this->_redis->ttl($this->_lock_key) === -1) {
            $this->_redis->expire($this->_lock_key, 300);
        }
        return false;
    }

    protected function _release_lock()
    {
        if ($this->_lock_key && $this->_redis->del($this->_lock_key) !== 1) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }
        return $this->_success();
    }

    protected function _fail()
    {
        return false;
    }

    protected function _success()
    {
        return true;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a Redis-based queue management system with connection handling, basic Redis operations, and error recovery mechanisms.

Class Description: The `queue` class is a Redis wrapper that manages connections to Redis servers and provides common Redis operations with automatic reconnection on failure. It supports multiple Redis connections, connection pooling, and prefixing of keys.

Attributes:
- `$redis`: [static, mixed] - Placeholder for Redis instance (deprecated in favor of `$links`)
- `$configs`: [static, array] - Stores configuration for different Redis connections
- `$links`: [static, array] - Maintains active Redis connections
- `$link_name`: [static, string] - Current connection name (defaults to 'default')
- `$prefix`: [static, string] - Default prefix for Redis keys
- `$error`: [static, string] - Stores the last error message

Methods:
- `init()` -> [bool|Redis] - Initializes Redis connection using current configuration. Returns Redis instance or false on failure.
- `set($key, $value, $expire = 0)` -> [bool|null] - Sets a key-value pair in Redis with optional expiration. Returns true on success, null on failure.
- `get($key)` -> [mixed|null] - Retrieves a value by key from Redis. Returns the value or null on failure.
- `del($key)` -> [int|null] - Deletes a key from Redis. Returns number of deleted keys or null on failure.
- `_get_default_config()` -> [array] - Retrieves default Redis configuration from global settings.
- `clear_link()` -> [void] - Closes all active Redis connections and clears the connection pool.

Input:
- Configuration via `$GLOBALS['config']['redis']` for default connection
- Method parameters as described above

Output:
- For connection methods: Redis instance or boolean
- For data operations: Various return types as described above
- Error messages stored in `$error` property

Task Description: Create a Redis cache driver class for CodeIgniter that implements basic cache operations using Redis as the backend storage.

Class Description: The CI_Cache_redis class extends CI_Driver and provides an interface for caching data in Redis. It handles connection management, serialization of complex data types, and standard cache operations like get, save, delete, increment, and decrement.

Attributes:
- $_default_config: [array] - Default configuration for Redis connection
- $_redis: [Redis] - Redis client instance
- $_serialized: [array] - Track which keys contain serialized data

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes Redis connection using configuration
- get($key) -> [mixed] - Retrieves data from cache by key
- save($id, $data, $ttl = 60, $raw = FALSE) -> [bool] - Stores data in cache with optional TTL
- delete($key) -> [bool] - Removes data from cache by key
- increment($id, $offset = 1) -> [int|bool] - Increments a numeric value in cache
- decrement($id, $offset = 1) -> [int|bool] - Decrements a numeric value in cache
- clean() -> [bool] - Clears all cache entries
- cache_info($type = NULL) -> [array] - Returns Redis server information
- get_metadata($key) -> [array|bool] - Returns metadata about a cache entry
- is_supported() -> [bool] - Checks if Redis extension is loaded
- __destruct() -> [void] - Closes Redis connection when object is destroyed

Task Description: Create a Redis wrapper class in PHP that provides a simplified interface for connecting to and interacting with a Redis server, including connection management, basic operations, and error handling.

Class Description: The cls_redis class is a singleton-style wrapper for PHP's Redis extension that manages Redis connections, provides common Redis operations, and handles connection errors gracefully. It supports multiple connection configurations, automatic reconnection on failure, and key prefixing.

Attributes:

Attribute1: protected static $redis - Redis - Singleton Redis instance (deprecated)
Attribute2: protected static $configs - array - Stores Redis connection configurations
Attribute3: private static $links - array - Maintains active Redis connections
Attribute4: private static $link_name - string - Current connection name (default 'default')
Attribute5: public static $prefix - string - Default key prefix ('phpspider')
Attribute6: public static $error - string - Stores last error message

Methods:

Method1: init() -> Redis|false - Initializes and returns a Redis connection instance
Method2: set(string $key, mixed $value, int $expire = 0) -> bool|null - Stores a value in Redis with optional expiration
Method3: get(string $key) -> mixed|null - Retrieves a value from Redis by key
Method4: clear_link() -> void - Closes all active Redis connections
Method5: _get_default_config() -> array - Retrieves default Redis configuration from global settings

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements a Redis client connection using TCP sockets and the phpiredis extension for efficient communication with a Redis server.

Class Description: PhpiredisSocketConnection is a Redis client connection class that handles TCP socket communication with a Redis server. It manages socket creation, connection, data transmission, and response parsing using the phpiredis extension for optimal performance.

Attributes:
- reader: [resource] - The phpiredis reader resource used for parsing Redis protocol responses
- parameters: [ParametersInterface] - Connection parameters including host, port, timeout, etc.

<?php

class PhpiredisSocketConnection
{
    private $reader;
    private $parameters;
    private $socket;

    public function __construct(ParametersInterface $parameters)
    {
        $this->parameters = $parameters;
        $this->assertExtensions();
        $this->reader = $this->createReader();
        $this->socket = $this->createResource();
    }

    public function __destruct()
    {
        if ($this->socket) {
            fclose($this->socket);
        }
        if ($this->reader) {
            phpiredis_reader_destroy($this->reader);
        }
    }

    private function assertExtensions()
    {
        if (!extension_loaded('sockets')) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('The sockets extension is required.');
        }
        if (!extension_loaded('phpiredis')) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('The phpiredis extension is required.');
        }
    }

    private function createReader()
    {
        $reader = phpiredis_reader_create();
        phpiredis_reader_set_status_handler($reader, $this->getStatusHandler());
        phpiredis_reader_set_error_handler($reader, $this->getErrorHandler());
        return $reader;
    }

    private function getStatusHandler()
    {
        return function ($payload) {
            return $payload;
        };
    }

    private function getErrorHandler()
    {
        return function ($errorMessage) {
            throw new \RuntimeException($errorMessage);
        };
    }

    private function createResource()
    {
        $socket = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, SOL_TCP);
        if ($socket === false) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('Unable to create socket.');
        }
        $this->connectWithTimeout($socket, $this->parameters->getHost(), $this->parameters);
        return $socket;
    }

    private function connectWithTimeout($socket, $address, ParametersInterface $parameters)
    {
        socket_set_option($socket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVTIMEO, [
            'sec' => $parameters->getTimeout(),
            'usec' => 0
        ]);
        socket_set_option($socket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDTIMEO, [
            'sec' => $parameters->getTimeout(),
            'usec' => 0
        ]);
        if (!socket_connect($socket, $address, $parameters->getPort())) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('Unable to connect to the Redis server.');
        }
    }

    public function write($buffer)
    {
        if (socket_write($this->socket, $buffer, strlen($buffer)) === false) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('Unable to write to the socket.');
        }
    }

    public function read()
    {
        $buffer = '';
        while ($chunk = socket_read($this->socket, 4096)) {
            $buffer .= $chunk;
        }
        phpiredis_reader_feed($this->reader, $buffer);
        return phpiredis_reader_get_reply($this->reader);
    }

    public function writeRequest(CommandInterface $command)
    {
        $this->write($command->getCommand());
    }
}

class PhpiredisSocketConnection
{

        $this->socket = $this->createResource();
    }

    public function __destruct()
    {

            phpiredis_reader_destroy($this->reader);
        }
        if (is_resource($this->socket)) {
            fclose($this->socket);
        }
    }

    private function assertExtensions()
    {
        if (!extension_loaded('sockets')) {
            throw new RuntimeException('The sockets extension is required.');
        }
        if (!extension_loaded('phpiredis')) {
            throw new RuntimeException('The phpiredis extension is required.');
        }
    }

    private function createReader()
    {
        $reader = phpiredis_reader_create();
        phpiredis_reader_set_status_handler($reader, $this->getStatusHandler());
        phpiredis_reader_set_error_handler($reader, $this->getErrorHandler());
        return $reader;
    }

    private function getStatusHandler()
    {
        return function ($payload) {
            return $payload;
        };
    }

    private function getErrorHandler()
    {
        return function ($errorMessage) {
            throw new RuntimeException($errorMessage);
        };
    }

    private function createResource()
    {
        $socket = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, SOL_TCP);
        if ($socket === false) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Unable to create socket: ' . socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
        }
        $this->connectWithTimeout($socket, $this->parameters->getAddress(), $this->parameters);
        return $socket;
    }

    private function connectWithTimeout($socket, $address, ParametersInterface $parameters)
    {
        socket_set_nonblock($socket);
        @socket_connect($socket, $parameters->getHost(), $parameters->getPort());
        $timeout = $parameters->getTimeout();
        $write = [$socket];
        $except = null;
        $result = socket_select($except, $write, $except, $timeout);
        if ($result === false || $result === 0) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Connection timed out.');
        }
        socket_set_block($socket);
    }

    public function write($buffer)
    {
        $length = strlen($buffer);
        while (true) {
            $sent = socket_write($socket, $buffer, $length);
            if ($sent === false) {
                throw new RuntimeException('Unable to write to socket: ' . socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
            }
            if ($sent < $length) {
                $buffer = substr($buffer, $sent);
                $length -= $sent;
            } else {
                break;
            }
        }
    }

    public function read()
    {
        $response = '';
        while (true) {
            $chunk = socket_read($socket, 4096);
            if ($chunk === false) {
                throw new RuntimeException('Unable to read from socket: ' . socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
            }
            if ($chunk === '') {
                break;
            }
            $response .= $chunk;
        }
        phpiredis_reader_feed($this->reader, $response);
        return phpiredis_reader_get_reply($this->reader);
    }

    public function writeRequest(CommandInterface $command)
    {
        $this->write($command->getCommand());
    }
}

    private function assertExtensions()

            throw new RuntimeException('The sockets extension is required.');

        }
    }

    private function createReader()
    {
        $reader = phpiredis_reader_create();
        phpiredis_reader_set_status_handler($reader, $this->getStatusHandler());
        phpiredis_reader_set_error_handler($reader, $this->getErrorHandler());
        return $reader;
    }

    private function getStatusHandler()
    {
        return function ($payload) {
            return $payload;
        };
    }

    private function getErrorHandler()
    {
        return function ($errorMessage) {
            throw new RuntimeException($errorMessage);
        };
    }

    private function createResource()
    {
        $socket = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, SOL_TCP);
        if ($socket === false) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Unable to create socket: ' . socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
        }
        $this->connectWithTimeout($socket, $this->parameters->getHost(), $this->parameters);
        return $socket;
    }

    private function connectWithTimeout($socket, $address, ParametersInterface $parameters)
    {
        socket_set_nonblock($socket);
        $result = @socket_connect($socket, $address, $parameters->getPort());
        if ($result === false && socket_last_error() !== SOCKET_EINPROGRESS) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Unable to connect: ' . socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
        }
        socket_set_block($socket);
        $timeout = $parameters->getTimeout();
        $write = [$socket];
        $except = null;
        $result = socket_select($except, $write, $except, $timeout);
        if ($result === false) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Connection timed out.');
        }
    }

    public function write($buffer)
    {
        $totalBytesWritten = 0;
        $bufferLength = strlen($buffer);
        while ($totalBytesWritten < $bufferLength) {
            $bytesWritten = socket_write($this->socket, substr($buffer, $totalBytesWritten));
            if ($bytesWritten === false) {
                throw new RuntimeException('Unable to write to socket: ' . socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
            }
            $totalBytesWritten += $bytesWritten;
        }
    }

    public function read()
    {
        $response = '';
        while ($chunk = socket_read($this->socket, 4096)) {
            $response .= $chunk;
            if (phpiredis_reader_feed($this->reader, $chunk) === false) {
                throw new RuntimeException('Unable to read from socket: ' . socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
            }
            if (phpiredis_reader_get_state($this->reader) === PHPIREDIS_READER_STATE_COMPLETE) {
                return phpiredis_reader_get_reply($this->reader);
            }
        }
        throw new RuntimeException('Connection closed by server.');
    }

    public function writeRequest(CommandInterface $command)
    {
        $this->write($command->getCommand());
    }
}

            phpiredis_reader_destroy($this->reader);
        }
        if (is_resource($this->socket)) {
            fclose($this->socket);
        }
    }

    private function assertExtensions()
    {
        if (!extension_loaded('sockets') || !extension_loaded('phpiredis')) {
            throw new RuntimeException('The sockets and phpiredis extensions must be loaded.');
        }
    }

    private function createReader()
    {
        $reader = phpiredis_reader_create();
        phpiredis_reader_set_status_handler($reader, $this->getStatusHandler());
        phpiredis_reader_set_error_handler($reader, $this->getErrorHandler());
        return $reader;
    }

    private function getStatusHandler()
    {
        return function ($payload) {
            return $payload;
        };
    }

    private function getErrorHandler()
    {
        return function ($errorMessage) {
            throw new RuntimeException($errorMessage);
        };
    }

    private function createResource()
    {
        $address = sprintf('tcp://%s:%d', $this->parameters->getHost(), $this->parameters->getPort());
        $socket = stream_socket_client($address, $errno, $errstr, $this->parameters->getTimeout());

        if (!$socket) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Unable to connect to Redis server: $errstr");
        }

        return $socket;
    }

    private function connectWithTimeout($socket, $address, ParametersInterface $parameters)
    {
        stream_set_timeout($socket, $parameters->getTimeout());
        if (!stream_socket_client($address, $errno, $errstr, $parameters->getTimeout())) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Connection timed out: $errstr");
        }
    }

    public function write($buffer)
    {
        if (fwrite($this->socket, $buffer) === false) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Failed to write to socket.');
        }
    }

    public function read()
    {
        while (($line = fgets($this->socket)) !== false) {
            phpiredis_reader_feed($this->reader, $line);
            if (phpiredis_reader_get_state($this->reader) === PHPIREDIS_READER_STATE_COMPLETE) {
                return phpiredis_reader_get_reply($this->reader);
            }
        }
        throw new RuntimeException('Failed to read from socket.');
    }

    public function writeRequest(CommandInterface $command)
    {
        $arguments = $command->getArguments();
        $buffer = '*' . (count($arguments) + 1) . "\r\n";
        $buffer .= '$' . strlen($command->getId()) . "\r\n" . $command->getId() . "\r\n";

        foreach ($arguments as $argument) {
            $buffer .= '$' . strlen($argument) . "\r\n" . $argument . "\r\n";
        }

        $this->write($buffer);
    }
}

class PhpiredisSocketConnection
{
    private $reader;
    private $parameters;
    private $socket;

    public function __construct(ParametersInterface $parameters)
    {
        $this->parameters = $parameters;
        $this->assertExtensions();
        $this->reader = $this->createReader();
        $this->socket = $this->createResource();
    }

    public function __destruct()
    {
        if (is_resource($this->socket)) {
            fclose($this->socket);
        }
        if (is_resource($this->reader)) {
            phpiredis_reader_destroy($this->reader);
        }
    }

    private function assertExtensions()
    {
        if (!extension_loaded('sockets') || !extension_loaded('phpiredis')) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Required extensions are not loaded: sockets, phpiredis');
        }
    }

    private function createReader()
    {
        $reader = phpiredis_reader_create();
        phpiredis_reader_set_status_handler($reader, $this->getStatusHandler());
        phpiredis_reader_set_error_handler($reader, $this->getErrorHandler());
        return $reader;
    }

    private function getStatusHandler()
    {
        return function ($status) {
            return $status;
        };
    }

    private function getErrorHandler()
    {
        return function ($error) {
            throw new RuntimeException($error);
        };
    }

    private function createResource()
    {
        $address = sprintf('tcp://%s:%d', $this->parameters->getHost(), $this->parameters->getPort());
        $socket = stream_socket_client($address, $errno, $errstr, $this->parameters->getTimeout());

        if (!$socket) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Unable to connect to Redis server: $errstr ($errno)");
        }

        return $socket;
    }

    private function connectWithTimeout($socket, $address, ParametersInterface $parameters)
    {
        stream_set_timeout($socket, $parameters->getTimeout());
        if (!stream_socket_client($address, $errno, $errstr, $parameters->getTimeout())) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Connection timed out: $errstr ($errno)");
        }
    }

    public function write($buffer)
    {
        fwrite($this->socket, $buffer);
    }

    public function read()
    {
        while (($line = fgets($this->socket)) !== false) {
            phpiredis_reader_feed($this->reader, $line);
            if (phpiredis_reader_get_state($this->reader) === PHPIREDIS_READER_STATE_COMPLETE) {
                return phpiredis_reader_get_reply($this->reader);
            }
        }
        throw new RuntimeException('Failed to read response from Redis server');
    }

    public function writeRequest(CommandInterface $command)
    {
        $args = $command->getArguments();
        $request = '*' . count($args) . "\r\n";
        foreach ($args as $arg) {
            $request .= '$' . strlen($arg) . "\r\n" . $arg . "\r\n";
        }
        $this->write($request);
    }
}

Task Description: Implement a Radius class in PHP that handles RADIUS protocol communication for authentication and accounting purposes using UDP sockets.

Class Description: The Radius class provides functionality to communicate with a RADIUS server for authentication (Access-Request) and accounting operations. It handles packet construction, socket communication, and response parsing according to RADIUS protocol standards.

Attributes:

_ip_radius_server: [string] - IP address of the RADIUS server
_shared_secret: [string] - Shared secret for communication with RADIUS server
_radius_suffix: [string] - Suffix to append to usernames
_udp_timeout: [int] - Timeout for UDP operations in seconds
_authentication_port: [int] - Port for authentication requests (default 1812)
_accounting_port: [int] - Port for accounting requests (default 1813)
_nas_ip_address: [string] - NAS IP address to send in requests
_nas_port: [int] - NAS port to send in requests
_encrypted_password: [string] - Encrypted password for authentication
_user_ip_address: [string] - User's IP address
_request_authenticator: [string] - Request authenticator value
_response_authenticator: [string] - Response authenticator value
_username: [string] - Username for authentication
_password: [string] - Password for authentication
_identifier_to_send: [int] - Packet identifier to send
_identifier_received: [int] - Received packet identifier
_radius_packet_to_send: [int] - RADIUS packet code to send
_radius_packet_received: [int] - Received RADIUS packet code
_attributes_to_send: [array] - Attributes to include in outgoing packets
_attributes_received: [array] - Attributes received from server
_socket_to_server: [resource] - Socket connection to server
_debug_mode: [bool] - Debug mode flag
debug_text: [array] - Debug messages
_attributes_info: [array] - RADIUS attribute information
_radius_packet_info: [array] - RADIUS packet type information
_last_error_code: [int] - Last error code
_last_error_message: [string] - Last error message

Methods:

__construct: [function]($ip_radius_server = '127.0.0.1', $shared_secret = '', $radius_suffix = '', $udp_timeout = 5, $authentication_port = 1812, $accounting_port = 1813) -> [void] - Initializes the Radius object with server details and default values

AccessRequest: [function]($username = '', $password = '', $udp_timeout = 0, $state = NULL) -> [bool] - Sends an Access-Request to the RADIUS server and returns true if authentication is successful (Access-Accept received)

SetIpRadiusServer: [function]($ip_radius_server) -> [void] - Sets the RADIUS server IP address

SetSharedSecret: [function]($shared_secret) -> [void] - Sets the shared secret for RADIUS communication

SetAuthenticationPort: [function]($authentication_port) -> [void] - Sets the authentication port

SetAccountingPort: [function]($accounting_port) -> [void] - Sets the accounting port

SetRadiusSuffix: [function]($radius_suffix) -> [void] - Sets the username suffix

SetUdpTimeout: [function]($udp_timeout) -> [void] - Sets the UDP timeout value

SetUsername: [function]($username = '') -> [void] - Sets the username for authentication

SetPassword: [function]($password = '') -> [void] - Sets the password for authentication

SetNasIpAddress: [function]($nas_ip_address = '') -> [void] - Sets the NAS IP address

SetNasPort: [function]($nas_port = 0) -> [void] - Sets the NAS port

SetPacketCodeToSend: [function]($packet_code) -> [void] - Sets the RADIUS packet code to send

SetAttribute: [function]($attribute_type, $attribute_value) -> [void] - Adds an attribute to the outgoing packet

GetNextIdentifier: [function]() -> [int] - Returns the next packet identifier

GenerateRequestAuthenticator: [function]() -> [void] - Generates a new request authenticator

DecodeAttribute: [function]($attribute_raw_value, $attribute_type) -> [mixed] - Decodes a received attribute value

ClearLastError: [function]() -> [void] - Clears the last error information

ClearDataToSend: [function]() -> [void] - Clears all data to be sent

ClearDataReceived: [function]() -> [void] - Clears all received data

class Radius {
