Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that facilitates the execution of shell commands as subprocesses, handling input/output streams, and providing process execution details.

Class Description: The Process class provides a way to execute shell commands as subprocesses, capturing their output streams (stdout and stderr), return codes, and execution time. It includes methods for basic execution and error-checked execution variants.

Attributes:

command: [string] - The shell command to be executed
cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the command execution
env: [array] - Environment variables for the command
descriptors: [array] - Static array defining I/O streams configuration
log_run_times: [bool] - Static flag to enable execution time logging
run_times: [array] - Static array storing command execution time statistics

Methods:

create: [static](string $command, string|null $cwd = null, array $env = []) -> [Process] - Factory method to create a new Process instance
run: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and returns execution details including stdout, stderr, and return code
run_check: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero
run_check_stderr: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero or if stderr contains unexpected output (with specific exception for known PSR-0 deprecation warning)
matched_results:
<?php

class Process
{
    private $command;
    private $cwd;
    private $env;
    private static $descriptors = [
        0 => ['pipe', 'r'], // stdin
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'], // stdout
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']  // stderr
    ];
    private static $log_run_times = false;
    private static $run_times = [];

    private function __construct(string $command, ?string $cwd = null, array $env = [])
    {
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        $this->env = $env;
    }

    public static function create(string $command, ?string $cwd = null, array $env = []): Process
    {
        return new self($command, $cwd, $env);
    }

    public function run(): ProcessRun
    {
        $startTime = microtime(true);
        $process = proc_open($this->command, self::$descriptors, $pipes, $this->cwd, $this->env);

        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Failed to open process');
        }

        fclose($pipes[0]);
        $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
        fclose($pipes[1]);
        $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);

        $returnCode = proc_close($process);
        $endTime = microtime(true);

        if (self::$log_run_times) {
            self::$run_times[] = ['command' => $this->command, 'time' => $endTime - $startTime];
        }

        return new ProcessRun($stdout, $stderr, $returnCode);
    }

    public function run_check(): ProcessRun
    {
        $result = $this->run();

        if ($result->getReturnCode() !== 0) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Command failed with return code ' . $result->getReturnCode());
        }

        return $result;
    }

    public function run_check_stderr(): ProcessRun
    {
        $result = $this->run();

        if ($result->getReturnCode() !== 0) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Command failed with return code ' . $result->getReturnCode());
        }

        if (!empty($result->getStderr()) && strpos($result->getStderr(), 'PSR-0 deprecation warning') === false) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Command failed with stderr: ' . $result->getStderr());
        }

        return $result;
    }
}

class ProcessRun
{
    private $stdout;
    private $stderr;
    private $returnCode;

    public function __construct(string $stdout, string $stderr, int $returnCode)
    {
        $this->stdout = $stdout;
        $this->stderr = $stderr;
        $this->returnCode = $returnCode;
    }

    public function getStdout(): string
    {
        return $this->stdout;
    }

    public function getStderr(): string
    {
        return $this->stderr;
    }

    public function getReturnCode(): int
    {
        return $this->returnCode;
    }
}

    private static $log_run_times = false;
    private static $run_times = [];

    private function __construct(string $command, ?string $cwd = null, array $env = [])
    {
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        $this->env = $env;
    }

    public static function create(string $command, ?string $cwd = null, array $env = []): self
    {
        return new self($command, $cwd, $env);
    }

    public function run(): ProcessRun
    {
        $startTime = microtime(true);
        $process = proc_open($this->command, self::$descriptors, $pipes, $this->cwd, $this->env);

        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Unable to execute command: {$this->command}");
        }

        $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
        fclose($pipes[1]);

        $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);

        $returnCode = proc_close($process);
        $endTime = microtime(true);

        if (self::$log_run_times) {
            self::$run_times[] = $endTime - $startTime;
        }

        return new ProcessRun($stdout, $stderr, $returnCode);

        if ($result->getReturnCode() !== 0) {

        return $result;

    {
        $result = $this->run();
        if ($result->getReturnCode() !== 0 || $this->hasUnexpectedStderr($result->getStderr())) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Command failed with return code: {$result->getReturnCode()} or unexpected stderr output");
        }
        return $result;
    }

    private function hasUnexpectedStderr(string $stderr): bool
    {
        $knownWarnings = ['Deprecation Notice: Class PSR0'];
        foreach ($knownWarnings as $warning) {
            if (strpos($stderr, $warning) !== false) {
                return false;
            }
        }
        return !empty($stderr);
    }

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages subprocess execution with proper pipe handling for inter-process communication, including input/output streams and error handling.

Class Description: The Process class provides a way to execute shell commands as subprocesses, capturing their output streams (stdout and stderr) and exit codes. It supports custom working directories and environment variables, and includes optional execution time tracking.

Attributes:
- command: string - The shell command to be executed
- cwd: string|null - The working directory for the command execution
- env: array - Environment variables for the command
- descriptors: array - Static array defining I/O descriptors for proc_open
- log_run_times: bool - Static flag to enable execution time logging
- run_times: array - Static array storing aggregated execution times

Methods:
- create(string $command, string|null $cwd = null, array $env = array()) -> Process - Static factory method to create a new Process instance
- run() -> ProcessRun - Executes the command and returns a ProcessRun object containing execution results
- run_check() -> ProcessRun - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code or stderr is non-empty
- run_check_stderr() -> ProcessRun - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero or stderr exists

Note: The ProcessRun return type refers to an object containing these properties:
- stdout: string - Output from stdout
- stderr: string - Output from stderr
- return_code: int - Process exit code
- command: string - The executed command
- cwd: string|null - Working directory used
- env: array - Environment variables used
- run_time: float - Execution time in seconds

        $this->stderr = $stderr;
        $this->return_code = $return_code;

class Process {
    private $command;
    private $cwd;
    private $env;
    private static $descriptors = [
        0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']
    ];
    private static $log_run_times = false;
    private static $run_times = [];

    private function __construct($command, $cwd, $env) {
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        $this->env = $env;
    }

    public static function create($command, $cwd = null, $env = []) {
        return new self($command, $cwd, $env);
    }

    public function run() {
        $start_time = microtime(true);
        $process = proc_open($this->command, self::$descriptors, $pipes, $this->cwd, $this->env);

        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Unable to execute command: {$this->command}");
        }

        fclose($pipes[0]);
        $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
        fclose($pipes[1]);
        $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);

        $return_code = proc_close($process);
        $run_time = microtime(true) - $start_time;

        if (self::$log_run_times) {
            self::$run_times[] = $run_time;
        }

        return new ProcessRun($stdout, $stderr, $return_code, $this->command, $this->cwd, $this->env, $run_time);
    }

    public function run_check() {
        $result = $this->run();
        if ($result->return_code !== 0 || !empty($result->stderr)) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Command failed: {$result->command}, stderr: {$result->stderr}");
        }
        return $result;
    }

    public function run_check_stderr() {
        $result = $this->run();
        if ($result->return_code !== 0 || !empty($result->stderr)) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Command failed: {$result->command}, stderr: {$result->stderr}");
        }
        return $result;
    }

    public static function enable_run_time_logging() {
        self::$log_run_times = true;
    }

    public static function get_run_times() {
        return self::$run_times;
    }
}

        $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);

        $return_code = proc_close($process);
        $end_time = microtime(true);
        $run_time = $end_time - $start_time;

        if (self::$log_run_times) {
            self::$run_times[] = $run_time;
        }

        return new ProcessRun($stdout, $stderr, $return_code, $this->command, $this->cwd, $this->env, $run_time);
    }

    public function run_check(): ProcessRun {
        $result = $this->run();
        if ($result->return_code !== 0 || !empty($result->stderr)) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Command failed with return code {$result->return_code} and stderr: {$result->stderr}");
        }
        return $result;
    }

    public function run_check_stderr(): ProcessRun {
        $result = $this->run();
        if ($result->return_code !== 0 || !empty($result->stderr)) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Command failed with return code {$result->return_code} and stderr: {$result->stderr}");
        }
        return $result;
    }
}

class ProcessRun {
    public $stdout;
    public $stderr;
    public $return_code;
    public $command;
    public $cwd;
    public $env;
    public $run_time;

    public function __construct(string $stdout, string $stderr, int $return_code, string $command, ?string $cwd, array $env, float $run_time) {
        $this->stdout = $stdout;
        $this->stderr = $stderr;
        $this->return_code = $return_code;
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        $this->env = $env;
        $this->run_time = $run_time;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a convenient way to execute shell commands with options for argument escaping, error capturing, and different execution methods (proc_open vs exec).

Class Description: The Command class encapsulates shell command execution functionality, allowing for flexible command building, execution, and result handling. It supports both proc_open and exec methods, with options for capturing stderr, escaping arguments, and configuring process execution environment.

Attributes:

escapeArgs: [bool] - Whether to escape arguments automatically (default true)
escapeCommand: [bool] - Whether to escape the command (default false)
useExec: [bool] - Whether to use exec() instead of proc_open() (default false)
captureStdErr: [bool] - Whether to capture stderr output (default true)
procCwd: [string|null] - Working directory for the process
procEnv: [array|null] - Environment variables for the process
procOptions: [array|null] - Additional options for proc_open
_command: [string] - The base command to execute
_args: [array] - Array of command arguments
_execCommand: [string|null] - The final constructed command string
_stdOut: [string] - Captured stdout output
_stdErr: [string] - Captured stderr output
_exitCode: [int|null] - Process exit code
_error: [string] - Last error message
_executed: [bool] - Whether command has been executed

Methods:

__construct: [mixed $options = null] -> [void] - Constructor that accepts either configuration array or command string
setCommand: [string $command] -> [self] - Sets the base command to execute
getCommand: [void] -> [string] - Gets the current base command
getExecCommand: [void] -> [string|false] - Gets the fully constructed command string
addArg: [string $key, mixed $value = null, bool $escape = null] -> [self] - Adds an argument to the command
execute: [void] -> [bool] - Executes the command and returns success status
getOutput: [void] -> [string] - Gets the stdout output
getError: [void] -> [string] - Gets the last error message
getStdErr: [void] -> [string] - Gets the stderr output
getExitCode: [void] -> [int|null] - Gets the process exit code

<?php

class Command
{
    private $escapeArgs = true;
    private $escapeCommand = false;
    private $useExec = false;
    private $captureStdErr = true;
    private $procCwd = null;
    private $procEnv = null;
    private $procOptions = null;
    private $_command = '';
    private $_args = [];
    private $_execCommand = null;
    private $_stdOut = '';
    private $_stdErr = '';
    private $_exitCode = null;
    private $_error = '';
    private $_executed = false;

    public function __construct($options = null)
    {
        if (is_array($options)) {
            foreach ($options as $key => $value) {
                if (property_exists($this, $key)) {
                    $this->$key = $value;
                }
            }
        } elseif (is_string($options)) {
            $this->setCommand($options);
        }
    }

    public function setCommand($command)
    {
        $this->_command = $command;
        return $this;
    }

    public function getCommand()
    {
        return $this->_command;
    }

    public function getExecCommand()
    {
        if ($this->_execCommand !== null) {
            return $this->_execCommand;
        }

        $command = $this->_command;
        if ($this->escapeCommand) {
            $command = escapeshellcmd($command);
        }

        $args = [];
        foreach ($this->_args as $key => $value) {
            if ($this->escapeArgs) {
                $key = escapeshellarg($key);
                $value = escapeshellarg($value);
            }
            $args[] = $key . ($value !== null ? ' ' . $value : '');
        }

        $this->_execCommand = $command . ' ' . implode(' ', $args);
        return $this->_execCommand;
    }

    public function addArg($key, $value = null, $escape = null)
    {
        if ($escape === null) {
            $escape = $this->escapeArgs;
        }
        if ($escape) {
            $key = escapeshellarg($key);
            if ($value !== null) {
                $value = escapeshellarg($value);
            }
        }
        $this->_args[$key] = $value;
        return $this;
    }

    public function execute()
    {
        $this->_executed = false;
        $this->_stdOut = '';
        $this->_stdErr = '';
        $this->_exitCode = null;
        $this->_error = '';

        $command = $this->getExecCommand();
        if ($command === false) {
            $this->_error = 'Failed to construct command';
            return false;
        }

        if ($this->useExec) {
            $output = [];
            $returnVar = 0;
            exec($command . ' 2>&1', $output, $returnVar);
            $this->_stdOut = implode("\n", $output);
            $this->_exitCode = $returnVar;
            $this->_executed = true;
            return $returnVar === 0;
        } else {
            $descriptors = [
                0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
                1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
                2 => ['pipe', 'w']
            ];

            $process = proc_open($command, $descriptors, $pipes, $this->procCwd, $this->procEnv, $this->procOptions);
            if (!is_resource($process)) {
                $this->_error = 'Failed to open process';
                return false;
            }

            fclose($pipes[0]);
            $this->_stdOut = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
            fclose($pipes[1]);
            if ($this->captureStdErr) {
                $this->_stdErr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
                fclose($pipes[2]);
            }

            $this->_exitCode = proc_close($process);
            $this->_executed = true;
            return $this->_exitCode === 0;
        }
    }

    {
        return $this->_stdOut;
    }

    public function getError()
    {
        return $this->_error;
    }

    public function getStdErr()
    {
        return $this->_stdErr;
    }

    public function getExitCode()
    {
        return $this->_exitCode;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles process execution and communication using pipes, specifically designed for logging purposes. The class should manage subprocess creation, input/output streams, and error handling.

Class Description: ProcessHandler is a logging handler that executes a subprocess and communicates with it through pipes (stdin, stdout, stderr). It ensures proper process management, handles startup errors, and provides methods for writing input and reading errors.

Attributes:
- process: [resource|null] - The subprocess resource handle
- command: [string] - The command to execute as a subprocess
- cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the subprocess
- pipes: [array] - Array of file pointers for process pipes (stdin, stdout, stderr)

Methods:
- __construct(string $command, int|string|Level $level = Level::Debug, bool $bubble = true, ?string $cwd = null) -> [void] - Initializes the handler with command, log level, and working directory
- write(LogRecord $record) -> [void] - Writes formatted log record to the process stdin
- close() -> [void] - Closes all pipes and terminates the process
- ensureProcessIsStarted() -> [void] - Ensures the subprocess is running (starts if not)
- startProcess() -> [void] - Starts the subprocess using proc_open
- handleStartupErrors() -> [void] - Checks for and handles any startup errors
- selectErrorStream() -> [int|false] - Monitors the stderr pipe for activity
- readProcessErrors() -> [string] - Reads and returns error output from stderr
- writeProcessInput(string $string) -> [void] - Writes data to the process stdin

class ProcessHandler
{
    private $process;
    private $command;
    private $cwd;
    private $pipes;

    {
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        $this->pipes = [];
        $this->process = null;
    }

    public function write(LogRecord $record): void
    {
        $this->ensureProcessIsStarted();
        $formattedRecord = $this->formatRecord($record);
        $this->writeProcessInput($formattedRecord);
    }

    public function close(): void
    {
        if ($this->process !== null) {
            foreach ($this->pipes as $pipe) {
                fclose($pipe);
            }
            proc_close($this->process);
            $this->process = null;
        }
    }

    private function ensureProcessIsStarted(): void
    {
        if ($this->process === null) {
            $this->startProcess();
            $this->handleStartupErrors();
        }
    }

    private function startProcess(): void
    {
        $descriptors = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
            2 => ['pipe', 'w']
        ];

        $this->process = proc_open($this->command, $descriptors, $this->pipes, $this->cwd);

        if (!is_resource($this->process)) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Unable to start process');
        }
    }

    private function handleStartupErrors(): void
    {
        $errorStream = $this->selectErrorStream();
        if ($errorStream !== false) {
            $errors = $this->readProcessErrors();
            if (!empty($errors)) {
                throw new RuntimeException('Process startup errors: ' . $errors);
            }
        }
    }

    private function selectErrorStream()
    {
        $read = [$this->pipes[2]];
        $write = null;
        $except = null;
        $timeout = 0;

        return stream_select($read, $write, $except, $timeout);
    }

    private function readProcessErrors(): string
    {
        $errors = '';
        while ($line = fgets($this->pipes[2])) {
            $errors .= $line;
        }
        return $errors;
    }

    private function writeProcessInput(string $string): void
    {
        fwrite($this->pipes[0], $string);
    }

    {
        // Assuming LogRecord has a __toString method or similar formatting logic
        return (string)$record;
    }

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that retrieves Git tag information from a specified directory using subprocess communication via pipes.

Function Description: The function checks if a given directory is a Git repository (by checking for .git folder) and then executes the 'git describe --tags' command to get the latest tag information. It handles subprocess communication using pipes for stdout and stderr, properly manages resources, and returns the tag information or false if unsuccessful.

Input: 
- $path (string): The filesystem path to check for Git repository and execute Git command

Output:
- Returns (string|bool): The trimmed output from 'git describe --tags' command as string if successful, false if:
  - The path is not a Git repository
  - The subprocess cannot be created
  - The Git command returns a non-zero exit code
matched_results:
<?php

function getGitTagInfo($path) {
    if (!is_dir($path . '/.git')) {
        return false;
    }

    $descriptorspec = [
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],  // stdout is a pipe that the child will write to
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']   // stderr is a pipe that the child will write to
    ];

    $process = proc_open('git describe --tags', $descriptorspec, $pipes, $path);

    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        return false;
    }

    $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);

    fclose($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[2]);

    $return_value = proc_close($process);

    if ($return_value !== 0) {
        return false;
    }

    return trim($stdout);
}

Task Description: Create a function that executes a shell command in a subprocess and captures its standard output while properly handling resources and errors.

Function Description: The function `readFromProcess` executes a given shell command as a subprocess using PHP's `proc_open`, captures the output from the subprocess's stdout stream, and ensures all resources are properly closed. It handles cases where the `proc_open` function is unavailable or fails to create the subprocess.

Input: 
- `$command` (string): The shell command to be executed in the subprocess.

Output: 
- (string|null): Returns the captured output from the subprocess's stdout if successful, or null if the subprocess could not be created or if `proc_open` is unavailable.

<?php

function readFromProcess($command) {
    if (!function_exists('proc_open')) {
        return null;
    }

    $descriptorspec = [
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],  // stdout is a pipe that the child will write to
    ];

    $process = proc_open($command, $descriptorspec, $pipes);

    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        return null;
    }

    $output = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[1]);

    $return_value = proc_close($process);

    return $return_value === 0 ? $output : null;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages a subprocess using proc_open, handling input/output streams and proper cleanup.

Class Description: ProcessStream is a class that manages the lifecycle of a subprocess, including initialization, stream handling, and termination. It provides access to the subprocess's standard input and output streams while properly handling errors and resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- command: string - The command to be executed in the subprocess
- stream: resource - The process resource created by proc_open
- in: resource - The input stream (stdin) of the subprocess
- out: resource - The output stream (stdout) of the subprocess

Methods:
- setCommand(string $command): void - Sets the command to be executed by the subprocess
- initialize(): void - Starts the subprocess, sets up streams, and checks for startup errors
- terminate(): void - Closes all streams and terminates the subprocess
- getReadConnectionDescription(): string - Returns a description of the process connection
unmatched_results:
<?php

class ProcessStream {
    private $command;
    private $stream;
    private $in;
    private $out;

    public function setCommand(string $command): void {
        $this->command = $command;
    }

    public function initialize(): void {
        $descriptorspec = [
            0 => ["pipe", "r"],  // stdin
            1 => ["pipe", "w"],  // stdout
            2 => ["pipe", "w"]   // stderr
        ];

        $this->stream = proc_open($this->command, $descriptorspec, $pipes);

        if (!is_resource($this->stream)) {
            throw new Exception("Failed to start the subprocess.");
        }

        $this->in = $pipes[0];
        $this->out = $pipes[1];
        fclose($pipes[2]); // Close stderr as we are not using it
    }

    public function terminate(): void {
        if (is_resource($this->in)) {
            fclose($this->in);
        }
        if (is_resource($this->out)) {
            fclose($this->out);
        }
        if (is_resource($this->stream)) {
            proc_close($this->stream);
        }
    }

    public function getReadConnectionDescription(): string {
        return stream_get_meta_data($this->out)['uri'];
    }
}

Task Description: Create a function that executes a shell command and captures its standard output and error streams using PHP's proc_open.

Function Description: The function should execute a given shell command, capture both stdout and stderr streams, properly close all resources, and return the exit code of the process. It should handle cases where process creation fails.

Input:
- $command: string - The shell command to execute
- &$stdout: ?string (optional reference) - Variable to store the standard output
- &$stderr: ?string (optional reference) - Variable to store the standard error

Output:
- int - The exit code of the executed process. Returns -1 if process creation fails.
matched_results:
<?php
function executeShellCommand(string $command, ?string &$stdout = null, ?string &$stderr = null): int {
    $descriptorspec = [
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],  // stdout
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']   // stderr
    ];

    $process = proc_open($command, $descriptorspec, $pipes);

    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        return -1;
    }

    $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[1]);

    $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
    fclose($pipes[2]);

    $exitCode = proc_close($process);

    return $exitCode;
}
?>

    ];

    if (!is_resource($process)) {

    fclose($pipes[1]);

}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that executes system commands using various PHP execution methods, with fallback options from most to least preferred, and returns the command output along with execution method information.

Function Description: The function attempts to execute a system command using multiple PHP execution methods in a prioritized order (COM, exec, shell_exec, system, passthru, popen, proc_open). It handles both Windows and Unix-like systems, sets the working directory, and properly manages process pipes and resources. The function returns the command output and indicates which execution method was successful.

Input:
- $cmd: [string] - The system command to be executed
- $cwd: [string] - The working directory where the command should be executed
- $com: [bool] (optional) - Flag to force using COM method on Windows (default: false)

Output:
- Returns [array] with two elements:
  - 'res': [string] - The output from the executed command
  - 'msg': [string] - Status message indicating the execution method used or NULL if no output

Task Description: Create a PHP helper class for executing system commands and handling inter-process communication using pipes.

Class Description: ProcessHelper is a utility class designed to execute system commands in a cross-platform manner (supporting both Windows and Unix-like systems). It provides a clean interface for running commands, capturing their output and errors, and properly managing process resources.

Methods:

Method1: run(string $command, string $cwd = null) -> array - Executes a system command and returns the exit code, output, and error messages. The method uses proc_open to create pipes for inter-process communication, properly handles resource cleanup, and returns trimmed output strings.

Input:
- $command: [string] - The system command to be executed
- $cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the command (optional)

Output:
- Returns [array] containing three elements:
  1. [int] Exit code of the process (0 typically indicates success)
  2. [string] Standard output from the command (trimmed)
  3. [string] Error output from the command (trimmed)

Throws:
- RuntimeException if the process cannot be started

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using cURL with support for various HTTP methods, custom headers, and JSON response handling.

Function Description: The function should initialize a cURL session, configure it based on input parameters, execute the request, handle errors, process the response, and return a structured result including status, headers, and response body. It should support GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, and OPTIONS methods, with options for custom headers, additional cURL options, JSON response parsing, and timeout configuration.

Input:
- $url (string): The target URL for the HTTP request
- $method (string, optional, default='GET'): HTTP method (GET|POST|PUT|DELETE|PATCH|OPTIONS)
- $data (mixed, optional, default=false): Request payload data
- $headers (mixed, optional, default=false): Request headers (string or array)
- $options (mixed, optional, default=false): Additional cURL options as array
- $json (bool, optional, default=false): Whether to parse response as JSON
- $timeout (int, optional, default=3600): Request timeout in seconds

Output:
Returns an associative array containing:
- 'data': Response body (parsed as array if $json=true and valid JSON)
- 'status': Boolean indicating success (HTTP status 200-299)
- 'code': HTTP status code
- 'header': Parsed response headers as associative array

In case of cURL errors:
- 'data': Error message
- 'code': 0
- 'header': cURL info array

Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages the execution of a subprocess using proc_open, handles input/output through pipes, and provides timeout functionality for process execution.

Class Description: DefaultPhpProcess is a class that extends AbstractPhpProcess and provides concrete implementation for running PHP jobs in a subprocess. It handles process creation, I/O management through pipes, timeout enforcement, and resource cleanup.

Attributes:
tempFile: string - Temporary file path used for storing job input when stdin is not used
stdin: mixed - Input source for the subprocess
env: array - Environment variables for the subprocess
timeout: int - Maximum execution time in seconds before process termination

Methods:
runJob(string $job, array $settings = []) -> array - Executes a PHP job with optional settings, returns output and error
getHandles() -> array - Returns empty array by default, can be overridden to provide custom handles
runProcess(string $job, array $settings) -> array - Core method that manages process execution and I/O handling
process(resource $pipe, string $job) -> void - Writes job input to the process pipe
cleanup() -> void - Cleans up temporary resources (files)
useTemporaryFile() -> bool - Determines whether to use temporary files for input (default false)

<?php

abstract class AbstractPhpProcess
{
    abstract protected function runJob(string $job, array $settings = []): array;
    abstract protected function getHandles(): array;
    abstract protected function runProcess(string $job, array $settings): array;
    abstract protected function process($pipe, string $job): void;
    abstract protected function cleanup(): void;
    abstract protected function useTemporaryFile(): bool;
}

class DefaultPhpProcess extends AbstractPhpProcess
{
    protected $tempFile;
    protected $stdin;
    protected $env;
    protected $timeout;

    public function __construct($stdin = null, array $env = [], int $timeout = 60)
    {
        $this->stdin = $stdin;
        $this->env = $env;
        $this->timeout = $timeout;
        $this->tempFile = tempnam(sys_get_temp_dir(), 'php_process_');
    }

    public function runJob(string $job, array $settings = []): array
    {
        return $this->runProcess($job, $settings);
    }

    protected function getHandles(): array
    {
        return [];
    }

    protected function runProcess(string $job, array $settings): array
    {
        $descriptors = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
            2 => ['pipe', 'w']
        ];

        $process = proc_open('php', $descriptors, $pipes, null, $this->env);

        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('Unable to start the process.');
        }

        if ($this->useTemporaryFile()) {
            file_put_contents($this->tempFile, $job);
            $this->process($pipes[0], $this->tempFile);
        } else {
            $this->process($pipes[0], $job);
        }

        fclose($pipes[0]);

        $output = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
        fclose($pipes[1]);

        $error = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);

        $status = proc_close($process);

        $this->cleanup();

        return [
            'output' => $output,
            'error' => $error,
            'status' => $status
        ];
    }

    protected function process($pipe, string $job): void
    {
        if ($this->useTemporaryFile()) {
            fwrite($pipe, file_get_contents($job));
        } else {
            fwrite($pipe, $job);
        }
    }

    protected function cleanup(): void
    {
        if (file_exists($this->tempFile)) {
            unlink($this->tempFile);
        }
    }

    protected function useTemporaryFile(): bool
    {
        return false;
    }
}

    private int $timeout;

    public function __construct($stdin = null, array $env = [], int $timeout = 60)
    {
        $this->stdin = $stdin;
        $this->env = $env;
        $this->timeout = $timeout;
        $this->tempFile = tempnam(sys_get_temp_dir(), 'php_process_');
    }

    public function runJob(string $job, array $settings = []): array
    {
        return $this->runProcess($job, $settings);
    }

    protected function getHandles(): array
    {
        return [];
    }

    private function runProcess(string $job, array $settings): array
    {
        $descriptors = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
            2 => ['pipe', 'w']
        ];

        $process = proc_open('php', $descriptors, $pipes, null, $this->env);

        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('Unable to start the process.');
        }

        if ($this->useTemporaryFile()) {
            file_put_contents($this->tempFile, $job);
            $this->process($pipes[0], file_get_contents($this->tempFile));
        } else {
            $this->process($pipes[0], $job);
        }

        fclose($pipes[0]);

        $output = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
        fclose($pipes[1]);

        $error = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);

        $status = proc_get_status($process);
        if ($status['running']) {
            proc_terminate($process);
        }

        proc_close($process);
        $this->cleanup();

        return ['output' => $output, 'error' => $error];
    }

    private function process($pipe, string $job): void

        fwrite($pipe, $job);
    }

    private function cleanup(): void
    {
        if (file_exists($this->tempFile)) {
            unlink($this->tempFile);
        }
    }

    private function useTemporaryFile(): bool
    {
        return $this->stdin === null;
    }

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles inter-process communication (IPC) using proc_open to execute external commands, manage input/output streams, and handle errors.

Class Description: The ProcessHandler class manages subprocess execution via proc_open, providing methods to write input to the process, read output/errors, and properly clean up resources. It extends Monolog's AbstractProcessingHandler for logging integration.

Attributes:
- process: [resource|null] - The subprocess resource handle or null if not running
- command: [string] - The command to execute in the subprocess
- cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the subprocess or null for default
- pipes: [array] - Array of file pointers for process pipes (stdin, stdout, stderr)

Methods:
- __construct(string $command, $level = Logger::DEBUG, bool $bubble = true, ?string $cwd = null) -> [void] - Initializes the handler with command and optional working directory
- write(array $record) -> [void] - Writes formatted log record to process stdin (inherited from AbstractProcessingHandler)
- close() -> [void] - Closes all pipes and terminates the process
- ensureProcessIsStarted() -> [void] - Starts the process if not already running
- startProcess() -> [void] - Executes proc_open to start the subprocess
- handleStartupErrors() -> [void] - Checks for and handles any startup errors
- selectErrorStream() -> [int|false] - Monitors stderr for error output
- readProcessErrors() -> [string] - Reads and returns content from stderr
- writeProcessInput(string $string) -> [void] - Writes data to process stdin

<?php

use Monolog\Handler\AbstractProcessingHandler;
use Monolog\Logger;

class ProcessHandler extends AbstractProcessingHandler
{
    private $process = null;
    private $command;
    private $cwd;
    private $pipes = [];

    public function __construct(string $command, $level = Logger::DEBUG, bool $bubble = true, ?string $cwd = null)
    {
        parent::__construct($level, $bubble);
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
    }

    protected function write(array $record): void
    {
        $this->ensureProcessIsStarted();
        $this->writeProcessInput($record['formatted']);
    }

    public function close(): void
    {
        if (is_resource($this->process)) {
            foreach ($this->pipes as $pipe) {
                fclose($pipe);
            }
            proc_close($this->process);
            $this->process = null;
        }
    }

    private function ensureProcessIsStarted(): void
    {
        if (!is_resource($this->process)) {
            $this->startProcess();
        }
    }

    private function startProcess(): void
    {
        $descriptorSpec = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'], // stdin
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'], // stdout
            2 => ['pipe', 'w'], // stderr
        ];

        $this->process = proc_open($this->command, $descriptorSpec, $this->pipes, $this->cwd);

        if (!is_resource($this->process)) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('Unable to start the process.');
        }

        $this->handleStartupErrors();
    }

    private function handleStartupErrors(): void
    {
        $errorStream = $this->selectErrorStream();
        if ($errorStream !== false) {
            $errors = $this->readProcessErrors();
            if (!empty($errors)) {
                throw new \RuntimeException('Process startup errors: ' . $errors);
            }
        }
    }

    private function selectErrorStream()
    {
        $read = [$this->pipes[2]];
        $write = null;
        $except = null;
        return stream_select($read, $write, $except, 0);
    }

    private function readProcessErrors(): string
    {
        $errors = '';
        while ($line = fgets($this->pipes[2])) {
            $errors .= $line;
        }
        return $errors;
    }

    private function writeProcessInput(string $string): void
    {
        fwrite($this->pipes[0], $string);
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles interactions with the Alipay payment gateway, specifically for transferring funds to Alipay accounts. The class should handle request signing, HTTP communication, and response processing.

Class Description: The AlipayService class provides functionality to interact with Alipay's fund transfer API. It handles request signing using RSA, constructs proper API requests, and processes responses. The class manages authentication credentials and provides methods for executing fund transfers.

Attributes:
- appId: string - Alipay application ID
- rsaPrivateKey: string - RSA private key for request signing
- alipayRootCertSn: string - Alipay root certificate serial number
- appCertSn: string - Application certificate serial number
- charset: string - Character encoding (default: 'utf-8')

Methods:
- __construct(string $appid, string $saPrivateKey) -> void - Initializes the service with app ID and private key
- setAlipayRootCertSn(string $alipayRootCertSn) -> void - Sets the Alipay root certificate serial number
- setAppCertSn(string $appCertSn) -> void - Sets the application certificate serial number
- doTransfer(float $totalFee, string $outTradeNo, string $account, string $realName, string $remark='') -> array - Executes a fund transfer with given parameters
- curlPost(string $url='', mixed $postData='', array $options=array()) -> string - Sends a POST request using cURL
- generateSign(array $params, string $signType="RSA") -> string - Generates a signature for request parameters
- sign(string $data, string $signType="RSA") -> string - Signs data using RSA
- checkEmpty(mixed $value) -> bool - Checks if a value is empty
- getSignContent(array $params) -> string - Prepares parameters for signing
- characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) -> string - Converts character encoding

<?php

class AlipayService {
    private $appId;
    private $rsaPrivateKey;
    private $alipayRootCertSn;
    private $appCertSn;
    private $charset = 'utf-8';

    public function __construct($appId, $rsaPrivateKey) {
        $this->appId = $appId;
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setAlipayRootCertSn($alipayRootCertSn) {
        $this->alipayRootCertSn = $alipayRootCertSn;
    }

    public function setAppCertSn($appCertSn) {
        $this->appCertSn = $appCertSn;
    }

    public function doTransfer($totalFee, $outTradeNo, $account, $realName, $remark='') {
        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'method' => 'alipay.fund.trans.toaccount.transfer',
            'format' => 'json',
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA',
            'timestamp' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s'),
            'version' => '1.0',
            'biz_content' => json_encode([
                'out_biz_no' => $outTradeNo,
                'payee_type' => 'ALIPAY_LOGONID',
                'payee_account' => $account,
                'amount' => $totalFee,
                'payer_show_name' => $realName,
                'remark' => $remark
            ])
        ];

        $params['sign'] = $this->generateSign($params);
        $url = 'https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do';
        $response = $this->curlPost($url, $params);
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    private function curlPost($url='', $postData='', $options=array()) {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));
        if (!empty($options)) {
            curl_setopt_array($ch, $options);
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    private function generateSign($params, $signType="RSA") {
        return $this->sign($this->getSignContent($params), $signType);
    }

    private function sign($data, $signType="RSA") {
        $res = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
        $sign = '';
        if ("RSA2" == $signType) {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
        } else {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA1);
        }
        openssl_free_key($res);
        return base64_encode($sign);
    }

    private function checkEmpty($value) {
        return !isset($value) || trim($value) === '';
    }

    private function getSignContent($params) {
        ksort($params);
        $stringToBeSigned = "";
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if (!$this->checkEmpty($v) && "@" != substr($v, 0, 1)) {
                $stringToBeSigned .= "$k=$v&";
            }
        }
        return trim($stringToBeSigned, '&');
    }

    private function characet($data, $targetCharset) {
        if (!empty($data)) {
            $fileType = $this->charset;
            if (strcasecmp($fileType, $targetCharset) != 0) {
                $data = mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, $fileType);
            }
        }
        return $data;
    }
}

class AlipayService {

        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setAlipayRootCertSn($alipayRootCertSn) {
        $this->alipayRootCertSn = $alipayRootCertSn;
    }

    public function setAppCertSn($appCertSn) {
        $this->appCertSn = $appCertSn;
    }

    public function doTransfer($totalFee, $outTradeNo, $account, $realName, $remark = '') {
        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'method' => 'alipay.fund.trans.toaccount.transfer',
            'format' => 'json',
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA',
            'timestamp' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s'),
            'version' => '1.0',
            'biz_content' => json_encode([
                'out_biz_no' => $outTradeNo,
                'payee_type' => 'ALIPAY_LOGONID',
                'payee_account' => $account,
                'amount' => $totalFee,
                'payer_show_name' => $realName,
                'remark' => $remark
            ])
        ];

        $params['sign'] = $this->generateSign($params);
        $response = $this->curlPost('https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do', $params);
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    private function curlPost($url = '', $postData = '', $options = []) {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        if (!empty($options)) {
            curl_setopt_array($ch, $options);
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    private function generateSign($params, $signType = "RSA") {
        return $this->sign($this->getSignContent($params), $signType);
    }

    private function sign($data, $signType = "RSA") {
        $res = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
        $sign = '';
        if ("RSA2" == $signType) {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
        } else {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res);
        }
        openssl_free_key($res);
        return base64_encode($sign);
    }

    private function checkEmpty($value) {
        return !isset($value) || trim($value) === '';
    }

    private function getSignContent($params) {
        ksort($params);
        $stringToBeSigned = "";
        $i = 0;
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if ($this->checkEmpty($v) || $k == "sign") {
                continue;
            }
            if ($i == 0) {
                $stringToBeSigned .= "$k" . "=" . "$v";
            } else {
                $stringToBeSigned .= "&" . "$k" . "=" . "$v";
            }
            $i++;
        }
        return $stringToBeSigned;
    }

    private function characet($data, $targetCharset) {
        if (!empty($data)) {
            $fileType = $this->charset;
            if (strcasecmp($fileType, $targetCharset) != 0) {
                $data = mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, $fileType);
            }
        }
        return $data;
    }
}

class AlipayService
{
    private $appId;
    private $rsaPrivateKey;
    private $alipayRootCertSn;
    private $appCertSn;
    private $charset;

    public function __construct($appId, $rsaPrivateKey)
    {
        $this->appId = $appId;
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
        $this->charset = 'utf-8';
    }

    public function setAlipayRootCertSn($alipayRootCertSn)
    {
        $this->alipayRootCertSn = $alipayRootCertSn;
    }

    public function setAppCertSn($appCertSn)
    {
        $this->appCertSn = $appCertSn;
    }

    public function doTransfer($totalFee, $outTradeNo, $account, $realName, $remark = '')
    {
        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'method' => 'alipay.fund.trans.toaccount.transfer',
            'format' => 'JSON',
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA2',
            'timestamp' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s'),
            'version' => '1.0',
            'biz_content' => json_encode([
                'out_biz_no' => $outTradeNo,
                'payee_type' => 'ALIPAY_LOGONID',
                'payee_account' => $account,
                'amount' => $totalFee,
                'payer_show_name' => $realName,
                'remark' => $remark
            ])
        ];

        $params['sign'] = $this->generateSign($params, 'RSA2');
        $response = $this->curlPost('https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do', $params);
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    private function curlPost($url = '', $postData = '', $options = [])
    {
        if (is_array($postData)) {
            $postData = http_build_query($postData);
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

        if (!empty($options)) {
            curl_setopt_array($ch, $options);
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        return $response;
    }

    private function generateSign($params, $signType = "RSA")
    {
        return $this->sign($this->getSignContent($params), $signType);
    }

    private function sign($data, $signType = "RSA")
    {
        $res = "-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\n" .
            wordwrap($this->rsaPrivateKey, 64, "\n", true) .
            "\n-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----";

        if ($signType == "RSA2") {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
        } else {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res);
        }

        return base64_encode($sign);
    }

    private function checkEmpty($value)
    {
        if (!isset($value)) {
            return true;
        }
        if ($value === null) {
            return true;
        }
        if (trim($value) === "") {
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    }

    private function getSignContent($params)
    {
        ksort($params);
        $stringToBeSigned = "";
        $i = 0;
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if ($this->checkEmpty($v) === false && "@" != substr($v, 0, 1)) {
                if ($i == 0) {
                    $stringToBeSigned .= "$k" . "=" . "$v";
                } else {
                    $stringToBeSigned .= "&" . "$k" . "=" . "$v";
                }
                $i++;
            }
        }
        return $stringToBeSigned;
    }

    private function characet($data, $targetCharset)
    {
        if (!empty($data)) {
            $fileType = $this->charset;
            if (strcasecmp($fileType, $targetCharset) != 0) {
                $data = mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, $fileType);
            }
        }
        return $data;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests using cURL for sending upgrade notifications, with error handling and response processing capabilities.

Class Description: UpgradeNoticeBehavior is a class designed to manage HTTP communications for upgrade notifications. It encapsulates cURL functionality to send requests to specified URLs, handle parameters and headers, process responses, and manage errors.

Attributes:
header_: [string] - Stores HTTP headers for requests
httpCode_: [int] - Stores HTTP status code from responses
httpDesc_: [string] - Stores HTTP status description from responses
accesskey_: [string] - Stores access key for authentication
secretkey_: [string] - Stores secret key for authentication

Methods:
send: [send]([string $url, array $params = array(), array $headers = array()]) -> [mixed] - Sends an HTTP request to the specified URL with optional parameters and headers. Returns the decoded JSON response on success or false on failure. Handles cURL errors and invalid response formats.

<?php

class UpgradeNoticeBehavior {
    private $header_ = [];
    private $httpCode_;
    private $httpDesc_;
    private $accesskey_;
    private $secretkey_;

    public function __construct($accesskey, $secretkey) {
        $this->accesskey_ = $accesskey;
        $this->secretkey_ = $secretkey;
    }

    public function send($url, $params = [], $headers = []) {
        $ch = curl_init();

        if ($params) {
            $url .= '?' . http_build_query($params);
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);

        if ($headers) {
            $this->header_ = array_merge($this->header_, $headers);
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $this->header_);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $this->httpCode_ = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $this->httpDesc_ = curl_error($ch);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }

        curl_close($ch);

        $decodedResponse = json_decode($response, true);

        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            return false;
        }

        return $decodedResponse;
    }

    public function getHttpCode() {
        return $this->httpCode_;
    }

    public function getHttpDesc() {
        return $this->httpDesc_;
    }
}

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $this->header_);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $error_msg = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }

        $this->httpCode_ = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $this->httpDesc_ = $this->getHttpStatusDesc($this->httpCode_);

        curl_close($ch);

        $decodedResponse = json_decode($response, true);

        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            return false;
        }

        return $decodedResponse;
    }

    private function getHttpStatusDesc($code) {
        $status = [
            200 => 'OK',
            400 => 'Bad Request',
            401 => 'Unauthorized',
            403 => 'Forbidden',
            404 => 'Not Found',
            500 => 'Internal Server Error',
            502 => 'Bad Gateway',
            503 => 'Service Unavailable'
        ];

        return isset($status[$code]) ? $status[$code] : 'Unknown Status';
    }
}

<?php
class UpgradeNoticeBehavior {
    private $header_ = [];
    private $httpCode_;
    private $httpDesc_;
    private $accesskey_;
    private $secretkey_;

    public function __construct($accesskey, $secretkey) {
        $this->accesskey_ = $accesskey;
        $this->secretkey_ = $secretkey;
    }

    public function send($url, $params = array(), $headers = array()) {
        $ch = curl_init();

        if (!empty($params)) {
            $url .= '?' . http_build_query($params);
        }

        $defaultHeaders = [
            'Content-Type: application/json',
            'Access-Key: ' . $this->accesskey_,
            'Secret-Key: ' . $this->secretkey_
        ];

        $headers = array_merge($defaultHeaders, $headers);

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $this->httpDesc_ = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }

        $this->httpCode_ = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($this->httpCode_ >= 200 && $this->httpCode_ < 300) {
            $decodedResponse = json_decode($response, true);
            if (json_last_error() === JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
                return $decodedResponse;
            } else {
                $this->httpDesc_ = 'Invalid JSON response';
                return false;
            }
        } else {
            $this->httpDesc_ = 'HTTP Error: ' . $this->httpCode_;
            return false;
        }
    }

    public function getHttpCode() {
        return $this->httpCode_;
    }

    public function getHttpDesc() {
        return $this->httpDesc_;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests using cURL with support for custom headers, payloads, and proxy configuration.

Class Description: The Meting class provides functionality to make HTTP requests using PHP's cURL library. It supports GET/POST requests, custom headers, timeout settings, retry mechanism, and proxy configuration.

Attributes:
- header: array - Stores HTTP headers to be sent with the request
- proxy: string - Stores proxy server address if configured
- raw: mixed - Stores the raw response from the cURL request
- info: array - Stores cURL request information
- error: int - Stores cURL error code if any
- status: string - Stores cURL error message if any

Methods:
- curl(string $url, mixed $payload = null, int $headerOnly = 0) -> self - Makes an HTTP request to the specified URL with optional payload and header-only response flag. Returns the class instance for method chaining.
  Parameters:
    - $url: string - The target URL for the request
    - $payload: mixed - Optional request payload (array or string)
    - $headerOnly: int - Flag to return only headers (1) or full response (0)

<?php

class Meting {
    private $header = [];
    private $proxy = '';
    private $raw;
    private $info = [];
    private $error = 0;
    private $status = '';

    public function setHeader(array $header) {
        $this->header = $header;
        return $this;
    }

    public function setProxy(string $proxy) {
        $this->proxy = $proxy;
        return $this;
    }

    public function getRaw() {
        return $this->raw;
    }

    public function getInfo() {
        return $this->info;
    }

    public function getError() {
        return $this->error;
    }

    public function getStatus() {
        return $this->status;
    }

    public function curl(string $url, $payload = null, int $headerOnly = 0) {
        $ch = curl_init();

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, $headerOnly);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);

        if (!empty($this->header)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $this->header);
        }

        if (!empty($this->proxy)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, $this->proxy);
        }

        if ($payload !== null) {
            if (is_array($payload)) {
                $payload = http_build_query($payload);
            }
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $payload);
        }

        $this->raw = curl_exec($ch);
        $this->info = curl_getinfo($ch);
        $this->error = curl_errno($ch);
        $this->status = curl_error($ch);

        curl_close($ch);

        return $this;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class for handling HTTP requests to interact with WeChat Pay API, supporting both GET and POST methods with proper SSL configuration.

Class Description: The Wechatpay class provides methods for making HTTP requests to WeChat Pay API endpoints. It handles both GET and POST requests, with special consideration for HTTPS connections and SSL configuration. The class includes error handling through HTTP status codes.

Methods:

Method1: http_get(string $url) -> string|false - Performs a GET request to the specified URL. Returns the response content if successful (HTTP 200), or false otherwise.
Method2: http_post(string $url, array $param, bool $post_file=false) -> string|false - Performs a POST request to the specified URL with given parameters. Handles both regular form data and file uploads. Returns the response content if successful (HTTP 200), or false otherwise.
matched_results:
<?php

class Wechatpay {
    private $sslCertPath;
    private $sslKeyPath;

    public function __construct($sslCertPath, $sslKeyPath) {
        $this->sslCertPath = $sslCertPath;
        $this->sslKeyPath = $sslKeyPath;
    }

    public function http_get($url) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSLCERT, $this->sslCertPath);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSLKEY, $this->sslKeyPath);
        
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($httpCode == 200) {
            return $response;
        } else {
            return false;
        }
    }

    public function http_post($url, $param, $post_file = false) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSLCERT, $this->sslCertPath);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSLKEY, $this->sslKeyPath);

        if ($post_file) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $param);
        } else {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($param));
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($httpCode == 200) {
            return $response;
        } else {
            return false;
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using Guzzle library to download files and fetch GitHub release information.

Class Description: The HttpClient class provides methods for downloading remote files via HTTP and retrieving GitHub release information (both stable and pre-release) using the Guzzle HTTP client library.

Attributes:
- client: [Client] - Guzzle HTTP client instance used for making requests

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the Guzzle HTTP client instance
- getSourceFile(string $fileName, string $savePath, string $url) -> [bool] - Downloads a file from the specified URL and saves it to the given path
- getLatestReleaseTagName(string $repo) -> [string] - Gets the latest stable release tag name from a GitHub repository
- getLatestPreReleaseTagName(string $repo) -> [string] - Gets the latest pre-release tag name from a GitHub repository
unmatched_results:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class HttpClient
{
    private $client;

    public function __construct()
    {
        $this->client = new Client();
    }

    public function getSourceFile(string $fileName, string $savePath, string $url): bool
    {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->get($url, ['sink' => $savePath . '/' . $fileName]);
            return $response->getStatusCode() === 200;
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return false;
        }
    }

    public function getLatestReleaseTagName(string $repo): string
    {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->get("https://api.github.com/repos/$repo/releases/latest");
            $data = json_decode($response->getBody(), true);
            return $data['tag_name'] ?? '';
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return '';
        }
    }

    public function getLatestPreReleaseTagName(string $repo): string
    {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->get("https://api.github.com/repos/$repo/releases");
            $data = json_decode($response->getBody(), true);
            foreach ($data as $release) {
                if ($release['prerelease']) {
                    return $release['tag_name'];
                }
            }
            return '';
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return '';
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that sends a POST request to a specified URL with given data using cURL and returns the response.

Function Description: The function initializes a cURL session, configures it for a POST request with the provided URL and data, sets various options including timeouts and SSL verification settings, executes the request, and returns the response. It handles the entire lifecycle of the cURL session from initialization to cleanup.

Input:
- $url (string): The target URL to which the POST request will be sent
- $data (mixed): The data to be sent with the POST request (can be an array or string)

Output:
- Returns the response from the server as a string if the request is successful
- Returns false if the request fails (though error handling could be enhanced in a production environment)
matched_results:
<?php

function sendPostRequest($url, $data) {
    $ch = curl_init();

    if (is_array($data)) {
        $data = http_build_query($data);
    }

    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);

    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        curl_close($ch);
        return false;
    }

    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}

?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a class that handles file downloads using cURL in PHP, with support for temporary file management and cleanup.

Class Description: The CurlDownloader class provides functionality to download files from a given URL using cURL, storing them in a temporary directory, and managing the downloaded files' lifecycle.

Attributes:
- tempDir: string - The directory path where temporary files will be stored. Defaults to system temp directory if not specified.
- outputFile: string - The path to the downloaded file.

Methods:
- setTempDir(string $tempDir) -> void - Sets the temporary directory for storing downloaded files.
- download(string $url) -> bool - Downloads a file from the specified URL using cURL. Returns true on success, throws ErrorException on failure.
- getFilename() -> string - Returns the path to the downloaded file.
- cleanup() -> void - Removes the downloaded file if it exists.

Input:
- For setTempDir(): A string representing the directory path.
- For download(): A string representing the URL to download from.

Output:
- For download(): A boolean indicating success (true) or failure (false).
- For getFilename(): A string representing the path to the downloaded file.
- Other methods do not return values.
matched_results:
<?php

class CurlDownloader {
    private $tempDir;
    private $outputFile;

    public function __construct($tempDir = null) {
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir ?: sys_get_temp_dir();
    }

    public function setTempDir($tempDir) {
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir;
    }

    public function download($url) {
        $this->outputFile = tempnam($this->tempDir, 'curl_');
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'w');

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);

        $success = curl_exec($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);

        curl_close($ch);
        fclose($fp);

        if (!$success) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            throw new ErrorException("cURL error: $error");
        }

        return true;
    }

    public function getFilename() {
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    public function cleanup() {
        if (file_exists($this->outputFile)) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Qiniu storage client class in PHP that handles HTTP requests to Qiniu's cloud storage service, including file uploads, downloads, and management operations.

Class Description: QiniuStorage is a client class for interacting with Qiniu's cloud storage service. It provides methods for making HTTP requests to Qiniu's API endpoints with proper headers and request handling.

Attributes:
- QINIU_RSF_HOST: string - Qiniu's RSF (Resource List) API host
- QINIU_RS_HOST: string - Qiniu's RS (Resource Management) API host  
- QINIU_UP_HOST: string - Qiniu's file upload API host
- timeout: string - Request timeout duration
- error: string - Last error message
- errorStr: string - Detailed error information

Methods:
- request(string $path, string $method, array|null $headers = null, mixed $body = null) -> mixed - Makes an HTTP request to Qiniu's API. Handles request setup, execution, and response processing.
- response(string $text) -> array - Processes the response text and extracts JSON data from headers.
- error(string $header, string $body) -> void - Handles error responses by parsing status codes and error messages.

Input Parameters for request():
- $path: string - The API endpoint path
- $method: string - HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, HEAD)
- $headers: array|null - Optional request headers
- $body: mixed - Request payload (can be string or resource)

Output for request():
- Returns response body for successful GET requests
- Returns parsed response array for other successful requests  
- Returns false on failure and sets error information

Input Parameters for response():
- $text: string - Raw response text with headers

Output for response():
- array - Parsed JSON data from response

Input Parameters for error():
- $header: string - Response header
- $body: string - Response body

Output for error():
- void - Sets error and errorStr properties

<?php

class QiniuStorage {
    const QINIU_RSF_HOST = 'http://rsf.qbox.me';
    const QINIU_RS_HOST = 'http://rs.qbox.me';
    const QINIU_UP_HOST = 'http://upload.qiniu.com';
    
    private $timeout = 30;
    private $error;
    private $errorStr;

    public function request($path, $method, $headers = null, $body = null) {
        $url = self::QINIU_RS_HOST . $path;
        $ch = curl_init();
        
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $this->timeout);
        
        if ($headers) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }
        
        if ($body) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $body);
        }
        
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        
        if ($response === false || $httpCode >= 400) {
            $this->error = curl_error($ch);
            $this->errorStr = "HTTP Code: $httpCode, Response: $response";
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }
        
        curl_close($ch);
        
        if ($method === 'GET') {
            return $response;
        }
        
        return $this->response($response);
    }

    private function response($text) {
        $headerSize = strpos($text, "\r\n\r\n") + 4;
        $header = substr($text, 0, $headerSize);
        $body = substr($text, $headerSize);
        
        return json_decode($body, true);
    }

    private function error($header, $body) {
        $this->error = "Error in response";
        $this->errorStr = "Header: $header, Body: $body";
    }

    public function getError() {
        return $this->error;
    }

    public function getErrorStr() {
        return $this->errorStr;
    }
}

    private $timeout = 30;
    private $error = '';

        $url = self::QINIU_RS_HOST . $path;
        $ch = curl_init();

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $this->timeout);

        if ($headers) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }

        if ($body) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $body);
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

        if ($response === false || $httpCode >= 400) {
            $this->error = curl_error($ch);
            $this->errorStr = $response;
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }

        curl_close($ch);

        if ($method === 'GET') {
            return $response;
        }

        return $this->response($response);

        $headerSize = strpos($text, "\r\n\r\n") + 4;
        $header = substr($text, 0, $headerSize);

        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            $this->error = 'Invalid JSON response';
            $this->errorStr = $body;
            return false;

        return $json;

    private $errorStr = '';

        $url = $this->getUrl($path);
        $ch = curl_init();
        
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $this->timeout);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        
        if ($response === false || $httpCode >= 400) {
            $this->error(curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_OUT), $response);
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }
        
        curl_close($ch);
        
        if ($method === 'GET') {
            return $response;
        }
        
        return $this->response($response);

            return self::QINIU_RS_HOST . $path;
        } else {
            return self::QINIU_UP_HOST . $path;

        $headerSize = strpos($text, "\r\n\r\n") + 4;
        $header = substr($text, 0, $headerSize);

        $json = json_decode($body, true);
        
        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {

        return $json;

        $this->errorStr = "Header: $header\nBody: $body";

            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'PUT');
            if ($body) {

            }
        } elseif ($method === 'HEAD') {

        }

            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }
        
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        
        if ($response === false || $httpCode >= 400) {
            $this->error = curl_error($ch);
            $this->errorStr = $response;
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }
        
        curl_close($ch);
        
        if ($method === 'GET') {
            return $response;
        }
        
        return $this->response($response);
    }

    private function response($text) {
        $headerSize = strpos($text, "\r\n\r\n") + 4;
        $header = substr($text, 0, $headerSize);
        $body = substr($text, $headerSize);
        
        $json = json_decode($body, true);
        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            $this->error = 'Invalid JSON response';
            $this->errorStr = $body;
            return false;
        }
        
        return $json;
    }

    private function error($header, $body) {
        $this->error = 'HTTP error';
        $this->errorStr = $body;
    }
