        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            return curl_error($ch);
        }
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    private function generateSign($params, $signType = "RSA")
    {
        ksort($params);
        $stringToBeSigned = "";
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if (false === $this->checkEmpty($v) && "@" != substr($v, 0, 1)) {

        openssl_sign($stringToBeSigned, $sign, $res, $algo);
        $sign = base64_encode($sign);

    private function checkEmpty($value)
    {
        if (!isset($value)) {

        }

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests using cURL with file writing capabilities, including error handling and response status checking.

Class Description: The timthumb class provides functionality to fetch remote URLs using cURL with controlled file writing, including size limitations and error handling. It falls back to file_get_contents if cURL is not available.

Attributes:
- $curlFH: [resource|false] - File handle for writing cURL response data
- $curlDataWritten: [int] - Tracks the amount of data written during cURL transfer
- $lastURLError: [string|false] - Stores the last URL fetch error message

Methods:
- curlWrite($h, $d) -> [int] - Static callback function for cURL write operation that writes data to file and enforces size limits
  - $h: [resource] - cURL handle
  - $d: [string] - Data to write
  - Returns: [int] - Number of bytes written (0 if size limit exceeded)

- getURL($url, $tempfile) -> [bool] - Fetches content from a URL and saves it to a temporary file
  - $url: [string] - URL to fetch
  - $tempfile: [string] - Path to temporary file for storing the response
  - Returns: [bool] - True on success, False on failure
  - Side effects: Sets $lastURLError on failure, may call set404() or error() methods
matched_results:
<?php

class timthumb {
    private $curlFH = false;
    private $curlDataWritten = 0;
    private $lastURLError = false;

    private static function curlWrite($h, $d) {
        $instance = self::getInstance();
        $len = strlen($d);
        if ($instance->curlDataWritten + $len > MAX_FILE_SIZE) {
            return 0;
        }
        $instance->curlDataWritten += $len;
        fwrite($instance->curlFH, $d);
        return $len;
    }

    public function getURL($url, $tempfile) {
        $this->lastURLError = false;
        $this->curlDataWritten = 0;
        $this->curlFH = fopen($tempfile, 'w');
        if (!$this->curlFH) {
            $this->lastURLError = 'Failed to open temp file';
            return false;
        }

        if (function_exists('curl_init')) {
            $ch = curl_init($url);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, array($this, 'curlWrite'));
            $data = curl_exec($ch);
            if (curl_errno($ch)) {
                $this->lastURLError = curl_error($ch);
                curl_close($ch);
                fclose($this->curlFH);
                return false;
            }
            curl_close($ch);
        } else {
            $data = file_get_contents($url);
            if ($data === false) {
                $this->lastURLError = 'Failed to fetch URL';
                fclose($this->curlFH);
                return false;
            }
            fwrite($this->curlFH, $data);
        }

        fclose($this->curlFH);
        return true;
    }

    private static function getInstance() {
        static $instance = null;
        if ($instance === null) {
            $instance = new self();
        }
        return $instance;
    }
}

define('MAX_FILE_SIZE', 1048576); // 1MB

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client using cURL for making HTTP requests with support for various methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH), custom headers, and request/response logging.

Class Description: The Curl class is an HTTP client implementation that uses PHP's cURL extension to send HTTP requests and handle responses. It supports common HTTP methods, allows configuration of cURL options, handles request headers and parameters, and provides detailed response information including headers, status code, and body.

Attributes:

curlOptions: [array] - Default cURL options including timeout, SSL verification, redirects, etc.
requestArguments: [array] - Stores the current request parameters including URI, method, parameters, and headers.
requestHeader: [array] - Default request headers that can be extended or overridden.
responseBody: [string] - Stores the response body from the last request.
responseHeader: [array] - Stores the response headers from the last request.
responseHttpCode: [int] - Stores the HTTP status code from the last request.
responseClientError: [string|null] - Stores any cURL error from the last request.
responseClientInfo: [array] - Stores cURL info from the last request.
logger: [object|null] - Optional logger instance for request/response logging.

Methods:

request: [request](string $uri, string $method = 'GET', array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false) -> string - Makes an HTTP request to the specified URI with given method, parameters and headers. Returns the response body.
getResponse: [getResponse]() -> array - Returns complete request/response information including headers, status code, body, and client info.
setCurlOptions: [setCurlOptions](array $curlOptions) -> void - Sets additional cURL options.
setLogger: [setLogger](object $logger) -> void - Sets a logger instance for request/response logging.
getResponseBody: [getResponseBody]() -> string - Returns the response body from the last request.
getResponseHeader: [getResponseHeader]() -> array - Returns the response headers from the last request.
getResponseHttpCode: [getResponseHttpCode]() -> int - Returns the HTTP status code from the last request.
getResponseClientError: [getResponseClientError]() -> string|null - Returns any cURL error from the last request.
fetchResponseHeader: [fetchResponseHeader](resource $curl, string $header) -> int - Callback function for processing response headers.
prepareRequestHeaders: [prepareRequestHeaders]() -> array - Prepares request headers in cURL format.
getResponseClientInfo: [getResponseClientInfo]() -> array - Returns cURL info from the last request.
getRequestArguments: [getRequestArguments]() -> array - Returns the arguments used for the last request.

<?php

class Curl
{
    private $curlOptions = [
        CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => true,
        CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
    ];
    private $requestArguments = [];
    private $requestHeader = [];
    private $responseBody = '';
    private $responseHeader = [];
    private $responseHttpCode = 0;
    private $responseClientError = null;
    private $responseClientInfo = [];
    private $logger = null;

    public function request(string $uri, string $method = 'GET', array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false): string
    {
        $this->requestArguments = compact('uri', 'method', 'parameters', 'headers', 'multipart');
        $curl = curl_init();

        $this->setCurlOptions([
            CURLOPT_URL => $uri,
            CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => strtoupper($method),
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $this->prepareRequestHeaders($headers),
            CURLOPT_HEADERFUNCTION => [$this, 'fetchResponseHeader'],
        ]);

        if ($method === 'POST' || $method === 'PUT' || $method === 'PATCH') {
            if ($multipart) {
                $this->curlOptions[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = $parameters;
            } else {
                $this->curlOptions[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = http_build_query($parameters);
            }
        } elseif ($method === 'GET' && !empty($parameters)) {
            $this->curlOptions[CURLOPT_URL] .= '?' . http_build_query($parameters);
        }

        curl_setopt_array($curl, $this->curlOptions);
        $this->responseBody = curl_exec($curl);
        $this->responseHttpCode = curl_getinfo($curl, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $this->responseClientError = curl_error($curl);
        $this->responseClientInfo = curl_getinfo($curl);

        if ($this->logger) {
            $this->logger->log($this->getResponse());
        }

        curl_close($curl);
        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponse(): array
    {
        return [
            'request' => $this->requestArguments,
            'response' => [
                'body' => $this->responseBody,
                'headers' => $this->responseHeader,
                'http_code' => $this->responseHttpCode,
                'client_error' => $this->responseClientError,
                'client_info' => $this->responseClientInfo,
            ],
        ];
    }

    public function setCurlOptions(array $curlOptions): void
    {
        $this->curlOptions = array_replace($this->curlOptions, $curlOptions);
    }

    public function setLogger(object $logger): void
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function getResponseBody(): string
    {
        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponseHeader(): array
    {
        return $this->responseHeader;
    }

    public function getResponseHttpCode(): int
    {
        return $this->responseHttpCode;
    }

    public function getResponseClientError(): ?string
    {
        return $this->responseClientError;
    }

    private function fetchResponseHeader($curl, string $header): int
    {
        $length = strlen($header);
        $headerParts = explode(':', $header, 2);
        if (count($headerParts) === 2) {
            $this->responseHeader[trim($headerParts[0])] = trim($headerParts[1]);
        }
        return $length;
    }

    private function prepareRequestHeaders(array $headers): array
    {
        $preparedHeaders = [];
        foreach (array_merge($this->requestHeader, $headers) as $key => $value) {
            $preparedHeaders[] = "$key: $value";
        }
        return $preparedHeaders;
    }

    public function getResponseClientInfo(): array
    {
        return $this->responseClientInfo;
    }

    public function getRequestArguments(): array
    {
        return $this->requestArguments;
    }
}

            'client_info' => $this->responseClientInfo,
        ];

    public function setCurlOptions(array $curlOptions): void

        return $this->responseClientError;
    }

    public function fetchResponseHeader($curl, string $header): int
    {
        $length = strlen($header);
        $header = explode(':', $header, 2);
        if (count($header) < 2) {
            return $length;
        }

        $this->responseHeader[trim($header[0])] = trim($header[1]);

        return $length;
    }

    private function prepareRequestHeaders(array $headers = []): array

    }

    {

    {
        $this->requestArguments = [
            'uri' => $uri,
            'method' => $method,
            'parameters' => $parameters,
            'headers' => $headers,
        ];

        $curl = curl_init();

        curl_setopt_array($curl, $this->curlOptions);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_URL, $uri);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, strtoupper($method));
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_HEADERFUNCTION, [$this, 'fetchResponseHeader']);

        if ($headers) {
            curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $this->prepareRequestHeaders($headers));
        }

        if ($method === 'POST' || $method === 'PUT' || $method === 'PATCH') {
            if ($multipart) {
                curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $parameters);
            } else {
                curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($parameters));
            }
        }

        $this->responseBody = curl_exec($curl);
        $this->responseHttpCode = curl_getinfo($curl, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $this->responseClientError = curl_error($curl);
        $this->responseClientInfo = curl_getinfo($curl);

        if ($this->logger) {
            $this->logger->log('Request', $this->requestArguments);
            $this->logger->log('Response', $this->getResponse());
        }

        curl_close($curl);

        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    }

    public function getResponseHttpCode()
    {

    }

    public function getResponseClientError()
    {

    }

    private function fetchResponseHeader($curl, $header)
    {
        $length = strlen($header);
        $headerParts = explode(':', $header, 2);
        if (count($headerParts) === 2) {
            $this->responseHeader[trim($headerParts[0])] = trim($headerParts[1]);
        }
        return $length;

    private function prepareRequestHeaders(array $headers)

class Curl
{

        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,

    ];
    private $requestArguments = [];
    private $requestHeader = [];
    private $responseBody = '';
    private $responseHeader = [];
    private $responseHttpCode = 0;
    private $responseClientError = null;
    private $responseClientInfo = [];
    private $logger = null;

    public function request(string $uri, string $method = 'GET', array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false): string
    {
        $this->requestArguments = compact('uri', 'method', 'parameters', 'headers', 'multipart');
        $curl = curl_init();

        $this->setCurlOptions([
            CURLOPT_URL => $uri,
            CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => strtoupper($method),
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $this->prepareRequestHeaders($headers),
            CURLOPT_HEADERFUNCTION => [$this, 'fetchResponseHeader'],
        ]);

        if (!empty($parameters)) {
            if ($method === 'GET') {
                $uri .= '?' . http_build_query($parameters);
                curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_URL, $uri);
            } elseif ($multipart) {
                curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $parameters);
            } else {
                curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($parameters));
                $this->requestHeader[] = 'Content-Type: application/json';
            }
        }

        curl_setopt_array($curl, $this->curlOptions);

        $this->responseBody = curl_exec($curl);
        $this->responseHttpCode = curl_getinfo($curl, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $this->responseClientError = curl_error($curl);
        $this->responseClientInfo = curl_getinfo($curl);

        if ($this->logger) {
            $this->logger->info('HTTP Request', $this->getRequestArguments());
            $this->logger->info('HTTP Response', $this->getResponse());
        }

        curl_close($curl);

        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponse(): array
    {
        return [
            'headers' => $this->responseHeader,
            'status_code' => $this->responseHttpCode,
            'body' => $this->responseBody,
            'client_info' => $this->responseClientInfo,
        ];
    }

    public function setCurlOptions(array $curlOptions): void
    {
        $this->curlOptions = $curlOptions + $this->curlOptions;
    }

    public function setLogger(object $logger): void
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function getResponseBody(): string
    {
        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponseHeader(): array
    {
        return $this->responseHeader;
    }

    public function getResponseHttpCode(): int
    {
        return $this->responseHttpCode;
    }

    public function getResponseClientError(): ?string
    {
        return $this->responseClientError;
    }

    private function fetchResponseHeader($curl, string $header): int
    {
        $length = strlen($header);
        $headerParts = explode(':', $header, 2);
        if (count($headerParts) === 2) {
            $this->responseHeader[trim($headerParts[0])] = trim($headerParts[1]);
        }
        return $length;
    }

    private function prepareRequestHeaders(array $headers = []): array
    {
        $finalHeaders = array_merge($this->requestHeader, $headers);
        $curlHeaders = [];
        foreach ($finalHeaders as $key => $value) {
            $curlHeaders[] = "$key: $value";
        }
        return $curlHeaders;
    }

    public function getResponseClientInfo(): array
    {
        return $this->responseClientInfo;
    }

    public function getRequestArguments(): array
    {
        return $this->requestArguments;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a function that performs an HTTP request using cURL in PHP, with support for proxy configuration and error handling.

Function Description: The function makes an HTTP GET request to a specified URL using PHP's cURL library. It includes configuration options for handling redirects, timeouts, SSL verification, and proxy settings. The function returns the content of the response or null if an error occurs.

Input: 
- $encUrl: string - The URL to which the HTTP request will be made
- $proxy: string|null - (Optional) Proxy server address if proxy is required
- $proxyAuth: array|null - (Optional) Associative array containing 'user' and 'pwd' keys for proxy authentication

Output: 
- string|null - Returns the response content as a string if successful, or null if an error occurs
matched_results:
<?php
function httpRequest($encUrl, $proxy = null, $proxyAuth = null) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    
    if ($ch === false) {
        return null;
    }

    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $encUrl);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);

    if ($proxy) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, $proxy);
        if ($proxyAuth && isset($proxyAuth['user']) && isset($proxyAuth['pwd'])) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXYUSERPWD, $proxyAuth['user'] . ':' . $proxyAuth['pwd']);
        }
    }

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $error = curl_errno($ch);

    curl_close($ch);

    if ($error) {
        return null;
    }

    return $response;
}
?>

Task Description: Create a PHP class that interacts with the Xiami music API to fetch details about songs, albums, or collections using cURL for HTTP requests.

Class Description: The HermitJson class provides functionality to make HTTP requests to the Xiami API and retrieve JSON responses containing music details. It handles different types of requests (song, album, or collection) through a single method.

Attributes: 
[This class has no explicitly defined attributes in the reference code]

Methods:
1: xiami_http(int $type, string $id) -> array|bool - Makes an HTTP request to the Xiami API based on the specified type and ID. Returns the decoded JSON response as an array or false on failure.
   - $type: Integer specifying request type (0 for song, 1 for album, 2 for collection)
   - $id: String containing the ID of the requested item
   - Returns: Array containing the API response data or false if the request fails
matched_results:
<?php

class HermitJson {
    public function xiami_http(int $type, string $id) {
        $url = '';
        switch ($type) {
            case 0:
                $url = "https://api.xiami.com/song/{$id}";
                break;
            case 1:
                $url = "https://api.xiami.com/album/{$id}";
                break;
            case 2:
                $url = "https://api.xiami.com/collection/{$id}";
                break;
            default:
                return false;
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, array('Content-Type: application/json'));

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        $data = json_decode($response, true);
        return $data ? $data : false;
    }
}

<?php

class HermitJson {
    
    private $apiUrl = 'https://api.xiami.com/web';

    public function xiami_http(int $type, string $id) {
        $endpoint = $this->getEndpoint($type, $id);
        if (!$endpoint) {
            return false;
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $endpoint);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
            'Content-Type: application/json',
            'User-Agent: HermitJsonClient/1.0'
        ]);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($httpCode !== 200 || !$response) {
            return false;
        }

        $data = json_decode($response, true);
        return $data ? $data : false;
    }

    private function getEndpoint(int $type, string $id) {
        switch ($type) {
            case 0:
                return "{$this->apiUrl}?v=2.0&method=xiami.song.get&id={$id}";
            case 1:
                return "{$this->apiUrl}?v=2.0&method=xiami.album.get&id={$id}";
            case 2:
                return "{$this->apiUrl}?v=2.0&method=xiami.collect.get&id={$id}";
            default:
                return false;
        }
    }
}

                $endpoint = "/album/detail/id/$id";
                break;
            case 2:
                $endpoint = "/collect/detail/id/$id";
                break;
            default:
                return false;
        }

        $url = $this->apiUrl . $endpoint;
        $response = $this->makeRequest($url);

        if ($response === false) {
            return false;

        $data = json_decode($response, true);
        return $data ? $data : false;
    }

        $ch = curl_init();

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);

        curl_close($ch);

        if ($error) {
            return false;
        }

        return $response;
    }

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP HTTP client class that handles various types of HTTP requests (GET, POST, DELETE, multipart POST) using cURL, with proper error handling and response processing.

Class Description: The Client class provides static methods to send HTTP requests and process responses. It handles request construction, cURL session management, response parsing, and error handling. The class supports standard HTTP methods and multipart form data for file uploads.

Attributes: (This class has no instance attributes as all methods are static)

Methods:

Method1: get(string $url, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a GET request to the specified URL with optional headers.

Method2: delete(string $url, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a DELETE request to the specified URL with optional headers.

Method3: post(string $url, mixed $body, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a POST request with the given body to the specified URL with optional headers.

Method4: multipartPost(string $url, array $fields, string $name, string $fileName, string $fileBody, string $mimeType = null, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a multipart/form-data POST request for file upload with additional form fields.

Method5: sendRequest(Request $request) -> Response - Internal method that executes the cURL request and returns a Response object. Handles request setup, execution, and response processing.

Method6: userAgent() -> string - Generates a User-Agent string with SDK, system, and PHP version information.

Method7: parseHeaders(string $raw) -> array - Parses raw HTTP response headers into an associative array.

Method8: escapeQuotes(string $str) -> string - Escapes quotes in a string for use in HTTP headers.

Method9: ucwordsHyphen(string $str) -> string - Properly capitalizes hyphenated header names.
matched_results:
<?php

class Client {
    
    public static function get($url, $headers = array()) {
        $request = new Request('GET', $url, null, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function delete($url, $headers = array()) {
        $request = new Request('DELETE', $url, null, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function post($url, $body, $headers = array()) {
        $request = new Request('POST', $url, $body, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function multipartPost($url, $fields, $name, $fileName, $fileBody, $mimeType = null, $headers = array()) {
        $boundary = uniqid();
        $body = '';

        foreach ($fields as $key => $value) {
            $body .= "--$boundary\r\n";
            $body .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$key\"\r\n\r\n";
            $body .= "$value\r\n";
        }

        $body .= "--$boundary\r\n";
        $body .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$name\"; filename=\"$fileName\"\r\n";
        if ($mimeType) {
            $body .= "Content-Type: $mimeType\r\n";
        }
        $body .= "\r\n$fileBody\r\n";
        $body .= "--$boundary--\r\n";

        $headers[] = "Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=$boundary";
        $request = new Request('POST', $url, $body, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    private static function sendRequest($request) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $request->getUrl());
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $request->getMethod());

        if ($request->getBody()) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $request->getBody());
        }

        $headers = array();
        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $key => $value) {
            $headers[] = self::ucwordsHyphen($key) . ': ' . self::escapeQuotes($value);
        }
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);

        $responseBody = curl_exec($ch);
        $responseInfo = curl_getinfo($ch);
        $responseError = curl_error($ch);

        curl_close($ch);

        if ($responseError) {
            throw new Exception('cURL Error: ' . $responseError);
        }

        $responseHeaders = self::parseHeaders(substr($responseBody, 0, $responseInfo['header_size']));
        $responseBody = substr($responseBody, $responseInfo['header_size']);

        return new Response($responseInfo['http_code'], $responseHeaders, $responseBody);
    }

    private static function userAgent() {
        return 'Client-SDK/1.0 (' . php_uname('s') . '; ' . php_uname('r') . '; PHP/' . PHP_VERSION . ')';
    }

    private static function parseHeaders($raw) {
        $headers = array();
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $raw);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                list($key, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
                $headers[trim($key)] = trim($value);
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    private static function escapeQuotes($str) {
        return str_replace('"', '\"', $str);
    }

    private static function ucwordsHyphen($str) {
        return implode('-', array_map('ucwords', explode('-', $str)));
    }
}

class Request {
    private $method;
    private $url;
    private $body;
    private $headers;

    public function __construct($method, $url, $body = null, $headers = array()) {
        $this->method = $method;
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->body = $body;
        $this->headers = $headers;
    }

    public function getMethod() {
        return $this->method;
    }

    public function getUrl() {
        return $this->url;
    }

    public function getBody() {
        return $this->body;
    }

    public function getHeaders() {
        return $this->headers;
    }
}

class Response {
    private $statusCode;
    private $headers;
    private $body;

    public function __construct($statusCode, $headers, $body) {
        $this->statusCode = $statusCode;
        $this->headers = $headers;
        $this->body = $body;
    }

    public function getStatusCode() {
        return $this->statusCode;
    }

    public function getHeaders() {
        return $this->headers;
    }

    public function getBody() {
        return $this->body;
    }
}

<?php

class Client
{
    public static function get(string $url, array $headers = array())
    {
        $request = self::prepareRequest($url, 'GET', null, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function delete(string $url, array $headers = array())
    {
        $request = self::prepareRequest($url, 'DELETE', null, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function post(string $url, $body, array $headers = array())
    {
        $request = self::prepareRequest($url, 'POST', $body, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function multipartPost(
        string $url,
        array $fields,
        string $name,
        string $fileName,
        string $fileBody,
        string $mimeType = null,
        array $headers = array()
    ) {
        $boundary = uniqid();
        $headers['Content-Type'] = 'multipart/form-data; boundary=' . $boundary;

        $body = '';
        foreach ($fields as $key => $value) {
            $body .= "--{$boundary}\r\n";
            $body .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"{$key}\"\r\n\r\n";
            $body .= "{$value}\r\n";
        }

        $body .= "--{$boundary}\r\n";
        $body .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"{$name}\"; filename=\"{$fileName}\"\r\n";
        $body .= "Content-Type: " . ($mimeType ?: 'application/octet-stream') . "\r\n\r\n";
        $body .= "{$fileBody}\r\n";
        $body .= "--{$boundary}--\r\n";

        $request = self::prepareRequest($url, 'POST', $body, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    private static function sendRequest(array $request)
    {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $request['url']);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $request['method']);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, self::formatHeaders($request['headers']));

        if (!empty($request['body'])) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $request['body']);
        }

        $responseBody = curl_exec($ch);
        $responseInfo = curl_getinfo($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($error) {
            throw new Exception("cURL Error: {$error}");
        }

        return [
            'status' => $responseInfo['http_code'],
            'headers' => self::parseHeaders($responseInfo['header'] ?? ''),
            'body' => $responseBody
        ];
    }

    private static function prepareRequest(string $url, string $method, $body = null, array $headers = array())
    {
        return [
            'url' => $url,
            'method' => $method,
            'body' => $body,
            'headers' => $headers
        ];
    }

    private static function formatHeaders(array $headers)
    {
        $formatted = [];
        foreach ($headers as $key => $value) {
            $formatted[] = self::ucwordsHyphen($key) . ': ' . self::escapeQuotes($value);
        }
        return $formatted;
    }

    public static function userAgent()
    {
        return 'Client-SDK/' . php_uname('s') . ' PHP/' . PHP_VERSION;
    }

    private static function parseHeaders(string $raw)
    {
        $headers = [];
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $raw);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                list($key, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
                $headers[trim($key)] = trim($value);
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    private static function escapeQuotes(string $str)
    {
        return str_replace('"', '\"', $str);
    }

    private static function ucwordsHyphen(string $str)
    {
        return implode('-', array_map('ucwords', explode('-', $str)));
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP class for interacting with the BTCPay payment gateway to create invoices and process payments.

Class Description: The BTCPay class encapsulates functionality for communicating with the BTCPay server API. It handles authentication, request formatting, and response processing for invoice creation.

Attributes:
- config: [array] - Stores configuration parameters including BTCPay server URL, store ID, and API key

Methods:
- __construct($config): [void] - Initializes the class with configuration parameters
  - $config: [array] - Configuration array containing:
    - btcpay_url: [string] - Base URL of BTCPay server
    - btcpay_storeId: [string] - Store identifier
    - btcpay_api_key: [string] - API authentication token

- pay($order): [array] - Creates a payment invoice in BTCPay
  - $order: [array] - Order details containing:
    - total_amount: [numeric] - Order amount in smallest currency unit (e.g., cents)
    - trade_no: [string] - Unique order identifier
  - Returns: [array] - Payment response containing:
    - type: [integer] - Response type identifier
    - data: [string] - Checkout URL for payment

- _curlPost($url, $params): [string] - Internal method for making HTTP POST requests
  - $url: [string] - API endpoint URL
  - $params: [string|false] - JSON-encoded request body or false for empty body
  - Returns: [string] - Raw API response
matched_results:
<?php

class BTCPay {
    private $config;

    public function __construct($config) {
        $this->config = $config;
    }

    public function pay($order) {
        $url = $this->config['btcpay_url'] . '/api/v1/stores/' . $this->config['btcpay_storeId'] . '/invoices';
        $params = json_encode([
            'amount' => $order['total_amount'] / 100,
            'currency' => 'USD',
            'metadata' => [
                'orderId' => $order['trade_no']
            ]
        ]);

        $response = $this->_curlPost($url, $params);
        $responseData = json_decode($response, true);

        return [
            'type' => 1,
            'data' => $responseData['data']['checkoutLink']
        ];
    }

    private function _curlPost($url, $params) {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $params);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
            'Content-Type: application/json',
            'Authorization: Bearer ' . $this->config['btcpay_api_key']
        ]);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        return $response;
    }
}

Function Description: The function performs an HTTP GET request to a specified URL using PHP's cURL library. It includes custom headers (including a mobile user agent), disables SSL verification for development purposes, sets a referer header, and ensures the response is returned as a string. The function handles the complete cURL lifecycle from initialization to cleanup.

Input:

Output: 
- string: The contents of the response from the HTTP request, or false if the request fails

<?php
function makeHttpRequest($url) {
    $ch = curl_init();

    $headers = [
        'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 10_3 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/602.1.50 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/10.0 Mobile/14E5239e Safari/602.1',
        'Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8',
        'Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5'
    ];

    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_REFERER, 'https://example.com');

    $response = curl_exec($ch);

    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        $response = false;
    }

    curl_close($ch);

    return $response;
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using Guzzle library, supporting various HTTP methods, request/response handling, and error logging.

Class Description: The Guzzle class is an HTTP client implementation that wraps GuzzleHttp\Client functionality. It supports GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE methods, handles different content types (including multipart/form-data and JSON), manages request/response data, and provides logging capabilities.

Attributes:
- requestArguments: [array] - Stores request parameters including URI, method, parameters, and headers
- requestHeader: [array] - Contains HTTP headers for the request
- responseBody: [string] - Stores the response body content
- responseHeader: [array] - Contains HTTP headers from the response
- responseHttpCode: [int] - HTTP status code from the response
- responseClientError: [string|null] - Stores any client error messages
- responseClientInfo: [array] - Additional client information
- logger: [object|null] - Logger instance for debugging and error logging
- client: [GuzzleHttp\Client] - Guzzle HTTP client instance

Methods:
- __construct([GuzzleHttp\Client|null] $client, [array] $config) -> [void] - Initializes the HTTP client with optional existing client instance and configuration
- request([string] $uri, [string] $method, [array] $parameters, [array] $headers, [bool] $multipart) -> [string] - Executes HTTP request and returns response body
- getResponse() -> [array] - Returns complete request/response information including headers, body, and status code
- setLogger([object] $logger) -> [void] - Sets a logger instance for debugging
- getResponseBody() -> [string] - Returns the response body content
- getResponseHeader() -> [array] - Returns response headers
- getResponseHttpCode() -> [int] - Returns HTTP status code
- getResponseClientError() -> [string|null] - Returns client error message if any
- getResponseClientInfo() -> [array] - Returns additional client information (protected)
- getRequestArguments() -> [array] - Returns request arguments (protected)
matched_results:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;

class Guzzle
{
    private $requestArguments = [];
    private $requestHeader = [];
    private $responseBody = '';
    private $responseHeader = [];
    private $responseHttpCode = 0;
    private $responseClientError = null;
    private $responseClientInfo = [];
    private $logger = null;
    private $client;

    public function __construct(Client $client = null, array $config = [])
    {
        $this->client = $client ?: new Client($config);
    }

    public function request(string $uri, string $method, array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false): string
    {
        $this->requestArguments = [
            'uri' => $uri,
            'method' => $method,
            'parameters' => $parameters,
            'headers' => $headers
        ];

        $options = ['headers' => $headers];

        if ($multipart) {
            $options['multipart'] = $parameters;
        } else {
            $options['json'] = $parameters;
        }

        try {
            $response = $this->client->request($method, $uri, $options);
            $this->responseBody = $response->getBody()->getContents();
            $this->responseHeader = $response->getHeaders();
            $this->responseHttpCode = $response->getStatusCode();
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            $this->responseClientError = $e->getMessage();
            if ($this->logger) {
                $this->logger->error($e->getMessage(), ['exception' => $e]);
            }
        }

        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponse(): array
    {
        return [
            'request' => $this->requestArguments,
            'response' => [
                'body' => $this->responseBody,
                'headers' => $this->responseHeader,
                'http_code' => $this->responseHttpCode,
                'client_error' => $this->responseClientError
            ]
        ];
    }

    public function setLogger(LoggerInterface $logger): void
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function getResponseBody(): string
    {
        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponseHeader(): array
    {
        return $this->responseHeader;
    }

    public function getResponseHttpCode(): int
    {
        return $this->responseHttpCode;
    }

    public function getResponseClientError(): ?string
    {
        return $this->responseClientError;
    }

    protected function getResponseClientInfo(): array
    {
        return $this->responseClientInfo;
    }

    protected function getRequestArguments(): array
    {
        return $this->requestArguments;
    }
}

use GuzzleHttp\Client;

class Guzzle
{
    private $requestArguments = [];
    private $requestHeader = [];
    private $responseBody = '';
    private $responseHeader = [];
    private $responseHttpCode = 0;
    private $responseClientError = null;
    private $responseClientInfo = [];
    private $logger = null;
    private $client;

    public function __construct(Client $client = null, array $config = [])
    {
        $this->client = $client ?: new Client($config);
    }

    public function request(string $uri, string $method, array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false): string
    {
        $this->requestArguments = compact('uri', 'method', 'parameters', 'headers', 'multipart');
        $this->requestHeader = $headers;

        $options = ['headers' => $headers];
        if ($multipart) {
            $options['multipart'] = $parameters;
        } else {
            $options['json'] = $parameters;
        }

        try {
            $response = $this->client->request($method, $uri, $options);
            $this->handleResponse($response);
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            $this->handleException($e);
        }

        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    private function handleResponse(ResponseInterface $response): void
    {
        $this->responseBody = $response->getBody()->getContents();
        $this->responseHeader = $response->getHeaders();
        $this->responseHttpCode = $response->getStatusCode();
        $this->responseClientInfo = [
            'protocol' => $response->getProtocolVersion(),
            'reason' => $response->getReasonPhrase()
        ];
    }

    private function handleException(RequestException $e): void
    {
        $this->responseClientError = $e->getMessage();
        if ($this->logger) {
            $this->logger->error($e->getMessage(), ['exception' => $e]);
        }
    }

    public function getResponse(): array
    {
        return [
            'request' => $this->requestArguments,
            'response' => [
                'body' => $this->responseBody,
                'headers' => $this->responseHeader,
                'http_code' => $this->responseHttpCode,
                'client_error' => $this->responseClientError,
                'client_info' => $this->responseClientInfo
            ]
        ];
    }

    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function getResponseBody(): string
    {
        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponseHeader(): array
    {
        return $this->responseHeader;
    }

    public function getResponseHttpCode(): int

        return $this->responseHttpCode;
    }

    public function getResponseClientError(): ?string

        return $this->responseClientError;
    }

    protected function getResponseClientInfo(): array
    {
        return $this->responseClientInfo;
    }

    protected function getRequestArguments(): array

        return $this->requestArguments;

}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes an HTTP request using cURL with specific configurations for timeout, headers, SSL verification, and referer settings.

Function Description: The function performs an HTTP GET request to a specified URL using PHP's cURL library. It includes custom configurations such as a user agent string, disabled SSL verification, a referer header, and a connection timeout. The function returns the raw response content from the requested URL.

Input: 
- $url (string): The target URL to which the HTTP request will be made.

Output: 
- string: The raw content returned from the HTTP request. Returns false if the request fails.
matched_results:
<?php
function fetchUrlContent($url) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/58.0.3029.110 Safari/537.3');
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_REFERER, 'https://www.example.com');
    
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        curl_close($ch);
        return false;
    }
    
    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement functions to verify transactions from different payment gateways (NowPayments, NextPay, and ZarinPal) using their respective APIs.

Function Description: The functions will interact with payment gateway APIs to verify transaction details and return the verification results.

Input: 
- verify_nowpayment_transaction: 
  - $paymentKeys (array): Contains API keys for different payment gateways
  - $hash_id (string): Unique transaction identifier from NowPayments

- verify_nextpay_transaction:
  - $paymentKeys (array): Contains API keys for different payment gateways
  - $amount (numeric): Transaction amount to verify
  - $payid (string): Transaction ID from NextPay

- verify_zarinpal_transaction:
  - $paymentKeys (array): Contains API keys for different payment gateways
  - $Authority (string): Transaction authority code from ZarinPal
  - $amount (numeric): Transaction amount to verify

Output:
- All functions return the decoded API response from the respective payment gateway, typically containing transaction verification details and status.
- Return type is object/mixed (decoded JSON response for NowPayments/NextPay, SOAP response object for ZarinPal)
matched_results:
<?php

function verify_nowpayment_transaction($paymentKeys, $hash_id) {
    $apiKey = $paymentKeys['nowpayments'];
    $url = "https://api.nowpayments.io/v1/payment/$hash_id";

    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
        "x-api-key: $apiKey"
    ]);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);

    return json_decode($response);
}

function verify_nextpay_transaction($paymentKeys, $amount, $payid) {
    $apiKey = $paymentKeys['nextpay'];
    $url = "https://api.nextpay.ir/verify";
    $data = [
        'api_key' => $apiKey,
        'amount' => $amount,
        'trans_id' => $payid
    ];

    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
        'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
    ]);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);

    return json_decode($response);
}

function verify_zarinpal_transaction($paymentKeys, $Authority, $amount) {
    $merchantID = $paymentKeys['zarinpal'];
    $client = new SoapClient('https://www.zarinpal.com/pg/services/WebGate/wsdl', ['encoding' => 'UTF-8']);

    $params = [
        'MerchantID' => $merchantID,
        'Authority' => $Authority,
        'Amount' => $amount
    ];

    $result = $client->PaymentVerification($params);

    return $result;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class for interacting with the GoDaddy DNS API to manage domain records, including retrieving domains, getting DNS records, and creating/updating records.

Class Description: The GodaddyDns class provides methods to interact with GoDaddy's DNS API. It handles authentication, domain parsing, and various DNS record operations through HTTP requests using cURL.

Attributes:
- accessKeyId: [string] - The API access key ID for GoDaddy authentication
- accessSecrec: [string] - The API secret key for GoDaddy authentication
- DomainName: [string] - The domain name being managed
- Host: [string] - The host portion of the domain (default empty)
- Path: [string] - The path portion of the domain (default empty)

Methods:
- __construct([string]$accessKeyId, [string]$accessSecrec, [string]$domain = "") -> [void] - Initializes the class with API credentials and optional domain name
- getDomain([string]$domain) -> [array] - Static method that parses a domain into its components (self domain, second-level domain)
- curl([string]$url, [array]$header = '', [string]$data = '', [string]$method = 'get') -> [array] - Private method that handles cURL requests and returns response
- getDomains() -> [array] - Retrieves all domains associated with the account
- GetDNSRecord([string]$domain, [string]$record, [string]$recordType = 'TXT') -> [array] - Gets a specific DNS record for a domain
- UpdateDNSRecord([string]$domain, [string]$name, [string]$value, [string]$recordType = 'TXT') -> [array] - Updates an existing DNS record
- CreateDNSRecord([string]$domain, [string]$name, [string]$value, [string]$recordType = 'TXT') -> [array] - Creates a new DNS record

<?php

class GodaddyDns {
    private $accessKeyId;
    private $accessSecrec;
    private $domainName;
    private $host = '';
    private $path = '';

    public function __construct($accessKeyId, $accessSecrec, $domain = "") {
        $this->accessKeyId = $accessKeyId;
        $this->accessSecrec = $accessSecrec;
        $this->domainName = $domain;
    }

    public static function getDomain($domain) {
        $parts = explode('.', $domain);
        $selfDomain = array_shift($parts);
        $secondLevelDomain = implode('.', $parts);
        return ['selfDomain' => $selfDomain, 'secondLevelDomain' => $secondLevelDomain];
    }

    private function curl($url, $header = [], $data = '', $method = 'get') {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, strtoupper($method));
        if (!empty($header)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $header);
        }
        if (!empty($data)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
        }
        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return json_decode($result, true);
    }

    public function getDomains() {
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains";
        $header = [
            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        return $this->curl($url, $header);
    }

    public function GetDNSRecord($domain, $record, $recordType = 'TXT') {
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains/{$domain}/records/{$recordType}/{$record}";
        $header = [
            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        return $this->curl($url, $header);
    }

    public function UpdateDNSRecord($domain, $name, $value, $recordType = 'TXT') {
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains/{$domain}/records/{$recordType}/{$name}";
        $header = [
            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        $data = json_encode([['data' => $value]]);
        return $this->curl($url, $header, $data, 'put');
    }

    public function CreateDNSRecord($domain, $name, $value, $recordType = 'TXT') {
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains/{$domain}/records";
        $header = [
            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        $data = json_encode([['type' => $recordType, 'name' => $name, 'data' => $value]]);
        return $this->curl($url, $header, $data, 'post');
    }
}

class GodaddyDns {

    private $path;

        $this->accessKeyId = $accessKeyId;
        $this->accessSecrec = $accessSecrec;
        $this->domainName = $domain;
        $this->host = "";
        $this->path = "";
    }

    public static function getDomain($domain) {
        $parts = explode('.', $domain);
        $selfDomain = array_shift($parts);
        $secondLevelDomain = implode('.', $parts);
        return ['selfDomain' => $selfDomain, 'secondLevelDomain' => $secondLevelDomain];
    }

    private function curl($url, $header = [], $data = '', $method = 'GET') {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, strtoupper($method));
        if (!empty($data)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
        }
        if (!empty($header)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $header);
        }
        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            return ['error' => curl_error($ch)];
        }
        curl_close($ch);
        return json_decode($result, true);
    }

    public function getDomains() {
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains";
        $header = [
            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        return $this->curl($url, $header);
    }

    public function GetDNSRecord($domain, $record, $recordType = 'TXT') {
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains/{$domain}/records/{$recordType}/{$record}";

            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",

            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        $data = json_encode([['data' => $value]]);
        return $this->curl($url, $header, $data, 'PUT');
    }

    public function CreateDNSRecord($domain, $name, $value, $recordType = 'TXT') {

            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, "DELETE");

            'Authorization: sso-key ' . $this->accessKeyId . ':' . $this->accessSecrec,

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return json_decode($result, true);
    }

        return $this->curl($url);

            'name' => $name,
            'data' => $value,

    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles file downloads using cURL with proper error handling and resource management.

Class Description: The CurlDownloader class provides functionality to download files from a given URL using PHP's cURL library. It manages temporary file creation, download execution, and cleanup of resources. The class includes methods to set a custom temporary directory, perform the download, retrieve the downloaded filename, and clean up downloaded files.

Attributes:
- tempDir: ?string - Optional custom directory for storing temporary files. If not set, uses system temp directory.
- outputFile: ?string - Path to the downloaded file. Null until download is completed.

Methods:
- setTempDir(string $tempDir) -> void - Sets a custom temporary directory for storing downloaded files.
- download(string $url) -> bool - Downloads a file from the specified URL. Returns true on success, throws ErrorException on failure.
- getFilename() -> string - Returns the path to the downloaded file. Throws RuntimeException if called before download().
- cleanup() -> void - Removes the downloaded file if it exists.

<?php

class CurlDownloader {
    private ?string $tempDir = null;
    private ?string $outputFile = null;

    public function setTempDir(string $tempDir): void {
        if (!is_dir($tempDir) || !is_writable($tempDir)) {
            throw new InvalidArgumentException("The provided directory is not writable or does not exist.");
        }
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir;
    }

    public function download(string $url): bool {
        $tempDir = $this->tempDir ?? sys_get_temp_dir();
        $this->outputFile = tempnam($tempDir, 'curl_download_');

        $ch = curl_init($url);
        if ($ch === false) {
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to initialize cURL session.");
        }

        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'wb');
        if ($fp === false) {
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to open temporary file for writing.");
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FAILONERROR, true);

        $success = curl_exec($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        fclose($fp);

        if ($success === false) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            $this->outputFile = null;
            throw new ErrorException("cURL error: $error");
        }

        return true;
    }

    public function getFilename(): string {
        if ($this->outputFile === null) {
            throw new RuntimeException("No file has been downloaded yet.");
        }
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    public function cleanup(): void {
        if ($this->outputFile !== null && file_exists($this->outputFile)) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            $this->outputFile = null;
        }
    }
}

    {
        if (!is_dir($tempDir) || !is_writable($tempDir)) {
            throw new InvalidArgumentException("The specified directory is not writable.");
        }
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir;
    }

    public function download(string $url): bool
    {
        $tempDir = $this->tempDir ?? sys_get_temp_dir();
        $this->outputFile = tempnam($tempDir, 'curl_');

        $ch = curl_init($url);
        if ($ch === false) {
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to initialize cURL session.");
        }

        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'w');
        if ($fp === false) {
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to open temporary file for writing.");
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FAILONERROR, true);

        $success = curl_exec($ch);
        if ($success === false) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            fclose($fp);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException("cURL error: $error");
        }

        fclose($fp);
        curl_close($ch);

        return true;
    }

    public function getFilename(): string
    {
        if ($this->outputFile === null) {
            throw new RuntimeException("No file has been downloaded yet.");
        }
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    public function cleanup(): void
    {
        if ($this->outputFile !== null && file_exists($this->outputFile)) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            $this->outputFile = null;
        }
    }
}

class CurlDownloader
{

    private ?string $outputFile = null;

    public function setTempDir(string $tempDir): void
    {
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir;
    }

    public function download(string $url): bool
    {
        $tempDir = $this->tempDir ?? sys_get_temp_dir();
        $this->outputFile = tempnam($tempDir, 'curl_download_');

        $ch = curl_init($url);
        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'wb');

        if ($ch === false || $fp === false) {
            throw new ErrorException('Failed to initialize cURL or open file.');
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FAILONERROR, true);

        $success = curl_exec($ch);

        if ($success === false) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            fclose($fp);
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            throw new ErrorException('cURL error: ' . $error);
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        fclose($fp);

        return true;
    }

    public function getFilename(): string
    {

            throw new RuntimeException('No file has been downloaded yet.');
        }
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    }

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements OAuth 1.0 authentication for interacting with the Twitter API, handling both GET and POST requests with proper parameter encoding and signature generation.

Class Description: TwitterAPIExchange is a PHP class that provides a convenient way to interact with Twitter's API using OAuth 1.0 authentication. It handles the construction of OAuth signatures, request headers, and performs HTTP requests using cURL.

Attributes:
- oauth_access_token: string - Twitter OAuth access token
- oauth_access_token_secret: string - Twitter OAuth access token secret
- consumer_key: string - Twitter API consumer key
- consumer_secret: string - Twitter API consumer secret
- postfields: array - Data to be sent in POST requests
- getfield: string - Query string for GET requests
- oauth: array - OAuth parameters for request signing
- url: string - API endpoint URL

Methods:
- __construct(array $settings) -> void - Constructor that validates and sets OAuth credentials
- setPostfields(array $array) -> self - Sets POST data and returns instance for method chaining
- setGetfield(string $string) -> self - Sets GET query string and returns instance for method chaining
- getGetfield() -> string|null - Returns current GET query string
- getPostfields() -> array|null - Returns current POST data
- buildOauth(string $url, string $requestMethod) -> self - Builds OAuth signature and parameters
- performRequest(bool $return = true) -> string|void - Executes the API request and returns response
- buildBaseString(string $baseURI, string $method, array $params) -> string - Private method to build base string for signature
- buildAuthorizationHeader(array $oauth) -> string - Private method to build OAuth header

<?php

class TwitterAPIExchange
{
    private $oauth_access_token;
    private $oauth_access_token_secret;
    private $consumer_key;
    private $consumer_secret;
    private $postfields;
    private $getfield;
    private $oauth;
    private $url;

    public function __construct(array $settings)
    {
        if (!isset($settings['oauth_access_token'])
            || !isset($settings['oauth_access_token_secret'])
            || !isset($settings['consumer_key'])
            || !isset($settings['consumer_secret'])) {
            throw new Exception('Invalid settings provided');
        }

        $this->oauth_access_token = $settings['oauth_access_token'];
        $this->oauth_access_token_secret = $settings['oauth_access_token_secret'];
        $this->consumer_key = $settings['consumer_key'];
        $this->consumer_secret = $settings['consumer_secret'];
    }

    public function setPostfields(array $array)
    {
        if (!is_null($this->getGetfield())) {
            throw new Exception('You can only choose get or post fields.');
        }

        $this->postfields = $array;
        return $this;
    }

    public function setGetfield($string)
    {
        if (!is_null($this->getPostfields())) {
            throw new Exception('You can only choose get or post fields.');
        }

        $this->getfield = $string;
        return $this;
    }

    public function getGetfield()
    {
        return $this->getfield;
    }

    public function getPostfields()
    {
        return $this->postfields;
    }

    public function buildOauth($url, $requestMethod)
    {
        $this->url = $url;

        $oauth = [
            'oauth_consumer_key' => $this->consumer_key,
            'oauth_nonce' => time(),
            'oauth_signature_method' => 'HMAC-SHA1',
            'oauth_token' => $this->oauth_access_token,
            'oauth_timestamp' => time(),
            'oauth_version' => '1.0'
        ];

        $getfield = $this->getGetfield();
        if (!is_null($getfield)) {
            $getfields = str_replace('?', '', explode('&', $getfield));
            foreach ($getfields as $g) {
                $split = explode('=', $g);
                $oauth[$split[0]] = $split[1];
            }
        }

        $postfields = $this->getPostfields();
        if (!is_null($postfields)) {
            foreach ($postfields as $key => $value) {
                $oauth[$key] = $value;
            }
        }

        $base_info = $this->buildBaseString($url, $requestMethod, $oauth);
        $composite_key = rawurlencode($this->consumer_secret) . '&' . rawurlencode($this->oauth_access_token_secret);
        $oauth_signature = base64_encode(hash_hmac('sha1', $base_info, $composite_key, true));
        $oauth['oauth_signature'] = $oauth_signature;

        $this->oauth = $oauth;
        return $this;
    }

    public function performRequest($return = true)
    {
        if (!is_bool($return)) {
            throw new Exception('performRequest parameter must be true or false');
        }

        $header = [$this->buildAuthorizationHeader($this->oauth), 'Expect:'];
        $getfield = $this->getGetfield();
        $postfields = $this->getPostfields();

        $options = [
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $header,
            CURLOPT_HEADER => false,
            CURLOPT_URL => $this->url,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => false
        ];

        if (!is_null($postfields)) {
            $options[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = http_build_query($postfields);
        } else {
            if ($getfield !== '') {
                $options[CURLOPT_URL] .= $getfield;
            }
        }

        $feed = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($feed, $options);
        $json = curl_exec($feed);
        curl_close($feed);

        if ($return) {
            return $json;
        }
    }

    private function buildBaseString($baseURI, $method, $params)
    {
        $r = [];
        ksort($params);
        foreach ($params as $key => $value) {
            $r[] = "$key=" . rawurlencode($value);
        }
        return $method . "&" . rawurlencode($baseURI) . '&' . rawurlencode(implode('&', $r));
    }

    private function buildAuthorizationHeader($oauth)
    {
        $r = 'Authorization: OAuth ';
        $values = [];
        foreach ($oauth as $key => $value) {
            if (in_array($key, ['oauth_consumer_key', 'oauth_nonce', 'oauth_signature', 'oauth_signature_method', 'oauth_timestamp', 'oauth_token', 'oauth_version'])) {
                $values[] = "$key=\"" . rawurlencode($value) . "\"";
            }
        }
        $r .= implode(', ', $values);
        return $r;
    }
}

        return $this;

    {
        return $this->getfield;
    }

    public function getPostfields()
    {
        return $this->postfields;
    }

    public function buildOauth($url, $requestMethod)
    {
        $this->url = $url;
        $oauth = array(
            'oauth_consumer_key' => $this->consumer_key,
            'oauth_nonce' => time(),
            'oauth_signature_method' => 'HMAC-SHA1',
            'oauth_token' => $this->oauth_access_token,
            'oauth_timestamp' => time(),
            'oauth_version' => '1.0'
        );

        $base_info = $this->buildBaseString($url, $requestMethod, $oauth);
        $composite_key = rawurlencode($this->consumer_secret) . '&' . rawurlencode($this->oauth_access_token_secret);
        $oauth_signature = base64_encode(hash_hmac('sha1', $base_info, $composite_key, true));
        $oauth['oauth_signature'] = $oauth_signature;
        $this->oauth = $oauth;

        return $this;
    }

    public function performRequest($return = true)
    {
        if (!isset($this->url)) {
            throw new Exception('No URL set');
        }

        $header = array($this->buildAuthorizationHeader($this->oauth), 'Expect:');
        $options = array(
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $header,
            CURLOPT_HEADER => false,
            CURLOPT_URL => $this->url,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => false
        );

    {

        foreach ($oauth as $key => $value) {

        return $r;

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes an HTTP request to the OpenAI API using cURL, handles the response, and manages potential errors.

Function Description: The function `make_curl_request` initializes a cURL session to interact with the OpenAI API. It sets necessary headers including authentication, configures cURL options for the request, and implements a callback function to handle the response stream. The function processes both successful responses and errors, setting appropriate cookies for error conditions and returning the response data.

Input:
- `$postData` (string) - The JSON-encoded data to be sent in the POST request body.
- `$OPENAI_API_KEY` (string) - The API key for authenticating with the OpenAI API.

Output:
- `$responsedata` (string) - The raw response data from the API, which could be either a successful response or an error message. The function also sets cookies for error conditions when they occur.
matched_results:
<?php
function make_curl_request($postData, $OPENAI_API_KEY) {
    $url = "https://api.openai.com/v1/your-endpoint"; // Replace with the actual endpoint

    $ch = curl_init($url);

    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
        'Content-Type: application/json',
        'Authorization: Bearer ' . $OPENAI_API_KEY
    ]);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        $error_msg = curl_error($ch);
        setcookie("api_error", $error_msg, time() + 3600, "/");
        curl_close($ch);
        return "cURL Error: " . $error_msg;
    }

    if ($httpCode >= 400) {
        setcookie("api_error", $response, time() + 3600, "/");
        curl_close($ch);
        return "HTTP Error: " . $response;
    }

    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}
?>

<?php
function make_curl_request($postData, $OPENAI_API_KEY) {
    $url = "https://api.openai.com/v1/your-endpoint";
    $headers = [
        "Content-Type: application/json",
        "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY"
    ];

    $ch = curl_init($url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        $error_msg = curl_error($ch);
        setcookie("api_error", $error_msg, time() + 3600, "/");
        $response = json_encode(["error" => $error_msg]);
    } elseif ($httpCode >= 400) {
        setcookie("api_error", $response, time() + 3600, "/");
    }

    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}

    $ch = curl_init($url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        $error_msg = curl_error($ch);
        setcookie("api_error", $error_msg, time() + 3600, "/");
        $response = json_encode(["error" => $error_msg]);
    } elseif ($httpCode >= 400) {
        $error_msg = "HTTP Error: $httpCode";
        setcookie("api_error", $error_msg, time() + 3600, "/");
        $response = json_encode(["error" => $error_msg]);
    }

    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes HTTP requests to the Heroku API using cURL, with support for various HTTP methods, custom headers, and error handling.

Function Description: The function `HerokuAPI` is designed to interact with the Heroku API by sending HTTP requests. It supports multiple HTTP methods (including PATCH and POST for sending data), sets appropriate headers including authorization, and handles the response. The function includes timeout settings and SSL verification options for secure communication.

Input:
- $method: [string] - The HTTP method to use (e.g., 'GET', 'POST', 'PATCH', etc.)
- $url: [string] - The URL to which the request will be sent
- $data: [string] - Optional. The payload to send with the request (typically for POST/PATCH methods)
- $apikey: [string] - The Heroku API key used for authorization

Output:
- Returns an associative array with two keys:
  - 'body': [string] - The response body from the API
  - 'stat': [int] - The HTTP status code of the response
matched_results:
<?php
function HerokuAPI($method, $url, $data = null, $apikey) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    
    $headers = [
        'Content-Type: application/json',
        'Accept: application/vnd.heroku+json; version=3',
        'Authorization: Bearer ' . $apikey
    ];
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
    
    switch (strtoupper($method)) {
        case 'POST':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
        case 'PATCH':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'PATCH');
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
        case 'DELETE':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'DELETE');
            break;
        case 'PUT':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'PUT');
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
        default:
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
    }
    
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $httpcode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        $error_msg = curl_error($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return ['body' => $error_msg, 'stat' => $httpcode];
    }
    
    curl_close($ch);
    return ['body' => $response, 'stat' => $httpcode];
}
?>

function HerokuAPI($method, $url, $data = null, $apikey) {

    $headers = [
        'Content-Type: application/json',
        'Accept: application/vnd.heroku+json; version=3',
        'Authorization: Bearer ' . $apikey
    ];
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
    
    switch (strtoupper($method)) {
        case 'POST':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
        case 'PATCH':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'PATCH');
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
        case 'PUT':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'PUT');
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
        case 'DELETE':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'DELETE');
            break;
        default:
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);
            break;
    }
    
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        $error_msg = curl_error($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return ['body' => $error_msg, 'stat' => $httpCode];
    }
    
    curl_close($ch);
    
    return ['body' => $response, 'stat' => $httpCode];
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement an OAuth2 client class in PHP that handles HTTP requests for OAuth2 authentication flows, including obtaining authorization codes and access tokens.

Class Description: This abstract class provides a base implementation for OAuth2 client functionality. It includes methods for making HTTP requests and stores OAuth2 configuration parameters. Concrete implementations should extend this class for specific OAuth2 providers.

Attributes:
- version: [string] - OAuth version being used (default: '2.0')
- appKey: [string] - Application/client ID for OAuth2
- appSecret: [string] - Application/client secret for OAuth2
- responseType: [string] - OAuth2 response type (default: 'code')
- grantType: [string] - OAuth2 grant type (default: 'authorization_code')
- callback: [string] - Callback URL for OAuth2 flow
- authorize: [string] - Authorization endpoint URL
- getRequestCodeURL: [string] - URL to request authorization code
- getAccessTokenURL: [string] - URL to exchange code for access token
- apiBase: [string] - Base URL for API endpoints
- token: [mixed] - Stores the access token (null by default)

Methods:
- http: [http](string $url, array $params, string $method = 'GET', array $header = [], bool $multi = false) -> string - Makes an HTTP request using cURL with the specified parameters. Handles both GET and POST methods, with support for multipart POST requests. Returns the response body or throws an exception on error.
